text: The food is delicious. I went there with my family today and ordered the paneer chili and chili chicken as appetizers. What can i say the appetizers was absolutely amazing. Try ordering it at a level 6-7 spicy and it will burn your mouth. Loved the Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Jalfrezi. They also have a check-in deal for yelp for a free lassi or soda. Last but not least one of my favorites was Gajar Halwa, it was nice and warm, and absolutely amazing. The prices are reasonable and cheap compared to other Indian Restaraunts around vegas. Chicken dishes are at $14 versus other restaraunts that have them for $18. They also have huge buffet for only $9.99. The most selections for the lowest prices. Now thats what i called a indian Buffet. I would deffinetly come back here again.

my husband and I came here after the sales associate at the pandora store at the forum recommended it. 

for apps we had bhel puri, chili chicken and chicken momos. the bhel puri was nice and spicy. the tamarind chutney is as good as homemade. the chili chicken is a huge portion and could double as an entrée. the momos were tasty also.

we then shared a non-veg thali and everything was divine. the best part was that the tabdoori chicken appetizer that comes with the thali wasn't hot pink in color (and it shouldn't be people just FYI) it was nicely BBQ'd and spiced beautifully. loved it! 

finally, a true test for me, was the chai. perfection! I really enjoyed thai place and will definitely be back. 

well done!

Great food, great service. Make sure to get garlic Naan. I'll definitely go back for some more. I sample a little bit of everything, but my favorite was goat curry by far. Plus you can't beat the price around $10.00 dollars for their lunch buffet .!

Food was GREAT!!!! 

I only docked 2 stars since service was pretty much non-existent. We went in on a Friday afternoon for the lunch buffet, it was a slow day I suppose, there were probably only 6 other patrons eating there. After you are seated and given your drink and naan, you are pretty pretty much on your own until its time to pay. If you ever want a drink or naan refill during the rest of your meal, you'll have to get up and go look for your server in the backroom/kitchen. I had to do this twice. Its like they don't care about your refills if its a slow day and instead just go hang out in the backroom.

AVOID!

Visiting from Texas and had an extremely bad experience two days in a row.  First day we order food and waited for 45 mins without a single dish on the table.  Since we were in no position to go anywhere else and just wanted to eat indian food, we asked it to be packed and get to-go and were told we will have our food shortly.  After waiting for nearly an hour, we proceeded to walk out at which point the food was being brought to us.  After taking the food back to the hotel, we noticed there were several items missing.  

Experience on Day 2 was similar with order placed for to-go and waiting for 40 minutes.  During our wait, we noticed two families walking out in a similar manner as we had on a previous day and also observed some patrons without menu and water for a long period of time.  Once again, we received the food after 45 minutes and took it back to the hotel.  AND THE ORDER WAS WRONG AGAIN!  

Food quality was just above par, it wasn't anything special.  Just slightly better than the popular indian place off the strip.

Overall, I will not be visiting this restaurant again.

I've been looking for a really excellent Indian restaurant in Vegas for a while now, and this totally exceeded my expectations. This was my first time here, and they gave me complimentary rice with my (some type of curry? Alas, I forgot) dish. My significant other ordered a lamb-curry dealio and couldn't rave enough about it. This was his first time trying Indian food ever, so this was a pretty epic moment. There is a plethora of vegetarian options, of course, and the naan tasted uber hot and fresh and is friggin' delightful. 10/10 would Delhi again
Excellent food! We had a class reunion and ordered food for 18 guys. Everyone love it. Good service.

Delicious. My mom wanted Indian food, and she couldn't stop raving about how everything tasted. The Lassi deal for checking in was pretty sweet too. It sucks that it's off the main tourist hub, which means you'll need a cab to get there, but it was definitely worth it.
Great butter chicken and curry goat.  And the roti is addictive and fresh you have to ask for it. I will definitely be taking my guest their brunch is from 11 to 3. Great price.
First time food here love chicken Briyani love service and food thanks I will be back for sure thanks you guys for the wonderful food

Excellent lunch buffet. Chicken biriyani, garlic naan, and chicken makhani are what I would recommend. Everything is good though. Cheap and reasonable price, can't go wrong with that. I hope this place gets more business.
Anyone looking for delicious food with friendly attentive staff, this is your place. Had the tikka masala, naan and lychee lassi. Yum!!

Made reservations on this yelp page- yet wasn't allowed to come in because they were only " open to CES" people... Ruined my companion bday dinner 

Dude at the door was rude as hell

This review is from ordering off their menu, not the buffet.

I came here at night and ordered chicken masala and samosa. The chicken masala was over cooked and dry. No flavor at all. The appetizer that they delivered at first was the wrong order and burnt on top of it. The samosa was okay, but again the seasoning was poor and there were 2 big ones for 5 dollars, which is pricey for the quantity. 

It took me awhile to get the food, and I had to get the waiters attention just to place the order. They weren't that busy, so it was disappointing. The place looks nice. The food tasted like buffet quality, and I have had better buffet food to be honest. My bill came to around 20 dollars.

Its the best Indian Restaurant that I came across in Vegas.They were ready to make jain dishes for us and all tasted so delicious that we went twice there. I must say that the ambience was pretty good as well and the place was neat and tidy. The willingness to cater to the customers' need is what blew my mind. I am gonna come here every time I visit Vegas. Will definitely recommend to all my friends:)

Delhi indian cuisine is by far the best indian buffet i have had and i have tried at least 4 of them. There is enough variety and more importantly the taste is good to great for most part.

The malai kebab and the goat curry wrre excellent and so were the naans. The only thing i could complain about if i wanted to nitpick was the raita and panjabi kadhi being too sour for my taste.

If you are in vegas, dont miss this buffet.

So far as I have experienced, the best Indian buffet in LV.  The staff is nice without being overbearing, and very attentive.  The food is always excellent.  I also like the fact that there is always a different item on the buffet which is veggie.

I had dinner buffet. Their portion are about average. The food is OK, but nothing special. Its not too greasy, but the palak paneer isn't creamy. Malai kofta is OK. Their dal is OK. Their naan is average. Kind of surprised place has 4.5 stars. I would go here, but wouldn't go out of the way to go here.
Great buffet! Delicious food and amazing service :) The lunch buffet has a lot of great options especially if you don't eat meat!

Yum, yum,yum!!  Great selection of food.  Chilli chicken, naan bread, and all the others I don't remember the names but equally yummy.  Restaurant was very clean and the service was great.  Will definitely return.

Wow..... i am still drooling over the delicious indian food... must must try the chicken biryani  and the mango lassi... the place is comfortably seated but the food is to die for... oh and have the samosas   owner was very nice wanted to make sure my fam and friends enjoyed the food... yes we did and will always stop here on our every trip to vegas....

If you don't make it to the lunch buffet, Everything  on the menu is á la cart, we assumed that our order would have came with rice or naan when ordering, but the waitress was quick corrected us. Her mood seemed to change quickly when we were not interested in the drink menu she provided. While waiting for our food we noticed a dead silence due to the fact that there was no music playing. A few moments pass by and a gentleman with a really upbeat attitude came over and delivered a little snack while we waited for our food.
When the food arrived , it looked amazing! The flavors were perfect along with the spice level that I had picked. I ordered the chicken tikka masala with rice and garlic naan. One garlic naan and white rice can be split between two people but the chicken tikka masala could not. 
The restaurant has a promotion going on that says " free dessert when you check in on Yelp" my fiancé told our waitress that we checked in and she said we would also have to write a review. She stayed with our table to watch my fiancé write the review and she then gave us a choice between rice pudding or a pastry.
The pastry tasted like a pancake with liquid sugar. It was really good.
OVER ALL, the restaurant could use background music, and maybe a little better costumer service, but the food was perfect for the most part. For $45 I paid for 2 white rice, 2 garlic naan, and 2 chicken tikka masala. It was worth it but in the future I now know that the naan and rice and be shared.

This place did not have any waiting and I had a flight to catch which made me choose this over the other Indian places around.
The food is simple and tasty, the quantity is more than sufficient. I loved the yellow dal and raita.
The service is courteous and fast (may be because there were few people eating, not sure how it would be during the rush hours).
Overall, a thumbs up!
Very good buffet, at least twenty items to choose from, haven't eaten dinner there yet. Very friendly staff.

Good buffet with many items. All appetizers are good. chilli chicken is the killer. I will go again just for that. Biryani is not actual biryani. Dont go for it. Curries need some additional indian flavors. Overall the buffet is worth the money

Fantastic is the word... Have been in the States for the last six months and I can bet that this the best buffet lunch I've had. Absolutely authentic Indian.. Pls enjoy yr Indian cuisine here like my wife n I did.. Keep it going!
Not too far from vegas strip. The lunch special is a great deal! Best food I ate while in vegas! Get the chicken tikka masala over white rice!! So good :) also very nice staff.
Excellent buffet. Large selection (including plenty of vegetarian). The restaurant is big and quite popular with both Indians and non-Indians alike. Everyone needs to try this!
Spacious restaurant with many food selections. Halal/zabiha meat. Tasty chicken curry. The owner was friendly.

Let's start with the basics: holy smokes this was delicious!

Food: 

Ordered Chicken Tikka Masala (medium), Steamed Rice, Garlic Naan, Tandoori Chicken and Lentil soup.
Everything was cooked perfectly. Chicken was tender and juicy and seasoned to perfection. Tikka Masala was was right-on spicy, chicken was tender and juicy, spices were robust. Absolutely great. Lentil soup reminded me that Indian cooking has the mastery and history of spice selection. Wow.

Delivered:

We had delivery at an usual location..an RV park. Not wanting to unhook our rig we decided to risk the possibility that they may change their mind upon reading my instructions. When the driver showed up he was super friendly!! 

The food was piping hot, and was like it had just been brought out of the kitchen. Did you catch the detail that it was delivered?!? It wasn't soggy, droopy, dry, over cooked or any of the other ills that befall delivered food. Oh and they delivered 30 minutes prior to estimated time  - bonus!!

Overall: amazing. So good. Fresh, cooked perfectly, a salute to the best in class.
Great Indian cuisine.  Resurant is lovely and clean.  Staff are very good and friendly. Went for the lunch  time buffet and was grea. , Service good, prices good we would diffinately  recommend.

Fantastic as always. I decided to mostly eat the vegetarian dishes today. Saag paneer, chana masala, yellow dal. Mmmmm mmmm mmmm. It was fantastic. The veggie Palau rice was also incredible. My favorite buffet appetizer are the samosas and the bread as usual was fluffy and delicious. Today I tried their Chai Masala and was very impressed. Not overly sweet, but just enough sweetness to compliment the tea. Thanks Delhi!!!
The worse Indian food I have ever eaten and what made it worse was the attitude of the guy "Krishna" on the phone. Very poor quality food and very unprofessional people.

Came here with my husband and we both loved it! The best Indian food I've had in years! Everything that interested me was tasty and also for my husband. I would highly recommend the buffet which is what we had! Great service, great food!

Worst experience ever!  They make you pay extra for rice, what kind of joke is that... I have never been to an Indian place that doesn't serve basmati rice with almost every dish.  For the prices, the portions are terrible. The chickpea roti was burnt.  Delivery was over 40 minutes later than what I was told. I get it's an estimate, but when your food shows up barely warm, what the heck. I knew I should have just went and picked it up because then I could have known I wasn't going to get rice either. Don't waste your money here!

The food is excellent. The service, one of the best I have seen at any Indian Restaurant's.

Their Biryani is very tasty, the pa Kora s - perfectly sprinkled with tiny salty spices and the mood music was superlative too. Love this place.

Food is pretty decent, prices are reasonable, and Harry (the manager) takes care of customers very nicely. Halal. Lunch buffet is $12 and has a wonderful selection. Restaurant is nice decor, clean, great service.

I'm speechless. I live in northern California we have lots of  Indian restaurants here but, nothing came close to this restaurant as far as the food quality and the tastes. Great customer service and beyond. Can't wait to come back and try the food again. And It was so good that I went 3 time during my stay in Vegas.
Awesome and affordable food, good service and family friendly . What else u need? I will come again to try other entrees . They have 9.99 buffet with endless choices .
Lunch buffet had cold food and very less options. Bland food. Only good was fresh lime soda.

Awesome!  Awesome! My fiancé and I eat a lot of Indian food back home (Queens, NY) and I'll say this food is better than most we've eaten in NY. Sooo much flavor. Sooo many chooses for the buffet lunch. We visit Vegas often and were getting tired of eating like tourists and have decided to eat where the locals go. Everyone here is friendly and smiling. Very nice people. This is a family owned restaurant and we spoke with owner for a few minutes. Our water was always topped off and with so many food choices we practically rolled out of the place. We will definitely eat here every time we're in town.

We were on a 4 day trip to Vegas and took a taxi here for the lunch buffet. IT WAS AMAZING!!! Highly recommend you do the same. The strip is so expensive that you will pay less all around by coming off of it to this place for lunch even with the taxi. My husband is the pickiest eater out there and he says it was better than his favorite Indian place at home! The mango lassi was also the best I have had. Good job guys!

Worst food that u will ever experience. Cold food, breads were uncooked. Long waiting time.

I am actually shocked to see this restro have a rating this high.

Decided to give this a place a try during "Dinner
Service".

As we entered we quickly noticed the emptiness. 

1st Started with an Appetizer, "Chicken Pakora" ($6) for drinks we ordered the Mango Lassi (1 free via Yelp check-in) Very delicious!  it's like biting into a very ripe mango!

My Wife ordered the "Authentic Chicken Curry"  ($14), I had the "Prawn Xacuti" ($21)......

The problem with this place is that they use the same "Base Sauce", the Sauce used for the Prawn Xacuti and Chicken Curry dishes tasted the same!, only difference was color and spice level , that's it!

Initially I was going to try the Non-Vegetarian Delhi Thali but was told by waiter that the Chef "did not time for that" so I chose the "Prawn Xacuti" . 

The portions regardless of dish/price are the same. 

Once our food arrived we really couldn't eat peacefully as the waiting staff were constantly asking if the food was OK, like every few minutes, I avoided making eye contact after the 2nd time, I just wanted to eat the freaking food! this place was a total disappointment guess the Wife and I should of just done the Buffet, but No Thanks, you only get to disappoint us once! We will never return!

I would Rate this restaurant top notch..
Awesome food, great service, beautiful interiors with an awesome pic of Himalayas. Not far away from strip. They even added rice when we packed the leftovers.
I forgot o take pic if anyone can post that to me.

****STAY OUT OF THIS PLACE****
Pathetic food. The breads were totally unbaked and the food served was cold.  Extremely long wait times for serving a couple of thali.

Customer service is pretty bad and doesn't bother about your concern.

Overall please don't go by the misleading 4.5+ reviews

This place was the only vegan friendly restaurant open, so my girlfriend and I stopped by for a bite. Food was delicious, but we ended up getting too much. We had snacked on the way into Vegas so our original order of palak aloo and garlic roti would've been enough. However, our waiter convinced us portions were smaller so we added something else to our order. The food was incredibly spicy so we didn't even eat much of the added dish.

I went to the this place for lunch with my wife and my son . When I went there , I was really surprised with the decoration inside . And the buffet wow, it's the largest Indian buffet in Las Vegas so far ,, so many varieties in the buffet , they have the largest selection of vegetarian and non- veg items , and the price wow, ,, just under $10 . Waiter and servers are so friendly and polite ,, great customer service ,, I am really glad conning here ,, highly recommended ,, Great service !!! Great Food , definitely going back soon .
Great Food!!! You won't be disappointed. My favorites are the chicken Biryani and Chicken Curry. Love the flavor and spice. Great atmosphere and ambience. I will definitely come back for more.

I really enjoyed myself here. The atmosphere was nice, the food was delicious, and the waiter did a great job. The chicken Biryani was delicious ! Can't wait to come back and try something else on the menu.

First of all this restaurant is not far from the strip. So it is perfect for visitors of Las Vegas. I been there about 3 times and always during the lunch buffet hours. It is so good. The restaurant it self is big and spacious with plenty of parking. Service is excellent and the staff are very friendly. The food is just so good. There are plenty of items on the buffet. And the food quality has always been just perfect. The "naan" aka Indian bread is always baked freshly when ordered. One of my favorite items on the buffet is the Goat Curry. It's just so delicious. If you are looking for a good Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, I highly recommend this place.

I went there a few days ago with a friend. I tried some of their vegetables and they were average. The lady said it's halal but i highly doubt it since alot of people disagreed. Other then that the staff was friendly

I gave this place at three their naan-bread is not that greatat all I gave it to three overall because of the look of the restaurant. Service was okay and I realize why there was only three people inside. I will admit that there Teeka masala was awesome

Excellent lunch buffet. They had a good spread for vegetarians as well. The owner was nice and came by the table many times to check on us. Much better than other Indian fares on the strip -- similar taste but much better price and service.

I would give zero stars if I could. After waiting 45 mins for a simple 2 entree order, the food served was cold and the daal was watered down. Rotis were cold without butter as requested. Would not recommend!!!
If you want to eat good Indian food this is the place. Chicken curry and daal is very nice, service is amazing, nice place to have North Indian food

Took over an hour to get 2 Cold entrees and Half cooked Naans for dinner (not buffet). With regards to taste, its average. Samosas were bland. Dal Makhani was OK and Paneer Tikka Masala is nice. Garlic naan was awful. Portions size is below average.
I'd give it a miss and try something else next time.

Excellent food! Warm people and patient service.
The entire family loved their custom flavored and spiced menu.
Any days choice!! Go and meet Krishna. He loves people coming to this place and serving them with lot of affection.

This is a go to restaurant for my family every time we visit Vegas.  The lunch buffet is great and they have North Indian, info Chinese, and South Indian dish also. I like there gulab jamun, chowmein, tandoori chicken, chili chicken, dal makhani, and naan alot
2 thumbs up!! Lots of clearly labeled veggie options.  Excellent never-ending garlic naan with the buffet.  Large selection, great service and very clean.

The buffet is only $9.99 and the food is great.  I have been to many of the other buffets in town and this is probably the best.  
Add in the free drink with check in and u can't beat it.  This is my go-to place for indian food.

I eat a lot of Indian food in Sweden, where I live, but this was better than most of it.

My choice was the Vegetarian Thal and it was excellent. costed only a bit more than a sandwich and a coffee at Starbucks on the Strip, earlier that day. :)

Its very tasty and there are lot of items to eat during buffet. Enjoyed idli and sambar, chicken and goat curries and dessert a lot. Naans were very soft too.
This surpassed my expectations :)

We went there for dinner. 
We were surprised to see lot of empty tables around 9:00/9:30 PM.
But the food was good. The Mango Lassi was no good. 
If you want to try Indian food after a long day in Vegas, This is a good Restaurant you can visit. 
The service was really good.
Excellent food .. Excellent staff and service  .. I'd like to come back again .. You have to try butter chicken

First time trying Indian food. Didn't know what to eat so we figured AYCE is a safe way to go to try everything. 

All the food was delicious!!!   Be aware, some were spicier than I could handle. But the yummy mango lassi hit the spot. 

Manager/owner was very nice and helpful. Prices are great.  Going to go back for dinner and try more items. 

Only reason why they didn't get five stars was the service from the wait staff. The manager came to the table more than the young girl that was supposed to be the waitress.   Only one other table was eating besides us and she walked past our dirty plates and we had to flag her down to get drink refills. 

Other than that. This will be our spot to go for curry and naan.

Very good food, the garlic naan bread is quite nice.
Butter chicken always is my favorate.
My family loved the food.. My kids had the greatest time ever.. We had a wonderful time and the food was amazing ... Thank you Hary for everything .. Amy

My husband and I came here for dinner our first night in Vegas.  Our dinner was so delicious that we decided to come back again the next night! This was the best Indian food we have had compared to places in San Francisco and Sacramento, CA. It has delicious food, great service and good prices. The restaurant is also nice and clean.
The Tandoori Chicken was fresh and sizzling when it came to our table. The meat was tender and falling off the bones! We also had the Lamb Curry, Chicken Curry, and Chicken Tikka Masala. All of the curries were amazing with just the right amount of spices. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be coming back here when we visit Vegas!

My order was delivered 1 hr late. The food was very bad. Yellow dal fry came with a beetle floating in it. I ordered Chicken madras and they sent me Chicken karahi. I guess thats the only thing they had at the time. Chicken karahi looked and tasted pathetic. I have never had such a bad experience with food delivery before. Dont try this place.
Pretty decent food and you can trust their quality. I would say this is a good Indian food close to strip in Vegas.

The food was seasoned right and I asked for mild and that's what I got. Lol. There wasn't a lot of people there when we arrived around 6:30 pm for dinner. It was little pricey, but portions was adequate. We were advised to come in for the buffet and order the same items for a lower price. The manager is nice and kind of a flirt or maybe he was pulling my leg. Lol. The staff was attentive and friendly.  We left a nice tip. We will be going back.
We had come in from Los Angeles and we were so happy to find such an authentic Indian restaurant with food that excites your taste buds. Thank you for the wonderful sweets! :)

We visited the restaurant for an afternoon buffet and found that the appetizers options were adequate but the entree and dessert options were less and also did not look to be fresh considering that we were there around 1 PM and not at 3 PM which is what the restaurant serves buffet until.

Amazing Indian food. Hari was very accommodating. We kept it simple with chicken Vindaloo and the traditional chicken curry, but both were incredible. The paneer kulcha was the perfect vehicle to deliver these tasty morsels to our bellies. Check this place out if you are in the Las Vegas area and LOVE Indian cuisine. Highly recommended. Cheers! 

I am ridiculously full.
Great Buffet.  Love the variety. Had a good selection of meat and bread.  Will go there again.
Excellent lunch buffet. They offer both meat and vegetarian options for the buffet. Large dinning area with plenty of space.
So very delicious! Get off the strip and get some real flavor here! Sam, the uber driver - you gotta try this place!
I loved their lunch buffet! Lots of vegetarian options as well as options for meat eaters

OMG. Both the food, and service was excellent. Very kind Gentleman named Hari defined various dishes for us, and went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. The Chicken Tikki Masala was so very tasty, along with garlic naan bread. Very clean place!!!!!!! Thanks Hari, you rock!!!!!

Great food, great prices, great service. Everything about this place is great. Got the palak aloo, lamb korma, and garlic naan. Washed it all down with a tasty strawberry lassi. Highly recommend to any lovers of Indian cuisine. Goung to come back and try the buffet soon.
tasty spicy veg biriyani and authentic chiken currry . both the items were delicious. satisfied with the taste. THE INDIAN TASTE in Vegas.Do visit

I am a picky eater when it comes to Indian food and I have been disappointed by the quality of some of the Indian food I have eaten over various major cities in the US. But this restaurant has one of the best Indian buffets in the US (from those I have been to). It is cheap, has a big capacity for seating, and a good variety of starters, vegetables, meat, and rice dishes. The goat meat dishes are excellent cause the meat is soft and tender (as compared to chewy meat with lot of bones in some other places). Chicken biryani is standard and not too spicy. I loved their samosas as well. I have heard that they have good lassi, though I haven't tasted it yet. This places is usually full of Indian tourists over weekend, so you may need to come a bit early (between 11 am-noon).

Okay so I just don't get the hype. I was really excited - I mean Indian, buffet, good reviews, sounds like a recipe for success. It was okay... and cheaper than other places at $9.99. But I think I would pay the extra few dollars and go a block over to Mint in a heart beat. Yes the buffet takes up length wise over half the restaurant, but what I didn't care for about this place was that it lacked variety - you have the standard Tandoori chicken, Tikka Masala etc.  But maybe it was a busy day before I got there giving them the benefit of the doubt, but I had to fish around in the sauce to find pieces of chicken and not only in the tikki masala but any dish which contained sauce and meat. Don't get me wrong I love sauce, but I like to find that there is ample meat to accompany my sauce. 

Also, there was something about the ambience that felt cold - maybe it was the poor acoustics which made it feel very big and open but not in a good way or the just the set up but somehow the dining room was not overly inviting. Although, that in itself is not something that would normally concern me - hey if the food is superb I'll eat it sitting on a street corner (as used to be the case with Viva Las Arapas before they moved). Nonetheless, I thought it is something that should be noted. 

Service was average, nothing outstanding. We did request garlic naan and they brought it. My friend asked for lemon wedges for water, they forgot, had to ask again and then they brought a plate of lime wedges from the salad bar.. maybe they don't have lemons? 

On the upside I got a free Mango Lassi which was tasty with Yelp check in - so thank you Delhi Indian Cuisine for that treat. So overall I wish them good luck and I hope that they make it as I do with all restaurants that are not chains but unfortunately I am going to stay loyal to Mint for lunch buffet, and Mt. Everest as a second choice.

Normally I am skeptical of Indian restaurant ratings because I come from Indian background and I am a good cook. My husband and I were craving Indian and we absolutely loved this place. The quality and variety of foods in the lunch buffet is amazing! LOVED the Tandoori chicken with garlic chili naan and chicken makhani! And Gulabjamuns (dessert) were soft and absolutely delicious! Food was hot not cold as it is normal in buffets sometimes. Definitely the place to go if you are craving Indian food!

We came to this restaurant with our friends thrice during our 3 days stay in Vegas. The buffet was amazingly awesome. Everything was freshly made and had lots of varieties both north and south Indian cuisines. Do try the golgappas here, I must say it was yummy.. We had thali in our dinner..u can only finish the thali, if your hunger level is 5 out of 5. Restaurant is well maintained. I recommend it to everyone atleast to try once.

Amazing food and fresh buffet. Indian style nan was very fresh with different types, 
Would love to go again and again.

Can't give minus stars, so starting with one star.  This is my first review ever and thought it might be helpful for anybody walking in with family and small hungry kids.  Service was so poor that one of the starters (chicken soup) was delivered after 35 min and the other starter (Pani Puri) after 40 min. Not to mention that the Pani puri shells were stale and smelled/tasted bad.  Food was delivered after one hour and don't even want to discuss how it was.  One of the servers realized and offered us gulab jamun, appreciate that, but fact is fact and if you are hungry and with impatient kids, please look somewhere else.

This place has opened two months ago and hence doesn't appear on google maps. But dont let that get into your way for this awesome north indian treat. I like the owner n staff who are very polite and attentive to their customers. The food is of high quality and is priced reasonably. My pick would be the traditional style chicken curry and would recommend it to everyone.

Excellent food- incredible flavor and very delicious. The service was very attentive, and everyone I encountered was super nice. The garlic naan was great and nothing I ate was a disappointment. The lunch buffet was just a little more expensive than comparable places, but I think a couple extra bucks is well worth the great food, wide variety, nice ambiance, and excellent service. Will definitely be back.

Real exceptional service... Attentive and kind and the food was phenom!  Big fan of super spicy food and they did it right :). palaak paneer was perfect and great portions too.  Will be back :). Thanks!

Goat curry was amazing, great blend of spices . Enough quantity of meat too.
Service was pleasant and courteous.
Masala papad was also good. Place has modern decor and comfortable seating.

Very creepy servers ,always looking on what are we eating.horrible taste and not delicious.
Will not recommend for desi people anytime.

Curry was good. Lachha Paratha was not even close to what it is supposed to be...  Paneer Paratha had raw paneer (no masala, etc).... And in a delivery order to Hotel there were no disposable plastic ware or napkins.  One star deduction for each issue:-(
Amazing food and good service. We had goat Biryani and it was excellent! The vegetarian was very good as well. Whenever I come back to Vegas, will definitely come back and eat here!

owned by a nepali, but serves authentic indian food. The service was slow even though we were the only ones in the restaurant on a Fri night. The location is a bit far from the strip, but worth the trip.

I love Indian food and I've been to several Indian restaurants on and off the strip so I was very delighted when my friend told me of Delhi's Indian buffet. I'm usually a little disappointed with the small portions at the Indian restaurants so I thought the buffet would be a good change. 

I was very very pleased with my experience. The selection was great and the food tasted very good. I haven't had vegetable pakoras that tasted as good as the ones they serve here. I tried goat curry for the first time and was impressed. The chicken tandoori and chicken biryani were just as delicious. I also tried these dough balls in syrup called Gulab Jamun and although the texture was a little weird at first the flavor was exceptional. The server suggested I try it with the rice pudding and it tasted even better!

 I have nothing but positive things to say about this place. The service was prompt and friendly and you cannot beat the price of $9.99! My bf said we're not going anywhere else for Indian food. We have definitely found a gem!
By far one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! We eat here frequently, never disappointed, great service!
One of the good Indian cuisine restaurants in Vegas. Their buffet is my favorite!

Enjoyed a delicious dinner here. Can't wait to come again and enjoy the lunch buffet. Chicken tikka was fabulous as was the chicken kadhai. Okra masala was delicious.   I suggest you give the kashmiri naan a try.  It was to die for.

I've constantly been disappointed with Indian food in the US, but this place is awesome! I ate way too much, but it was just so good that I couldn't stop. I would definitely go back if we weren't leaving Vegas tomorrow morning.
Good ambience and good food. The owner was very nice and so was the staff we reached there at 10:30 and they did not rush us at over all a good place to eat Indian food

This is only my second Indian buffet I've tried, so maybe you want to take that into consideration. But I'd come back again. A great deal for only $11/person. They had butter chicken and goat curry, which were both good and not tough or overly dry. The veggie/salad section was small but fresh. Chana masala and potatoes/cauliflower mixture were good. (Unfortunately for me) they had more of a vegetarian selection than meat selection. But all in all, a decent variety to suit any palate or diet. One plate was enough for me as I find Indian food to be extremely filling, even in small quantities.

A few minor complaints were that the naan was thin in some parts, but very doughy towards the middle. And had to remind one of the workers about my drink order. But worth it to come back again.
Food was authentic Indian. Liked much  the goat and chicken curry n naan. Can't forget the taste really yummy
My first  time  here...I missed  the lunch buffet  which  starts  at 11-3pm but I  will surely come back. The service  was awesome!  The food was really  good...

Best indian food at lasvegas as of I know.. saffron is next to this one.. earlier I was thinking li mm e saffron is best but after trying here I changed my best option to here.. lot of varities and good food at las vegas

Great place great food !!! Amazing mango lassie
Must check out ... Best out of 2 buffet that i been to
Owner super nice guy , great garlic nan

Truly some of the best Indian my wife and I have ever had and there were some great Indian places in Phoenix where we lived previously. 

As others have stated, the Naan is pretty much the best I've tasted in Las Vegas. The lunch buffet is very good with a wide, fresh selection. I also order take out a couple times a month to bring home to the wife and kid for dinner. 

Every staff member there is beyond nice and super attentive to boot! Highly recommended.
Terrible. We did not receive appetizer or drink for 1 hour. Don't go by overall reviews. Poor management. No communication.
Really good Indian food in Vegas. Chicken biriyani was excellent and garlic naan is a must try!!

I went there at lunchtime on a weekday so it was empty. The ambiance is okay, nothing really special. The lunch buffet is about $13 per person and you have a decent selection. The food I would say is below average. Chicken was a over cooked and dry and the curries tasted like they were a day or two old. The Naan was doughy and tasted a little undercooked. The waiting staff could also benefit from more training.

Very bad chicken fried rice ... had no spring onions ... just plain rice and chicken nothing else ... very disappointed with the food. After seeing those many reviews I don't think it's worth that many reviews

I could have given this a better rating - but I went here for a lunch buffet and they had 5 entrees in the non-veg section which I cannot venture into.
It was Christmas and we were on our way to the airport. So we picked this restaurant for lunch. I went by the star rating in my Google search.

The idly was soft and sambar tasted pretty good. I heard lot of people talk about the Gulab Jamuns here. So I made sure I checked them out. Again they were very soft. But a bit sweet even for me. The veg curries were good and the nan was ok. And I should not forget the starters. They were good.

Extremely slow service. There were 5 people who were supposed to take orders but were wandering aimlessly, just passing a  stare and moving to the next table

We had ordered Naan and biryani Once the food arrived, it was extremely spicy even though the order was supposed to be moderate spicy. To top this experience, when we shared this feedback to the restaurant guy, his answer to eat naan with a bit of curd. Must be kidding right?

Very pricey, extremely slow service Not worth it..
The Lamb Briyani took us by surprise, it was super delicious!!!
Food was very tasty.Excellent customer service.clean and pleasant.I will recommend this restaurant to my friends.....

I came here for dinner because I am traveling solo for business and they offer a thali (a kind of combo plate), which is great because I enjoy variety. It was wonderful. The tandoori chicken appetizer (2 pieces, almost a meal in itself) was amazing and the assortment of dishes was just right. If you like Indian you must try this place.

We have placed few orders, the way of packing is not good the entire food got leacked into the packing bag and we have informed to them, the restaurant staff members are very bad in the way of receiving the customer calls were not so improper and the way of talking to the customer is not good, we asked them to refund my money they didn't do that and they haven't replaced my order, fuck the restaurant

We had a very good time here, the service was excellent. Our waiter (Krishna) took really good care of us.  They have a great variety of vegetarian as well as non veg.  If you are into non veg I would highly recommend the tandoori chicken, it was juicy and spicy and very well cooked.  The Navratan kurma was wonderful and the shaai paneer was great.  The kulfi is homemade so definitely try that,  it was great.

The best Indian food we've ever had! Thank you Yelp for helping us find this place.  Everything was SO delicious. Some of my favorites were:

- Palak paneer (spinach/cheese) had the perfect amount of spiciness, so delish!

- Tandoori chicken was so juicy and smokey, not dry like other places. 

- The goat meat in the goat curry was so tender and flavorful. 

Can't wait to come back next Vegas trip.

Delicious briyani, highly recommend 
Waiter is very friendly and quality is good 
Food is not pricey compared with other food in Vegas
Diamond in the rough. Fantastic food and exceptional service. We had dinner tonight and we will go back tomorrow for lunch:-) Thank you for the wonderful experience.
Decent Indian buffet. Liked their biryani....so far the best biryani in town. ......kebabs are also a plus for the buffet....even vegetarians have huge choice ....would definitely recommend

I will preface this by saying that the food is amazing. I ordered the butter chicken, rice, and garlic naan; they were delicious. But I think this place is overpriced. The butter chicken was $15 and all I got were a few pieces of a chicken thigh floating around in sauce. I mean, $15???? And it didn't even come with rice. Had to order that separately. 

Again, the food is good. But there are tons of other equally delicious Indian restaurants that don't overcharge.

I've just recently gotten into Indian food so I can't really compare it to more than 3 other places but man this place is so good. People are super nice and veg and non-vegetarian is all amazing. Highly recommended!

We went to eat at this restaurant today. It was my Husband Birthday and after reading the good reviews, we decided to go to this place. 
What a disappointment!, the food was cold, the taste nothing to impress, the waiter was rude, bossy and impatience with us. 
I do not recommend it.
Pathetic service..!!! Waste of time.. please don't visit...we r waiting for food last more than 1 n half hour ..
Hands down, the best Indian food in Las Vegas.  The buffet is incredible and economical.  Plus a free drink when you check in on Yelp!

The paneer pakora appetizer is really yummy! They give fair portions for the price. Something else that I love about this is that they don't skimp on paneer! I ordered the shahi panner and it had good flavor, more vegetable than I'm used to but still good.

As an Indian lunch buffet veteran in Seattle/ NYC/ Chicago, I was very impressed with the variety and quality of dishes offered for the price. The goat curry was a standout, as well as, the gajar halwah dessert, drizzled with some rice pudding, as a sauce.

I would definitely return with friends on my next visit to Las Vegas.
Food was average during dinner time. Soup was very spicy even after reminding the staff twice.
Really good food and nice environment. Manager was friendly. Naan was fresh made. A good Indian Buffet at Las Vegas.

Wow couldn't believe how tasty this place was came here for dinner. A hidden gem! If you enjoy spice with lots of flavor this is the place.This would have been a five star but the server was to eager to remove our plates. It could be because it wasn't so busy and it's off the strip. Everything we order was amazing!!!

Chicken Fried rice was bad. 
Jeera rice is like it came out of ghee pot. 

White rice n goat curry were good. 
Ambiance is great
Great meal. Nice people great tradition Indian cuisine. Garlic Naan was perfect. Curry Goat and the sizzling platter was just what was needed. If ur in the mood for Indian food this is the place.

What a great spot for AYCE Indian buffet for brunch on the weekend! You get a lot of different varieties here to suits your craving.  The service I received from the staff are always friendly and top notch that I don't hesitate to leave them a fat tip afterward.  

Please keep up the excellent work and I will continue to show my support in the future!

You have 4.5 star rating in Yelp. I am sure it is influenced by the ala carte because most of the starters in buffet today were like warm, tight. A bit stale. 
You have a good customer base. Please strive to be great every day. 

Will hit the main course now with expectations !

Sometimes we don't act like tourists when we are tourists but like to go where the locals go.  This buffet for lunch was a great deal, and it must really be, because it was full of indians eating there , except for us.  I loved the tandoori chicken which was moist inside and spicy outside.  The garlic naan was delivered to our table piping hot, so I used it to soak up my curry sauce on the curry chicken and the sauce on a remarkable goat  meat dish. They had steamed white rice and biryani, take your choice.  I wish my stomach was bigger. I'm going back again next Vegas trip, also note: clean bathroom and lots of parking.
Best food and service. Best taste in Las Vegas veg korma, paneer kadahi, dal everything was tasting. Staff and restaurant very clean.
Came here for the breakfast, they have one of the best buffet in Vegas. Many choices in Buffet and delicious food.

It's my second time eating India food,  it's very good a different level of spicy then I'm use to but I was still able to enjoy the flavors of the food. I really enjoyed the  okra dish and their chicken rice dish. I will recommended and eat there again.
No complaints. All love and appreciation for delicious food and awesome service. I'll be back for sure!
The best Indian I've ever had in the states. Im from uk and Indian is a big dish so it takes a lot for me to say this. Highly recommend.

This place was so horrible!!  I love Indian food and had it bookmarked for a while.  I was excited to suggest hitting it up to 2 of my good friends for dinner end of business day. 

I arrived first and it was empty and cavernous.  I ordered a cocktail while waiting for my friends.  15 minutes went by and my first friend arrived and still no cocktail. I was the only one there!  It was forever before she finally brought my drink and when she did it was the wrong cocktail. I explained it was a goose and side of fresh lemon juice the first time. She brought out a goose and a fresh lemonade.  When I told her it was wrong she totally copped an attitude with me, then went back to the bar only to make another wrong cocktail which was goose and a lemon soda!   When I told her she got it wrong yet again she told me she's never had somebody in there like me and she started yelling in her native language to another of her associates... and clearly it was about me lol  

Then someone came out of the kitchen, we believe it was an owner, and started accusing her of stealing keys.  It turned into an all out screaming match in the middle of the restaurant.  I mean take it outside!  The cooks even came out of the kitchen to get ring side seats, eagerly awaiting the blood shed.   Our friend finally arrived in the midst of the insanity. It was like an episode of cops was unfolding before our very eyes.  We exited the establishment post haste.  

Unfortunately we never tried the food but the ambience or lack there of leads me to want to leave a negative star rating, but I have to give it a one to post.  Needless to say it's erased from my bookmarks forever!  I was ashamed it was my suggestion in the first place. My friends definitely applauded me for the stellar recommendation lol

The ambiance of this place is nice. It appears to be clean, linen napkins and glass tables. I had chicken tiki masala. The flavor was good but the chicken was over cooked. I did not like that rice does not come with meal. You have to purchase it separately. I may return. As I will be going back to Vegas next week. I did inform the waitress that the chicken was over cooked.

I love this place! Naan is always delicious. Their lentil soup is hands down my favorite. Their dishes are tasty! I always get the American special -- chicken tiki masala. But I've tasted a few other dishes and I wasn't disappointed. Their service was quick and friendly, which is hard to come by! It's my go to Indian restaurant in Vegas.
It has Delicious and cheap food! The only problem is it seems it is a business family. So in the rush hour time, you won't get good service.

This is a famed restaurant in Las Vegas, 
Went for buffet yesterday with family. Extremely disappointed. Food was OK at best. Tandoori chicken was cold and dry, It got finished and was not replenished for 30 mins. Till then we were done.
They serve bread (naan) fresh on the table. Great. We were 4 adults. Gave us 2 naans, one garlic and one plain. We didn't know the type till we were done with the top garlic one. We asked for another garlic naan and our unfriendly waitress refused till we finished all the naans. As is in dictatorship you have to follow what the Govt says so here we have to obey with the instructions. When done, we asked for Garlic naan and for a change she smiled and left to get replenishment. We waited for as long as we could reminding her but with little success. Finally after a long wait we got the naan (1 piece) only to discover that it was not properly cooked and raw dough was coming in our mouth. Called the waitress and she quickly took our naan away never to be seen again. At that point we were disappointed and done. Paid our bill and left the place vowing to never return. 
My wife paid the bill as me and kids were freaking out because of poor quality of management and lack of food. She complained to the manager who had following reasons. Got too many people, staff ran away, 3 weeks ago there was rain in Las Vegas that they are recovering from etc.. However we had to pay full price for the food while they all messed up.
Our waitress was very unprofessional and would run away when before we could finish asking her a question. I had once asked her to listen patiently. She was rude or may be helpless. Did not understand hospitality and maybe had no experience. I think if she was polite my review would not be so negative.
As I see we paid full price for below average meal and horrible service. Will not go there again.

Overall definitely in the top 10% of the Indian restaurants I have eaten at across the country over last 15+ years. Chilli Chicken was really good and non-veg thali was alright. Service was great. I will go here again.

It was just OK. Ive definitely had better Indian food before (not in Vegas but back home in the UK).

Lets just say, I wont be ordering from here again lol. I ordered a Lamb curry/biriyani

Excellent Food with Authentic Taste and flavorful...Service was also fantastic. Mango Lassi is an absolute must have in this restaurant and one of the best that I have had ever. I had the Vegetarian Thali and every item was great..
The best Indian restaurant in Vegas. They had idli and sambar which was the best. Chicken biryani and samosa was good too. It was spacious and the waiters were also courteous.
Food is really good and very nice waitress...Restaurant is very spacious  and try Lassi...Sambar is very tasty.

The best service I've ever received at a restaurant. And delicious food! Please go! 

We came for a late dinner, stayed past closing, and received freshly made, free desserts. Not to mention outstanding service throughout. 

Each dish was absolutely excellent, and SO FRESH. Our friend ordered the tandoori chicken and loved it. It had few spices, came out on a sizzling hot plate; great for anyone scared of eating Indian. 

Recommend the chick pea bread, rice pudding, and carrot desserts.

Couldn't say anything better. (Thank you!)

Long wait times and we realized server missed orders requested after an hour. Requires repeated follow ups for the orders placed. Waste of time and a horrible experience knowing food was not prepared after an hour wait. If you are lucky to get the food served it's not any better too
Delicious fresh food! Best Indian food in Vegas. Place is very clean. Customer service is prompt and friendly. I was not expecting the food to be this good. I highly recommend this place!!

Great service! Good food! The reason I am giving four stars is because it did take a long time for the food to come out. Granted we were warned ahead of time, so at least we prepared ourselves for the long wait.
This is my favorite indian buffet in town. Their food is tasty and they are reasonably priced.  Manger also came and asked if we need something else, keep it up guys.
This was the best restaurant I had food at since long time. Each and everything in buffet was amazing .. Highly recommend here !!
Nothing fancy, but they did bring out warm fresh cooked food. They tried to sell us the buffet. Asked us several times, until we firmly said no.
Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Clean environment, attentive staff, GREAT FOOD

Great food, great service, Krishna came to our table and got our review.  They were willing to accommodate our specific food requests. Food to table took some time but art cannot be rushed.  Compliments to the chef.
They do take American Express, but will try to talk you into using another card.  The food was decent, but I am rating them low due to how they scammed me into using a Visa card.
Great indian buffet!!!! Will definitely be going back when in Vegas!!! Lots of choices to choose from. Don't know the name but the carrot dessert was delicious!!!!! Best I've had!

I went for dinner with my family. Food was just ok. Vegetables were not properly cooked. Service was really bad. The guy named 'Hari' was very rude. He doesn't know how to talk to a customer. Overall very disappointing. I don't know how this place got 4 stars. Really bad place for food...

text.text:
Delhi Indian Cuisine has been on my radar for quite some time. I've seen the high reviews and wanted to check this place out. I'm so glad that I did because the food here rocks! (my socks).

The lunch buffet starts at 11:00am and goes until 3:00pm. It is one of the better priced Indian buffets in town at 9.99. I came in and ordered the lunch buffet. The dining room is very clean and spacious. There is a large buffet area which is loaded with tons of food.

The yelp check in offer was for either a soda or one of their house made lassi's, basically, a yogurt smoothie. They have a sweet one, a salty one, and a mango one. I ordered the mango. It was SOOO good. The flavor was very mango-ey and it was silky smooth and had a nice mouthfeel from the yogurt.

As for the food, I would recommend anything! I especially liked their chicken, all of their versions of them were super tender. The goat stew was especially tasty as well. It wasn't too gamey and the sauce on it was fabulous! There wasn't anything on the menu that I didn't like.

One thing that I thought was kinda weak was their garlic naan. I found the taste to be a little bit bland. And for their noodle, milk dessert was a little bit too sweet.

Service was also kinda questionable. They seemed to start out pretty slow with taking our orders and getting our drinks, and after our first round of dishes they didn't clear our plates fast enough so that we were stacking our plates on top of each other. But, they were quicker at bussing our table during the middle of our dining experience.

Would I come back? Oh, you know it, because I loves me some Indian food. And the food here is delicious, fresh, and tasty. And try the mango lassi, it's really good.

The BEST place to get your masala fix! The place to be whether you want an extensive vegan Indian spread or if you are a carnivore at heart. The lunch buffet spread is impressive. For only $10.99 you have transported your palate to India aboard the royal elephants with the cool Maharajas of Rajasthan.  The staff are attentive ... make that very attentive and friendly. Pleasant ambiance, glass goblets, paper lined white tablecloths and linen napkins.  The food speaks for its self. The flavors are so pure, complex and divine. You can taste the unique blends of masala spices like cardamom, turmeric, fennel are noticeable. From the Dals, Curries, Pulaou, Tandooris to the Koftas, Paneer, Tikkas and Kormas - the food is awesome. Plus the condiment section is amazing: lime chutney, tamarind sauce, chili peppers, corriander chutney, Raita etc are just nice touches to make your experience unforgettable. Fresh Naan brought to your table bubbly, crusty and pipping hot! I love this place. I drove 17miles to get here and it was worth it. Give this place a try.

So delicious! Was excited when I remembered we had left overs the next day. Loved how well the menu labeled vegan and veggie. Definitely my new go to Indian place. Only had delivery so far - will try dining in sometime soon.
Brought my friend here for her birthday and we both loved it! Definitely coming back.

My family and I are Indian food aficionados, and we adore this restaurant. The food is very Northern Indian (so people who like India Masala or more Southern-style restaurants may not go as crazy for Delhi as we do), and the flavors are everything we love about Indian food with a few subtle, delicious differences. Certainly not the standard Indian buffet. Highly recommend.

I have been here many times.  Food good and fresh with many different options.  My wife enjoys the goat curry  and I enjoy the vegetarian part of the buffet.  The nan bread is kept on the buffet and replaced often.   Nice touch is having water pitcher on the table.  I always judge a ethnic cuisine as good if persons of that ethnicity are eating there.  The only reason not 5 star ordered some papadum and never received it ( no big deal)
This place has an amazing lunch buffet. All of the food tastes amazing and they keep it stocked.

Went for  the lunch buffet, great traditional food it was so good. Lot's of different choices, everything I tried was amazing. Service was great very as well. I will be going back the next tme I am in town.

Solid lunch buffet for $11/person- clean and organized display with all item labeled, naan available by request with garlic, and free mango lassi with Yelp check-in.

Cucumber, onion, and tamarind-sauce salad is refreshing and delicious.
Goat curry is meaty with good heat to it, tandoori chicken, curry chicken, chili chicken, and biryani rice all available. Vegetarian options included samosas, pekora, chana masala, dal, and squash, along with saag paneer.
The salad section also has a phenomenal mint sauce that goes deliciously with absolutely everything- I'd buy this stuff to go if I could (I didn't ask).
Finished up with the gulab jamun, my favorite dessert of milk-cheese balls soaked in honey sauce.

I liked that the variety of the buffet was fairly diverse with a lot of lighter and vegetarian options, allowing me to sample a little of everything without totally pigging out.
Service was polite and soft-spoken, we were asked repeatedly if we liked our food, which was appreciated.

Having moved here from the Bay area, with about 234920349 times more Indian restaurant options to pick from, I simply wish I didn't have to cross town to find this cuisine.

This place got great reviews so I figured I would try it. Well, not going back. 2 stars for the way it looked. The food all had the same spice level. The rice, both of them were really dry. The buffet is in one location that makes for poor circulation of people. Crowded, a lot of screaming children. Thanks but no thanks.
Wish I could give you 10 stars. Food is excellent. Buffet is a great price. Staff are friendly. Place is clean and beautiful. Nice dining experience.

I was travelling through Las Vegas and found this restaurant through Yelp. Thanks to it.
It seems a new restaurant and 5 to 10 mins away from strip. I usually go to Gandhi but found this better for various reasons.
This have plenty of parking space for vehicles and plenty of area for dining. 
We are larger group with three kids and  we need a plenty of space to move around. This restaurant was perfect for us. Coming to the food it was better than other Vegas Indian food i tasted. Since it became crowded the items are fresh that makes it delicious . I wont find anything in the heating tray for longer time. It always better to go early for buffets, we went late by 2pm so some of the vegeterian trays are already over so we got a little wait time for the foods to be prepared and filled up.

The Non veg starters are more , so you will get good options. This is typical north indian resturant so you cant expect a South indian briyani or the idly at its best. But its typical briyani and an better idly served at north indian resturant.

The butter nan and garlic nan was really delicious. 

And at that time there was option to get a Mango lassi for yelp check in, Its really very good. I found this as best among Indian resturants in Vegas.
One of the good Indian restaurants in Vegas. Good food and descently priced. Lunch buffet was really good.

Best Indian food ever .   EVER.      Goat curry is good.    Chicken curry no bones is good.  And everything is good.   But mango lassi looked reddish.      Too much food coloring?   But it was good too
They have lots of good things but some are plain and their too hot so thats bad but the food taste is nice

Food was great! I was a little bummed I missed the buffet, but that melted away after eating a level 10 spice chicken tikka masala.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas to try out the buffet!

Also Keema Naan was very good.

Got to order the "Mango Lasse" oh, sooooo good! Still the best Indian buffet for it's value and taste. Even the take-out for lunch is a huge portion enough for a big eater like me to have two portions.

So far from my experience best restaurant in Vegas,  although I am a vegetarian so only can comment on Veg food. Their manchurian and momo's are best. Also restaurant is Spacious so no waiting..!!! I wish they add dosas to menu and veg biryani in buffet.

Good food and prompt service. 

I went to this restaurant last week with family and I was pleased with the taste, quality and the variety of food on their buffet menu. We will definitely visit again on our next trip to Vegas.

Heard a lot about this place from friends and family, wanted to try the buffet. Arrived a bit too late but the alacarte menu looked appealing too.

The paneer tikka masala and garlic naan were cooked to perfection, masala papad made a great appetizer. 

Cordial and prompt service makes this place a must visit multiple times!

The tandoori chicken was very tender and one of the best that I've ever had ,the biriyani  was quite average though, it can get quite noisy in the evening, not a place for a quiet dinner:) , but decent food.

I ordered delivery while on a work trip from CA. Ordered quite a spread too - chicken korma, saag paneer, rice, papadums, roti, kheer, mango lassi, and 1 other appetizer. Not only did I have enough for 3 people, but the food was delicious!!! Perfectly spiced and beautifully prepared. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, and would definitely order again next time I am in town!

Great buffet! Good service.. Chicken curry, naan, veg curry, chicken biryani, tandoori, all was delicious. The ending with Gajar halva was heaven. We got a good chai to end our lunch. The price is good for the amount, service, variety in flavors & taste.

We visited vegas for 3 days, on last day we decided to try a different indian restaurant out of the strip and found delhi indian cuisine via yelp, we are glad we tried it out. Food here was simply amazing, yummy and delicious with indian kind of spice level and highly authentic. 

We went for lunch buffet - tried idly, sambar, chicken briyani, chicken gravy, reshmi chicken kabob, samosa, pakora, mutter paneer, navarathna kurumah, daal, white rice and aloo gobi. All the items were too good without any complaints and we truly enjoyed the whole experience. 

Dessert - carrot halwa was too good and simply cant stop eating :). 

I would recommend anyone visiting vegas to definitely check this out , one of the must eat place. We will absolutely go here during our next visit.
i like their selections..from curries and vegetables! this is a hidden indian food away from the strip
This place is absolutely awesome!! The food and service were absolutely amazing!!! Prices were great and the food was soo fresh.

Never had Indian food before. Friends recommended I give this place a chance, and I loved it. Spice level on everything is perfect for me, and the bread must be foreign to earth cause it's on another level.

We went for a buffet on  Wednesday 12/14. They have a huge selection. Food tasted good. Samosa was the best. Naan was served at table. Naan was good. They won't serve you naan until you empty your naan basket even if it's the last bite left. Cmon guys I respect your sense of responsibility of not wasting food but don't give that reason to customers who need a naan. I don't want to wait for five minutes between my last bite and next bite.
I know there might be people who waste lot of food in buffet but there must be a better way to refill Naan. You are already saving food by serving naan at table.

Who doesn't love yelp eats 24?!? I'm such a fan of the delivery options while at the same time being able to navigate star ratings and photos from my fellow yelpers. 

So I was extremely hungover, and refused to leave my house,  so I searched yelp deliveries and somehow all the Nann had me memorized.  And I thought somehow that all the spice and turmeric might just keep my brain from exploding,  so I ordered from Dehli Indian. 

I ordered the chicken Tikka masala,  garlic nann, and then added in a new nann that I had never tried that had cheese in it! There was also a yelp check in of a free mango lassi. Now,  I actually have no idea what mango lassi actually is... but can I have a keg of that!?! 

The food was great.  Perfectly spiced,  great portions... my only complaint,  was that they changed my order.  I guess they were out of the cheese nann, so they substituted it for a nann that had coconut and cherries in it.  And while I appreciate the substitution,  I didn't want that,  and would have just rather saved the $5 or had like 100 mango lassi instead.  I was not crazy about the fact that I wasn't given a choice,  but they just did it for me.

Quantity over quality is best way to describe this location. It also doesn't help that during their buffet hours they rented out half the restaurant to a family that was celebrating their wedding party. This isn't the most professional thing to do, because things did get a bit hectic when you try to get food at the serving stations. 

Now to the quality of the food. The curry flavor is so-so, lot of the curries are watery. The naan was excellent, but the food can use some improvement. 

I'd recommend Mint, Saffron, or Mount Everest over this place. Check them out for their buffet and a-la carte meals.
As soon as you walk in you know you came to the right place. Full buffet and beautiful ambiance. Mango lassi was bomb!

Where shall I begin, food is excellent, nice atmosphere, service is great. The staff is very friendly and informative for first timers to Indian cuisine. The chicken tikka masala was my favorite dish, along with the yellow fried rice.
Best Indian buffet in Vegas!!! Lot of good vegetarian options and lot of sweets!!! The best thing was idli sambhar!! Must visit!!

Very tasty food... not a very large selection but good for the buffet i guess.  the service was very very slow.  took almost 20 min to get the bread which is essential in eating indian food!  place wasnt even busy. we must have asked the waitress at least 4 times and she just kept forgetting.  all in all it was good....

Amazing Indian food! We went for dinner and their chicken tikka masala was so delicious along with their yummy garlic naan. Their goat vindaloo was just as amazing. Everything was great and the staff is very friendly! We also had the mango lassi and it was so tasty I want more! Can't wait to go back!
Great Indian food and it's made fresh to order. Best lamb biryani I had so far (comparing to bay area and Chicago)

We came here for dinner and ordered from the regular menu, as buffet is only available during lunch. Appetizers were generally priced at about $5, and entrees range from about $11 - $15. So it is a little pricey, but the portions were generous. We ordered vegetable pakora, saag panner, tandoori chicken, and aloo gobi. We also got a free Mango Lassi for our Yelp check-in, and complimentary Galub Jamuns for dessert (served warm)! My husband and I were both full by the time we left, and we had enough left over for lunch the next day. 

The food was absolutely delicious and the staff was very nice. There place was pretty empty, only about 5 tables were occupied, so the staff was very attentive - asking if we needed more water, and checking to make sure we were enjoying our meal. 

I'll definitely be coming back here - only next time I hope I can make it for the $10.99 buffet lunch!!

Well people I have to say nothing less than ..OMG!! Hands down the best Indian restaurant i have ever been to.The service and the food went together like bonnie and clydeI had a sizzling plate with a variety of meats,  and bed of rice with their naan bread.. Will definently be returning soon!!

I was never a fan of Indian food because the spice was just too over powering and you could not enjoy the flavors of the food. But at Delhi they will tone down the spiciness of the food so you can actually taste the food. Now we (my wife and I) love to eat Indian as often as we can, we even take our out of town guest there!
Having only eaten there for dinner, I am unable to comment on their lunch buffet.

I am good cook of Indian and Pakistani food, so my standard for Indian and Pakistani food is pretty high. In my 35 years I've been to countless Indian and Pakistani restaurant in US and I always get disappointed in at least 95% of restaurant I have been. I am from Bay Aria there is only one good Pakistani restaurant in SF, Fremont name Shalimar, I used to travel 2 hrs. drive from Sacramento to Fremont just to eat at this restaurant to me Shalimar on scale 10. When I go to any Indian and Pakistani restaurant I compare it to Shalimar. I just recently move to Las Vegas and start trying new restaurant and came across Delhi Cuisine restaurant and scale 1 to 10 its up there at 8 and believe me every other restaurant  I've been never cross more than 4 on scale. The best Indian Buffet restaurant, place is clean service is great and food is absolutely delicious fresh and tasty. Usually they have about 25 different dishes to choose from.  fresh plain or garlic nan the buffet is only for $10. You cannot beat that. I go there at least every other day for lunch. If you are looking for Indian and Pakistani food in Las Vegas this is the only place in town try it and you will love it.

The food is fantastic but they did not give me forks and spoon!! How am I SUPPOSED to EAT!? 
I would give four stars for the food but I subtracted one for the forks and spoon
The food is very good, though this place is a bit pricy. The menu has great variety, the tastes are authentic Delhi. The staff was friendly and service was good.

This was a very pretty Indian restaurant in a not SO good location.  The food was good, as was the service.  However the portions were extremely small and the prices were high for what we got. 

Our recommendation for Indian is Mount Everest.  Good portions, quality, service  and the right price for us!

Well they have a buffet so food is plentiful, but, one of the dishes is goat curry. I guess I am not cool enough to eat that and as far as pans go it was the fullest, timing perhaps but I was told people like it. Place is clean and all the staff is very nice, love the bread.

Lunch buffet runs until 3. We got here at 2 and there was still an ample amount of food in the trays. The naan was fresh and fluffy. The wait staff was very attentive and polite. One of the better lunch buffets I've been to.

Another  5 star review that everyone isn't sure of right?!
No, this is the real deal. The food is excellent. My wife and I had dinner off the standard menu and we asked for several dishes and we know indian food. How do we know indian? We were taught by an Indian from Goa who knew many dishes and taught us how to cook northern, delhi, goa, and southern styles. My wife has cooked indian, made the paneer, made the yogurt, crushed the spices, everything. So we know how it should taste and the regional spices.
So what did we try?
We had vegetable samosa chaat with mint sauce and tamarind d sauce. They also brought papadom.
We then had Rogan Josh, Navratan Korma, Goat Vindaloo, Mutter Paneer, plain parathas, and plain basmati rice. Every dish was authentic and provided in nice portions.
The dinner was capped by galub jaman which was very light and fresh and the syrup was light and sweet.
If you like indian, you won't be disappointed. If you want to try it, they will scale the heat from 1 to 10...don't be afraid it will be too hot!
The owners are one family from Nepal. We were served by Krishna and Ashmati who were informative and met our wishes exactly.
I love indian food and this restaurant is incredible...please, just go!
Very less vegetarian options in the buffet. Was not a great fan of the place and food.
Have to say this food is better than Mint Indian Bistro. Sorry guys. Great great Food!!

Great food and excellent customer service.  We went there almost around closing time, most of the restaurants will probably say their kitchens are closed but they accommodated us without any rush.

Food quality was great, specifically garlic roti, onion Kulcha and baigan bhadatha.

In this place there is an amazing meal. The service was excellent prices were honest, and our waitress was pleased to help us make decisions about things that we were not sure about. I recommend it quickly and delicious.
Good service. Nice selection. Flavorful. Generous naan portions. I was happy with them. Reasonable price too. Strong competition to India palace.

We ordered to go. Peas pulav was extremely oily!!! Even palak paneer is dumped in oil. Surprisingly we got only 2 spoons of chutney for 6 idlys. Am still not able to believe how anyone can give just 2 spoons of chutney for 6 idlys while charging so much! Atleast one star because Nepali veg momos were good and dal soup was decent. Otherwise don't bother. Such oily food and tiny quantity for such heavy price is not worth it!

Second best Indian restaurant in Vegas. We did the lunch buffet. They had tons of different options for a reasonable price of $12.00 
Restaurant is very clean and staff are nice. Service wasn't the greatest. We had to wait quit a bit for our garlic naan and was almost done with our meal when we got it.

Where do I start?...

Service: Attentive and kind. 

Ambience: White table cloths, red cloth napkins, stemmed glasses, uniformed wait staff, subtle Indian music, and clean. 

Food: Great!!!! Sooo flavorful hot and fresh! Right when you walk in the door you are hit with the most wonderful, herbaceous, warm smell which reflected the food to a T. What a treat. Fresh warm garlic nann made and brought to the table. Every single item (which is plentiful) on the buffet was absolutely delicious and had its own flavor. 

Price: Cheap/moderate $25 with tax for two lunch buffets. 

Would recommend!

I am sorry this restaurant is not closer to our part of town, for when we are craving Indian food! My husband and I stopped in for their lunch buffet. A great selection, and all the food tasted fresh. I thought the particular standouts were the Goat Curry, the onion bhaji, and the garlic naan. I love goat, and of course its not easy to find in the U.S., and this is a staple on Delhi's buffet. Goat meat is a little stronger tasting than beef, and stood up to the sauce very well. The cuts of meat are on-the-bone...I wanted to dive in with my fingers and grab each piece and gnaw it clean!  The onion bhaji was crisp and tasty; not greasy at all. And the garlic naan was light and chewy and very, very fresh.
I'm not a big fan of the bright yellow curry sauces, but my husband reported that the Punjabi curry was very good. The saag paneer was good also.. The tandoori chicken wasn't as highly spiced as I like, but it was moist enough to be tasty. Like the onion bhaji, the samosas were crisp, not soggy, and had a nice flavor. The biryani rice was a little greasy, but that was probably my only real nitpick with any of the dishes.
They also have the standard side sauces, raita and mint sauce. We could have eaten those all day long, with baskets of naan! For dessert, there was warm carrot halwah (very tasty, but a little odd to us; not quite a side dish; not quite a dessert); and one other selection. You'll have to look for the "samia" (I've always known it as "kheer"), at the back of the salad table. It's not labeled as a dessert, and it's right next to the similar-looking raita sauce. If you aren't familiar with it, its a sweet milk and vermicelli-noodle pudding flavored with cardamom. I like mine with more cardamom, but this was a nice cool & sweet ending to a spicy lunch :-) 
With one soda pop, our meal for 2 was about $25, and well worth it. Rather than cook just one main dish at home, we enjoyed being have a lot of good Indian food at one meal. Oh, and the employees were very friendly as well!
We go to Vegas a lot from Los Angeles.. I was a fan of Ghandi since last 8 years.... I think I found my new fav... Food and service was great...

do not go here
do not trust any ratings

we went for dinner and food was stale

decor and service was good

costed us $90. do not serve stale food to families who come for dinner and spend extra money.

Specifically asked for spoons and forks as I am staying at a hotel. Guy shows up and confirms that there are spoons and forks in the bag. I paid him for the food, $9 or $6 delivery charge and $5 tip only later to find out that there was just really bad quality food in the bag and nothing else. I LITERALLY THREW MY ENTIRE ORDER AWAY, PAID $50 FOR TRASH. If you guys want I can give you online lessons on how to cook good Indian food? Seriously, I won't charge you a thing. Don't scam people by offering something that you don't even know how to cook.

Service was good and fast. Decent food. They accepted the order on phone and prepared in time.
But its bit pricy though.

First off I must admit that I'm no Indian food expert. In fact this was my first experience eating authentic Indian cuisine. We tried this place on a friend's recommendation. And the verdict- I'd go back in a heartbeat and I'm lamenting the fact that we live 2 hours away. Their naan bread with garlic was to die for. I loved the chicken mahkani and the tandoori chicken was very tasty. I enjoyed the yellow dal and the palak peneer (spinach with cheese). I even got brave and tried the goat curry which was delicious. The lunch buffet was $12.99 and was perfect because I got to try a little of everything. Our tummy's were so happy after this meal.
