Had an Indian person in town for the first time so we tried a few different restaurants courtesy of yelp and by far this place was the best. On top of it, service was outstanding even though it was just the lunch buffet. The workers clearly take pride in their restaurant.
Came here recently and loved the buffet.  The nan was hot and fresh.  Tandori Chicken was as good as I have ever had.  I will certainly return to Delhi on my next trip to Las Vegas.

The Skinny: the Nepalese/East Indian cuisine is very satisfying... not to mention great piping hot naan that is perfectly crispy on the bottom with a slight chew. Only sad thing is that they do not consistently have kheer which is my fav. (4) service: always pretty good - water glasses are filled consistently (4) value: for $11.99, the lunch buffet is a great value - good for groups due to the large dining room (4).

This is our new go-to Indian Buffet joint in town. Sporting a good variety of items, they offer both Nepalese/East Indian flavors. The dining room is spacious and is capable of serving large groups of people comfortably.

Service is usually pretty good and your water glass is never left unfilled.

My favorite items include the saag paneer, chana masala and the aloo gobi. So delicious and usually always there. Their raita is nice and thick. They do not have chutney available as a condiment however the tamarind sauce does okay in a pinch. The tandoori chicken is quite moist and tasty as well. The hubs is addicted to their butter chicken and daal.

Their naan is great - loved the crispy bottom with the slight chew. Order it with garlic at no extra cost. Awesome!

Their one weakness in my opinion are the desserts. They have a rather artificial, watery mango "custard". This is in rotation with the vermicelli payasam which I found to be a bit too sweet and one note. I kind of miss the kheer using rice pudding and cardamom.

Overall, these are minor issues to an great buffet. 4 starred review.

Lunch buffet was awesome! Very large selection of items, vegetarian and non-vegetarian alike. 

Naan bread is brought to your table fresh from the oven, so no problem of dried out (or missing) naan in the buffet line like some other places. As if you need another reason to wolf down warm deliciousness...ask for the garlic naan, mmmmmm, you won't be sorry.

We ended our meal with one of my favorite things - a cup of real chai tea ($2/cup). If you have  never had it, you have to add your own sweetener, which is nice because you can adjust it to your liking (and you don't have to use real sugar if you prefer artificial sweeteners).

I would have to say this is one of the best Indian buffets I have had in Vegas. We left full and happy, without feeling heavy (other buffets we've visited often had overly oily items and this one did not). I also think that for the quality and selection of items, they could actually charge a couple dollars more and still be a bargain. We will definitely be back!

note to owners:  I wish you offered some kind of drink menu. Not only would customers would know what kind of drink options were available for purchase, it would also give your business the opportunity for additional revenue during the lunch buffet time.
This place is great, the food was fantastic, the service very good,  you don't expect it in a restaurant that has buffet.

Passing through Las Vegas, found this place on Yelp! Amazing experience! Food was fantastic, fresh, plentiful and diverse and each dish had its own, unique flavor.
Staff was friendly and provided excellent service. The establishment was also clean and well maintained.
     Will not pass through without another visit!

I have never imagined that I would get such a great Indian vegetarian food in Vegas. This is a great place for any vegetarian folks out there in Vegas, especially this restaurant serves Jain( food without onion, potatoes and garlic). The staff is very friendly and helping. I would recommend to visits this place if you're looking for delicious Indian food and great ambience. Totally worth it.
I'm a Vegas local, and Delhi is my go-to Indian restaurant. High marks on service, price, atmosphere, selection, and taste! Vegan friendly too!
Buffet was not great. I have tried better Indian buffet in Vegas. Tea was very bad. I won't recommend this

You know it's legit when you're the only white person in the restaurant. This is officially the greatest tasting Indian food I have EVER experienced in my life! Thank you YELP for leading me here.

Only down fall is how well they're doing. This place is so packed that they are having trouble keeping their buffet filled. The naan is instantly gone once it's put out/served.

We went here for dinner. They have a lot of seating.

Food: Really good, fresh authentic Indian food. The food was a little oily. But tasted really good. The malai kofta could have been better.

Ambience: Casual, family friendly.

Service: No complains.

Came here with my bf and his friend. We were visiting Las Vegas for the 1st time and the friend really wanted to eat Indian food. So this place was the best choice to eat from the order restaurants. 

The location was pretty easy to find. Although if you are coming from the side it can be a little difficult because the restaurant is hidden in the back corner. The server was pretty quick... too quick I say. She would come around and grab my bf's plate 1st before asking "are you done?"

 *sigh; honey you gotta ask if they're done before you take it* 

The buffet in my case was pretty good. I like the chicken masala, to me it was good. The spinach (saag paneer but without the cottage cheese) * I think * had a little weird taste to it. The lamb dish was kinda hard and over cooked. The soup was pretty good (can't remember the name of the dish). The chicken tandoori was severely burnt and lacked spice and flavor. Samosas (vegetarian) were pretty good. They had a slight kick to them,which I liked. 

From the guys side, they didn't like it. They say the chicken  was over cooked. The saag paneer was mixed with milk and it tasted bad. The Naan was dry, hard and slightly burnt but the dessert was okay ( the guys say it was the only dish that was good because it was brought rather than made). Overall if you're not a food analyst  will love it! But if you are one then "enjoy".

Also the manager doesn't really care about its customers, he could have at least asked if the food was alright, instead like most business people, Money 1st (pay 1st) ask questions maybe later.... or never.

Their food was great! Customer service was definitely okay. I came in two consecutive days for my lunch break at the beginning of the buffet lunch. Initially, no one was there to greet me but I was noticed quickly. I told them I wanted buffet to go and he said okay. Then proceeded to sit two groups of people, grab them all waters, and then come back and ask me if I wanted a to go box. Obviously I did so he took another 5 minutes or so to grab me so styrofoam containers. This didn't happen the second day I came in as I went straight to a waiter that recognized me and told them I wanted to-go again.

The food is amaze-balls! It's on the spicy side, so for someone who likes their curry mild beware! That's why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 3 for the service. $10 for as much as you can stuff into 3 containers is great to me! Also, I forgot to get dessert so I ask the waiter if I could get a little cup. He gave me a little side sauce cup, but he could have said no so I'll still give credit where it's due!

People who say that this is a good Indian restaurant have never eaten Indian before!! Seriously! I have eaten at Indian restaurants all over the U.S. I get it if the food is lil less spicy and all but the food here is completely tasteless. As if you are eating some kind of mashed taste less stuff. We tried the buffet and seriously we didn't like a single item. And not only that we had severe stomach ache after few minutes, maybe it was the baking soda or something I have no clue. I would say do yourself a favor and don't go to this place!

Really bad experience. This review is only for their to go service. 

Coming from bay area in CA I know my Indian/ Pakistani flavors. I fail to understand why it has such high ratings. Food is so average and way too spicy.

We asked for a normal daal so that our kids could have but they paid no attention N made it so spicy. Chicken in the curry was hard as rubber.

To top it the Naans we ordered were thick pieces of dough. Had to throw almost a whole naan.

It might be just because we ordered to go N dine in experience might be different. But based on our experience we are never coming back.

It's a place that's a little out of the way (really close to UNLV tho) and if you're looking for authentic Indian food this is a great place to visit. It's a buffet, but the selection is on the small side. They DO however have Butter Chicken, which I found is something that a lot of Indian restaurants in Vegas lack (that has saddened me to no end, Butter Chicken and I are in a committed relationship). There are two sides to the buffet; one side is purely vegetarian which is nice so people don't get confused. The food itself is really delicious. I ate almost everything and I recommend it all. I also recommend getting a Mango Lassi if you're not good at handling spice. Since the food isn't made to order, you have no control over the spice levels.

A must-visit restaurant when in Vegas and craving for Indian food. The food portion is huge, fresh and tasty, restaurant is hygienic and the service is prompt and impeccable. We were a group of five comprising of my husband, my MIL and my parents. My family can be a bit fussy and choosy when it comes to food but they all thoroughly enjoyed the food served here. We went for a vegetarian thali, sev puri, momos, chilly chicken, and chicken curry with assorted bread. No disappointments whatsoever! We were served by Hari and Krishna. They were both extremely courteous, prompt and accomodating when it came to our preferences. Special shout- out to Hari who went out of his way to give us the best service possible. Highly recommend this restaurant for its service, ambience and taste. Definitely worth giving it a shot!

We LOVED this place! The food selection on the lunch buffet was incredible and tasted amazing. We're pretty picky about our Indian food, and this place did not disappoint! They had some dishes new to us! Fav dish was the Chicken Tikka Masala. Flavors were nice & even. Some Indian buffets do not have much for a "salad" section, but here they did, with pickled items and a mango desert. We witnessed staff taking food temperature readings, which is a nice thing to see. It means they care about the customer. Very clean, & friendly staff. I lived out in NYC for a number of years, and this restaurant beats the places in Little India in Queens and the fancy places on the East side of Manhattan.

By far the best Indian food in Las Vegas
The service almost too good
The food amazing
The restaurant very clean
The spicy very spicy
The price very fair

Came in for the lunch buffet. Great food and excellent service! Garlic naan came with the lunch buffet. Mango lassi was delicious. As others have stated, lots of variety. Food was hot and tasted fresh. We will be back for sure!

Great food, great service, best momo and best Manchurian we have had in a long time. 
Very nice staff especially Krishna and Hari and their team
We will definitely visit when back in Vegas.

Tried it once so far. Loved the lunch buffet. Check-in offer at the time of this review is still one free soda or lassi, which is a cool bonus for what is already a great deal ($9.99 lunch buffet).

Impressed by the gingery Dal Tadka, and the savory and slightly sweet Navratan (veggie) Korma. They were cool with making us Roti (whole wheat) instead of regular Naan, and I thought the size of the Tandoori Chicken pieces was encouraging. Smaller chicken pieces indicate less hormones, and a more expensive bird. It's the first dish you will see on the buffet, and is a good representation of the rest of it. Quality ingredients made with care in quantity - these are some of the largest chafing dishes you will see on a Indian buffet, ever!

Looking forward to the next visit, and hopefully an upgrade to a string of *red* stars.

Way to go, Delhi! Keep it up please!

Bad customer service. Made us wait for 40 mins before serving anything! They assured us that they will give us food now and it never came. After we repeatedly told them that its long time we are waiting, give us or we will walk away. Then, they started serving.

Food was ok and not great taste. It was bit salty and looks like made in hurry. Also few items was missing from vegetarian thali.

4 star reviews are I believe because of incentive of free Lassi. It is not worth even 2 star with this kind of customer dining service !

I ate my first plate of Indian food about a year and a half ago and it seems like I've had it at least once or twice a month ever since. The stuff's addicting, like crack well not really. Why didn't I know about Indian food when I was going to school.

Anyways Delhi Indian Cuisine is the latest Indian restaurant in my rotation. It's located in a plaza on the NE corner of Flamingo and Maryland between Toys"R"Us and Albertsons. Of course you have to do the lunch buffet I think it was $10.99 which is about the same price for everyone else, you might find someone doing it for $9.99. The food here is delicious, not my favorite for taste but maybe a close 2nd with the other business one block over. Forgive me but I don't know what all the dishes are but I love the green stuff, the orange stuff, the reddish stuff, and the chicken stuff. Nah I'm kidding, almost but I'll pretty much eat everything they have to offer, the tandoori chicken, the chicken tikka masala, the chilli chicken, the goat curry, the saag paneer, the garlic naan, the gulab jamun, etc. Well almost everything, I still haven't tried the chow mein yet.

It does seem like it can hold a lot of people, you could throw a party,  and it has been very busy each time I've been there. They have booths and tables. Customer service is alright they do seem to be shorted handed and do take a while to do thinks like getting the garlic naan.

They have check-in offer of a free soda or lassi. Each time I've been there I've asked them for the lassi but they've yet to brought be one. Good luck on getting your. Dammit I see that a lot of you are getting yours.

Yes! Finally, a good Indian place! 
I went for their lunch buffet and everything was soooo tasty! Included in ur lunch buffet is plenty of Naan. They also have ,my fav, Samosas within the buffet. So, u kno I had to grab two. Everyone working was super nice. They even were gushing over my baby, which I think is really sweet. 

The only thing negative thing I can say isn't really a big deal. But, it was super stuffy in there. There was condensation on the windows haha. But soooo worth it. Maybe in the summertime not so much. Locals know.
Fantastic Indian cuisine. We had the butter chicken, dal and lamb koma and the flavors and texture was right on point.

Out for past 11 days and was tired of eating burgers and pizza, we wanted to have Indian food. While browsing yelp, we stumbled upon this place. Dinner was great, service was also good. Next day we tried their lunch buffet, and it was even better than last night's dinner. Lots of option, great taste and overall great service. I would recommend this place to my Friends visiting Vegas.

To start with I have been lazy on this review I ate here couple of months ago when I was in Vegas last and I owe them this review cause I searched them on yelp and boy was I glad to have landed there with my wife. We were greeted very warmly and shown around the dishes they served that day in buffet wich was priced very reasonably at 10.99 . Food was delicious we loved chicken Tikka masala and couple of other chicken and veg dishes goat curry was great and we simply fell in love with the punjabi curry which was finger licking good ( we Indians eat with hands  not forks) desserts were also good as was the service . I would recomend it to every one and will definetly eat here when I visit Vegas again

Hardly any options for veg food and the veg curries were tasteless. Th white rice was not cooked properly and the Nan was cold. i did not like the appetizers or the desert as well. Probably the place was catered to non -veg folks but considering it was buffet i think it should have been better.

The hunt for the best tasting Butter Chicken has ended, and we have found a place that taste superrrrr close to the one my BF had in Africa. 
I myself have never had a whole lot of Indian Food and have only been to one other Indian restaurant many years ago. Being that this is the second Indian restaurant I've eaten at, this by far is my favorite!

The first time my BF and I had decided to try Delhi Indian Restuarant, we had decided to go for lunch. They offer a buffet style with lots of different dishes to from such as Tikka Misala, Tandoori Chicken, Curries, vegetarian dishes, appetizers, endless Naan bread and of course Butter Chicken. The buffet is great! Especially if you're not familiar with Indian Food than you should definitely try the buffet, so you're able to try multiple dishes and figure out what you like and it was inexpensive (I believe it was like $10 or so)

....LOVE THE BUFFET BUT.....
The BF and I came the second time around thinking it was buffet style not knowing they only served it during lunch. Not mad at all, the BF only wanted Butter Chicken and this also gave me the chance to try something new. 

Before we ordered, they give you what is called a Papadum. Thin, crisp bread served with 2 Chutneys. Not sure of the names, but the one to the left had a plum flavor, almost like sweet and sour or li hing mui flavor. Maybe even a lighter than the two. The right has a cilantro taste and it is spicy, but a tolerable spice to it. Both very delicious!

My BF ordered of course the Butter Chicken Basmati Rice. You choose your heat 1 thru 10, he loves HOT food! 7, he chooses 7 so that I'm able to eat a little bit of it too. Eeks! I can feel my insides burning already, haha. 

I ordered the Lental Soup and the Reshmi Kebab. Lental Soup was creamy, flavorful and delicious. I would order it again! The kebab comes out hot and sizzling on a plate, literally. The meat is not on a stick either, it's shaped and texture is like a breakfast sausage link but on a larger scale, sitting on a bed of onions and green bell peppers. Topped with cilantro and wedges of lemon. Do, take those lemons and squeeze it allllll over the kebab, it takes it to a whole new level. OMG, okay Reshmi Kebob I see you!! Sooooo good! The meat is ground up chicken in a sausage form, it's packed full of flavors! Reminds me of a chicken and lemon dish from back home. Although I'm not familiar with all the spices used, I'm loving every bite of it! 

We loved everything about our meal. 

If you want to try Indian Food give them a try.

Tried the place on new year day 2016. Biryani is horrible.. and friedrice too.
Only thing liked is mango lassi. Not sure how does it get a 4+ rating.

We ordered for delivery through Amazon: paneer pakora, chicken tikka masala, chicken biryani, authentic chicken curry, rice, and plain naan. Totaled $93 with free delivery. The curry was overpowered by onion, but I'm possibly more sensitive to that than the average person (I typically love curry). This may seem silly, but the rice was a waste of money and I would recommend you steam your own while you wait for your delivery; may be different in-store. The medium spiced biryani was spicy as hell, which my SO enjoyed.

Three stars because the food was okay/fine-- not the worst Indian food we've had, but definitely not the best, either. We wouldn't order again.

Excellent food.. we were a group of 10 people we ordered variety of appitizers , main course , both veg and non veg . All of them were very delicious and spicy  accordingly . If you are in Vegas and are craving for quality indian food.. this is the place to eat

Used to be good. This visit we visited on Sunday for lunch buffet.. rice was dry and hard.. curd was sour.. although the chicken dirty was good but could not enjoy as both rice and bread were dry and hard.. I am not sure if I will come again here

Environment: It's a large place that can fit lots of people at once, I saw a lot of Indian people at lunch time, I guess this is the good sign for a good Indian restaurant.

Food: Get the Garlic Nnan bread! So good! They have variety of food choices, I saw at least 10 types of curry there, they also had rice, noodle, chicken wings (Indian kind). However, dessert options are not that much, but I don't complain with that price.

I went there for lunch buffet, I love the face Indian restaurant love to have lunch buffet for special price. I ate there on lunch and I paid $15 in total (lunch price and tips included).

Place is big a no one dining at 9:30pm on a Friday night. 

I did order a butter chicken, but I'm really not sure the meat was chicken, very bad, sauce was ok, but the meat I really don't think is chicken. Of course asking will not tell you the true....

As the restaurant is really empty, they maybe try to cut the cost on the food, and it's scary to think what you have on your plate....

I was eating the rice and the server pass his arm in front of my face to catch an empty plate on the other side of the table, because it was late and he want to go home.

Unfortunately it's a no go restaurant in Vegas. You find better.

I will call the city health department and have this place checked.

I decided to try this place's lunch buffet so I could get a good idea of what they offered.  While there were a few good dishes on the buffet, I guess the flavors weren't quite what I expected. Also, the paneer was really quite hard and the pakora was over cooked and more hard than crispy. The goat curry was quite good, but I don't think I could justify coming back for just that. They may have a lot of selections, but having less selections and concentrating on quality might be the better way to go.

I must say, the service is very good and their attentiveness is outstanding. It's something the other Indian lunch buffets here in Vegas could really use.
Cheap lunch buffet that has different food every time. Always chicken, goat options and paneer options as well. Clean and friendly.
We tried the lunch buffet for $12/13 per person. Food was fine. They had loads of options. Samosas. Idli Sambhar. 3/4 vegetables. Dal etc Staff was friendly and attentive. Good for the price.
Came here for the Sunday lunch buffet and it was awesome. Good service, good people and good food.

The food here is amazing!  Loved the fresh hot naans and malai kofta.  We had our Thanksgiving family reunion here (I know - not traditional) and they were very polite and accommodating.  We were 27 people from 3 years old to 72 years old and we were a little rambunctious - mostly because all of us were trying to talk at once.  But the Delhi staff was polite and listened to each one of our requests and followed up promptly.  Highly recommend this place even though it is a bit off the Strip.  A few of us family members walked back to Paris Hotel after dinner and it was absolutely do-able.  Great hotel!  LOVED it!

Excellent breads and good curries. We ordered a variety of breads and everything tasted delicious. The curries tasted decent, some were very good and some were ok. One common theme in all their curries was the food coloring. Wish they would cut down on the amount of food coloring used!

Love this place! Since I started getting into Indian food I've been to many of the major ones in Vegas and Henderson and this place is still top of the list. The buffet is great, prices are reasonable, the mango lassi and naan are amazing. The best thing about this particular restaurant is the customer service. The waitstaff are always so nice and attentive, and swing by every few minutes to check on us and refill our drinks. The food is fresh and doesn't have that characteristic "skin" that develops on buffet soups and stews.

This is seriously the tastiest, most legit Indian buffet my wife and I had been to since Manohar's Dehli Palace in Los Angeles. Would recommend this to anyone who likes good Indian food. It's not exactly as authentic as some places we've been to (Taj Mahal in Boise), but it's spicier and more authentic than most white boy / gringo style Indian buffets in the U.S.

EAT CURRIES AND SUCH TO ONE DAY BECOME INDIAN FOOD YOURSELF!!!

Delicious yummy food.  Loved Malai kofta, palak paneer, kali  daal, aloo tiki, samosa, chilli paneer.  Must try their falooda kulfi.  Very good services.  Their garlic naan is must try.  Found out that they serve jain food too. Love it....

Overall not bad experience. The restaurant itself was clean and was surprisingly not very busy for a weekend evening. The food itself was actually pretty good, the best in Vegas I've had yet, but still falls short compared to other big cities with a larger Indian population. Service was great, no complaints there.
We walked for 2 miles from the strip for this and we were not disappointed with the quality and flavor of the food.  It was Awesome!!!
Very good Indian lunch buffet. They even do it on weekends! Fantastic garlic Naan complimentary as well.

Went here on a Friday night around dinner time. Thought the place was closed because there was only 1 other patron dining. The server was a bit weird, awkward, and his English wasn't the best. Everyone (staff) else seemed weird and different as well. However, the food was very delicious and fresh. We ordered chicken tikka masala and a chicken kabob style with a yellow rice. The food was flavorful and tasted great.

Always looking for good indian food. 
Ended up at this spot. I have tried quite a few Indian restaurants in and around Vegas. Mostly ok experience. Have to say Delhi India delivered a great service excellent food. Their chicken tandoori was on point and then some. Specially if you like it spicy order it spicy. Malai kofta is great as well and paneer tikka Dry was ok. Stayed in Vegas 4 nights and went there 2 nights, since I enjoyed the experience so much. Pls give it a shot if you are in the area on or around the strip
First time eating here and the wait staff was awesome help! The food was very well prepared! Will defiantly be back!

It's simply my favorite. This is a great, authentic, and clean food buffet. It's the only buffet I'll eat , 'cause I'm picky that way. Always pleasant, always clean, always good , and I'm almost always the only white guy in the place...that tells me a little sumpin about the authenticity and quality of the food:)

Oh man, where do I start?  My husband and I eat a whole grain plant-based diet, and Indian food has lots to offer.  We ordered one of almost everything on the Vegan menu, except for naan and roti.  We're full and satisfied, and have enough for at least one more meal!  Delicious flavors, savory aromas...what more could one ask for?  It's no surprise they were awarded Best Restaurant 2015.
Great place the food was amazing and so was the service I will be definitely coming back here and bring all my friends !!!!

Delicious food!  So much flavor!  Lots of variety.  Very friendly staff.  I enjoyed trying the mango lassi with my yelp check in!  The garlic naan bread is so yummy!!!!  Will be back soon!  Nice family restaurant.

Surprisingly empty on a Friday night, but the food was stellar! We had the chicken Nepali Momo as an appetizer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and an excellent Baingain Bharta which they recognized from our confused description and prepared even though it wasn't on the menu. Unfortunately we're only passing through Vegas. I'd definitely be a regular if they were located in my hometown!
Really tasty North Indian food. Okra masala and daal were very tasty. We were traveling to Vegas and this was a nice apatite quencher. Must try if you're craving for a good Indian food.
This isn't good for vegetarians. The options were limited.. for about 13$ I expect more. Also the  restrooms weren't functional when we went.

My husband and I love good Indian curry.  In fact, most times we prefer to cook at home rather than going out.  Enter Dehli.  They have an awesome lunch buffet that has a lot of curries that are difficult to make at home.  Overall, go to this place for lunch and order the Garlic Naan
Best Indian food !!! Love chill chicken  and okra dish with mango lassi . Don't forget to get some garlic naans !!

This is my first review on yelp and you can imagine how disappointed i am that i took the pain of writing this review. 

Probably the worst food in terms of quality that i had in my recent memory. Please do not waste your time and money at this place.
Didnt enjoyed the food as it was not good based on price... i just tried having seeing the good rating..

This review is for the dinner. 

On a recent trip to Vegas, a friend recommended I leave the strip (its like 3 blocks away so not that far I guess) and eat at Delhi. I love Indian food so I gave it a shot. If I didn't like Indian food before, this would have sold me for sure! 

The food was a solid 5/5. We had the butter chicken and the malai kofta. We also started with some classic somosas. Everything was fantastically delicious. The somosas were crisp and yet fluffy on the inside. The butter chicken was a little spicy, creamy, and melt in your mouth all at once. The kofta was a dish I had never tried before but was pleasantly surprised because the curry it was in was the best curry I have had to date. We topped it off with garlic naan and life was perfect.

The servers were always attentive. This is the kind of place where you will never see a water glass empty. To be fair, we were one of two parties dining at that time (they had just opened for dinner 2 minutes prior to us arriving) so mileage may vary.

Finally, the price was most definitely right. That entire meal I described came out to like $40 which left me and my gf who I was eating with bursting at the seams. I can't say enough about how great this place is.

I am a self confessed foodie! I am in particular an Indian food snob! 
I have the opportunity to travel with my job and I try ask sorts of locally owned places. Because this place received a good review I thought I'd give it a go... Oh man! Wonderful! The Saag paneer was fantastic. As was everything I tried. Everything was fresh and flavorful. I easy Indian all over the state's and this it's by far the best I've had! I'm almost sorry I only make it to Vegas twice a year!

Amazing food.. great service.. would recommend to everyone. We had momos, chicken, paneer dish and biryani.. Food was delicious.. Everyone in my family relished the food... very rare to get authentic taste of Indian food in US..
I LOVE this place! I can't say enough! We went to Mount Everest indian buffet and it was entirely too spicy and I love spicy food! But this place is so perfect friendly and clean.

Four words: bang for your buck. For $9.00 you get amazing food! And when you're in Vegas surrounded by steak buffets offering powdered mashed potatoes, this is a great deal. What this place lacked in ambience, it made up for in taste. It's relatively new with a great culinary future ahead.

The owner was very sweet. He personally brought over the free mango lassi I got from checking in (delicious, might I add).

If you're feeling your pockets empty because the strip is just too darn expensive, then hop on over to the outskirts of main vegas attractions and scoop up your desired heaps of savory, succulent, mouth-watering (affordable) Indian food. Seriously though, go go go.

One star so that i can post a review.

Over hyped restaurant. Absolutely negligent staff and below average food. It was a wednesday lunch buffet spread. I went in with my parents for a vegetarian indian spread. The moment you enter the place it has a weird fries oil n smoke smell. The spread had bad oil smelling samosas as starters. One bite and all you can taste is oil, on the verge of puking. Idlis were warm from bottom but the top layer was dry like a plastic. Hmm proceeding further cucumber in the salad bar was bitter, raita was made from sour curd. It seemed leftover curd and to cut the sourness the chef added too much of water resulting it into a lassi rather then a raita. 

Main course was another trauma in its own. Gobi aloo was a bit under cooked, palak paneer looked a left over of saag mixed with hard paneer. Infact wasnt even mixed well. Navratan korma was actually a carrot curry with rich cream gravy. Chole and naan alongwith a gulab jamun were the only decently cooked items. Paid 43$ for it. Certainly not worth it. 

Adding to the above i communicated all of this to the staff/manager on duty. All he did was hear and walk off. One of the most disappointing experiences ever. Please donot go there and waste your time and money.

Awesome food....very well organized... More staff to help... I have tried all the Indian Restaurants in Las Vegas.. But this is my no 1. Choice..

I would recommend all who visit Las vegas please check this place out....

Delhi Palace ..

Went for dinner, it was delicious! I had the Vegetarian Thali and my babe had the Butter Chicken. My Thali came with regular naan but we ordered additional garlic naan and both were tasty. We had plenty of leftovers, there was so much food! Service was great, really friendly.

This is one  of the best Indian buffets i have been to in USA. It's $14 but it's totally worth it. We were in Zion National Park for 4 days and really craving Indian food while on the way back to Vegas airport we stopped here and I am so glad we did. I had an awesome meal, there were 5 chicken dishes, a goat curry, 4-5 Indian dishes ( palak paneer, aloo mutter, korma etc) , nan and pulav. The only thing which I didn't like was gulab jamun which felt a little old but all in all a good restaurant.
I will def visit again

Went here with my wife for the lunch buffet, no wait at all to sit down and immediately asked what kind of naan we wanted (Garlic or Butter). We each went up to the buffet and there was a large selection of different foods, I loaded up on Chicken Tikka Masala, basmati rice and vegetable samosas. 

The chicken was delicious and not dry on the middle as some other places I've been to that don't let there chicken sit in the sauce for too long, this was deliciously juicy throughout. The garlic naan was delicious as well and complimented the meal nicely. I had a couple other things from the buffet that I've never had before and all was nicely cooked. We left after filling up on one plate each, both wanting to go back for more but knew better. Final bill was about $23 total for two (both drank water).

If I rated it on the food flavor alone, I would give it five stars. What's holding me back is the casual racism exhibited by the owners. 

If you don't think white people can handle spicy food, just don't ask us how spicy they want it. Make us think you only offer it one way. But that's not what you did. You specifically asked how spicy I wanted my Vindaloo. I said, "Very spicy." You looked at me like I was crazy, and asked again. I said, "Indian spicy", hoping that magical keyword would convince you. No, instead, you looked me in the eye and asked if it was for someone else. Had I not been ready to rob a bank for a Vindaloo, I would have left right then, but, at this point, I was committed. So, thinking that you finally were going to give me what I asked, I let it go, and we ordered the rest of our stuff. 

The Vindaloo's spice level was somewhere between yogurt and a milk shake. Granted, it had a fantastic flavor, as did the Tikka Masala, the Mahkane, and the Saag Paneer. The Kashmir Naan was so delicious it brought a tear to my eye, and the Galub Jamun was top-notch. In fact, the only thing missing from my night of Indian food bliss was some vague tingle; some heat to let me know that I had eaten some spices. It was just not there.  

I'll definitely order from here again, but I need to know what secret code I can give you so that you'll actually put some heat in my Vindaloo.

Holy cow do not come here today. It's about 95 degrees and 95% humidity inside here! I came here to dine on authentic Indian cuisine not dine in authentic Indian summer heat. On top of everything being very spicy and no ice in your drinks. Was never asked if we wanted drinks. We were never offered menus. We never even had a server. The food was ok. I would assume it was very authentic and that is why they have such good reviews on here. I would hope that ordering off the menu would be better. The pictures on Yelp are definitely not from the buffet. 1 extra star because on the plus side I lost three pounds due to excessive sweating;)!

(Review of buffet only)

Interesting choice of location to set up a new Indian buffet on the east side of town considering you have Mint, India Masala, Origin India, Gandhi, and Taste of India all within a 2 mile radius, although I think it's the others that should be intimidated, since the new kid in town has got some bhangra swagger.  Pretty much all of its rivals are in little strip malls of varying degrees of  decay, so this should not deter you in terms of its exterior.  Once you step inside, the modern decor with track lighting, single open room layout, and seemingly endless linear display of offerings along the buffet line should set your mind at ease.  

Upon being seated, you are immediately prompted if you would like naan bread with your buffet.  Not only should you say yes, but you should specifically request the garlic naan since the aroma alone with the freshly minced garlic and finishing brush of ghee emanating from the freshly cut bread removed from the tandoori oven is intoxicating enough to get your appetite revved up on the feast that lies ahead (refills are complimentary if you need more)

As one approaches the buffet line, the first wave of offerings include various meats including the standards such tandoori, tikki masala, and curry chicken along with some wild cards such as goat curry and reshmi kababs, which is a ground chicken meatball that seems a bit healthier than the sauced meats.   The latter half of the line offers a multitude of vegetarian offerings including saag paneer (spinach), chana masala (spicy stewed chickpeas), eggplant, mixed curry veggies, and lentils.  The third category of offerings is the carbs, which in this case included plain basmati, a spicy chicken biryani, mini-samosas (which gives you more of the flaky crust to enjoy, much like why mini-pecan pies are superior to regular pecan pie), idli (a steamed rice cake), and something I've never seen before, a spongy savory cake called dhokla, which I've read to be a beloved street snack in the southern part of India.  It has a cornbread-like consistency, a rich yellow hue from turmeric and mustard seeds, and is served with some chili peppers, cilantro, and toasted coriander seeds.  Add a dollop of tamarind, and it is a pretty addictive combo of flavors which I would have had more of had I not discovered it at the end of my meal.  

I almost never have room for desserts after an Indian buffet but it is a rotating mix of gulab jamun(sweet milk balls), rice pudding, gajar halwa (carrots+milk), and a few offerings of fruit which I am always a bit wary of when it comes to buffets in general.  

Service was very good in which plates were cleared and water was refilled efficiently, and the staff checked in a few times to see how I was enjoying the meal.  Compared to the local competition, price point is excellent (9.99 vs 10.99 at India Masala, and 12 and up at Mint and Gandhi), quality of food is definitely in my top 3 in Vegas (Mount Everest and Taj Palace), and highlights include the garlic naan, balance in offerings between vegetarian and meat dishes,  a few unique offerings (mini samosas and dhokla), and ambiance.  India Masala is still my go-to choice for take out buffet due to quantity (refer to my review for my patented packing technique) as well as complimentary Mango Lassi with yelp check-in, but if I'm dining in, Delhi Indian is my new go-to place for quality when I plan to go on an Indian carb feeding frenzy for lunch.

This place was great the food was delicious. We had the sev puri, all the ingredients tasted very fresh with just the right amount of spice. I also had the chicken tikka masala and it was also very good, they made it spicy to my specific request, even the nan was great.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in town.  Definitely the best Indian.   The grilled paneer cubes are amazing.  The buffet is great.  Definitely worth it.  But for an experience you won't forget, go for dinner.  Too many great recommendations to list.  Just go, you won't regret it.
It's all good but most of the plates don't have any meat. Also there are no desert at all. However they are really friendly and nice.
Excellent place to get Indian buffet. I highly recommend to have food there as it's worth. The service is really good and the variety is awesome. Lastly you will get high value for what you spend.

Last night, my mother and I stopped in for dinner. We ordered garlic nan bread, tandoori chicken, & a mild curry chicken. The curry chicken was very good, but the Tandoori chicken, not so much. We never received refills on our drinks, the service was okay at best, and when we asked for for more rice, we were told no! But here's the kicker, we were never thanked nor did anyone say goodbye as we were walking out the door. Maybe the buffet during the day would be a better option since you're serving yourself.
Amazing Indian food! The buttered chicken and garlic naan are the best here! The service is great and a nice clean restaurant. Definitely will be coming back!

Wow- my husband and I are vegetarians from phoenix who love indian food, and we loved this place! 

The food was very flavorful and colorful - some unique items. It was presented elegantly, with a good selection of alcoholic beverages. 

Also, the owner came to our table and was very polite, asking us if there was anything we needed. 

Don't usually eat much dairy, but we got the free mango lassi and it was to die for! 

Definitely check this place out! It's HUGE so it would be great for big parties. Good atmosphere with lots of natural light.

We were passing through vegas and decided to get lunch here seeing such amazing reviews. I did find this place much bigger, cleaner and better than Mt. Everest. The food was average. It was your usual run of the mill, palak paneer, samosa, pakora, dal, naan, mixed vegetable, aloo, rice kheer, gulab jamun. Some of the things that I found exceptionally good were, Samosa and black dal. Everything else was pretty normal. It definitely was better than Mt. Everest in terms of flavor for sure.

I placed an order for pickup.  When I arrived, I checked the items and noticed that they were not prepared as requested.  When I asked if they could accommodate the original request, they said it would be an extra $7.50 to fix their mistake, which made no sense at all (the fix should not have cost $...).  Did not seem to care whether I was happy or not, despite the very high prices.  The food was decent but between the poor, inconsistent service and the high prices, I will look for an alternative Indian restaurant from now on.

Very good food. Nice atmosphere and friendly servers. The garlic naan is so good I took some home. Chicken tikka masala was excellent. Veggie samosa is very good and an excellent light meal. I can't wait to try everything on this large menu; everything is so tasty! The room while large was fairly quiet and the booths afford some privacy. I havent tried the buffet but will be back soon to do so!
Good food, excellent service, very quiet setting somewhere away from the busy strip.  After you eat, you can also go to the next door TJ Maxx to shop a little.  Highly recommended!

Food tasted pretty fresh and tasty for this buffet. They had a large variety to choose from. They had goat, chicken, and a lot of vegetarian options. Some of the items were pretty spicy. The item that stood out the most was their Garlic naan. It was exceptional. I've been to several Indian buffet back in my home state of Iowa so I was not sure what to expect here in Vegas. Heard a lot of good reviews so we tried this place out. I am giving it 3 stars because I expected the food to be a step above what I get in Iowa but I didn't get that. Sorry I just expect a little more when you are in Vegas. I would still recommend this place if you want Indian buffet because at $11.99 for lunch was pretty cheap for the variety you get.

Food - 3/5   Thought it would be better than what I get in Iowa, come on.... it's Vegas!!!

Service - 5/5  They refilled our drinks often and took our empty plates.
One off the worst Indian restaurant I visited. For new visitors, please dont go there better go to other restaurant. The 4.5 start ratting is fake.

This is my new favorite Indian Buffet!!  Lots of choices! All fresh, hot and great spice.  People were nice and attentive.  If I had one thing negative to say it would be that it is hot and humid in the dining room. However, it's so good I don't mind sweating. 

This is my second time now and it is better than I remember.   The food is wonderful and it is not hot or humid.  Just perfect.

Once again (third time) I stopped while in Vegas.  The food is amazing.  I never saw the bottom of my water glass.  They were on top of everything.   I don't want to stop eating.  I think the people who write bad reviews are the owners of the other Indian food restaurants and are jealous.

Subsequent to a long day at work and with a gift certificate in my love's hand, we were on our way to cash in at Delhi Indian Cuisine. It was a bit of a drive across town for us, but we would soon discover that it was well worth the drive on this blustery night in Vegas. When we arrived it was rather quite with only a few tables of guests, but we were welcomed with a warm greeting that soon transformed into thorough service in their clean space with simple yet pleasing ambiance.

We took most of our server's suggestions after talking about our likes and dislikes. Most dishes have a spice range from one to ten. We opted to stay right in the middle and asked for some separate spicy sauce to add...the spice on the side was very spicy, just the way I like.

We ordered Garlic Naan, Nepali Vegetable Momos, Butter Chicken with dark meat, Lamb Dhansak, Baingan Bharta, and Mango Lassi. Dinner also comes with complimentary Papadum & Chutney. Everything was delicious and exotic. 

My favorites were the Momos and Butter Chicken. The Momos are Nepali dumplings--folded fresh and juicy with curry dipping sauce on the side...I enjoyed these dumplings very much, especially the excellent wrapper of the Momos...not too thick and not too thin.  I am used to Japanese and Thai Curry but this Indian Curry was made of different layers of spices and full of great flavor. To cool it all down we had a Mango Lassi...made with Yogurt and Mango...yummy.

According to Yelp Reviews, lunch buffet at Delhi Indian Cuisine is must...so I am planning to come back to satisfy my appetite for Indian meals.

Ordered delivery thru the UBER eats app. Food was fast,... and hot when I got it. I ordered the SAMOSA CHAAT and curry chicken (medium) with rice...and a side of garlic Naan. My favorite was the samosa chaat. It was so flavorful...I wish I can have it again but I live in California lol

I'd like to give them 3.5 stars, but it's not an option on reviews.

My stepdaughter and I ordered takeout from Bite LV. (Good service from them as an aside.)  The food was good quality.  We shared chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, garlic naan and samosas.  We like Indian food on the mild side.  The food tasted good and it was hot and delivered quickly.

My personal preference leans toward India Palace.  I find their food more flavorful, but In fairness, we order the food on the low scale of spicy.  I order the food the same way from IP but find it to be more to our liking.

Whoo I'm kind of a fan!!! I would have definitely given 4 stars for food and cleanliness, however there was a little something the servers did that I'm sure would annoy most people, but I'll get to that later.
When we first came in, there were about 4 other parties seated. There was a lot of seating available and everything was kept nice and clean. We didn't get any menus, once we sat down, she told us we could start on the buffet. We didn't realize they were only offering a buffet for lunch but no problem. She also asked if we wanted fresh garlic or regular naan and if we wanted mango lassi. We went with garlic naan and skipped on the lassi just because we wanted to see how the food was first. 
We basically tried all the meat options and many of the vegetarian options and there wasn't a single dish we didn't like. They all had incredible flavor and you could tell everything was really fresh and constantly having the temperature checked. Forgive me, I forgot basically all the names as I just started getting into Indian cuisine, Sorry! But everything was delicious.
Now time for that annoying little quirk they had. They started passing out fliers to everyone to vote for them as Best of Las Vegas while everyone was eating. Okay no problem, I told them I would later since I mean I was basically mid-bite lmao BUT they wouldn't leave our table till I was like okay fine and pulled it up on my phone. And they were telling me how to vote and apparently you need an account to vote, then she grabs my phone, clicks login and tells me to enter my Facebook. I don't have a Facebook. Soo then she takes my phone again and tells me to create an account and just stares at me waiting for me to do it. Are you kidding me?? Ughh so I enter my info and it says it sent me and email confirmation. I kept checking and I never got an email..finally I tell her I'll call her over when I get it. She continued to check on me the rest of the time we were there and when we checked out. -_- Ya I know, I could of said no, but I didn't want to be mean. They should of never been so aggressive with it anyways. 
Overall, food was amazing especially for $23 total (including tax before tip) and water was constantly being filled. Also fresh garlic naan was definitely a plus but hopefully if we come back, they don't attack us with that crap again. If they don't, 4 stars.

AAAA++++++++++++    This is by far the best tasting, decor, customer service and price ever!!!! The people here are very nice and the food is awesome for an indian lunch buffet. Huge selection and the price is amazing! I love it and I will be back very soon. When I saw indian people surrounding me ... I knew I found my pot of gold at the end of my rainbow for indian buffet!!! woohooo!!! The garlic nann bread is absolutely amazing.... order it.. order it NOW!!!!!  They are so good at topping off the food and if by chance you need something in the middle of your meal just ask someone they will be glad to help you. I was helped by a younger cubby boy and he was the sweetest waiter ever! He ran to assist me when I ordered an indian tea and then ran to get it and then I ordered a coke and he ran to fetch that and smiled ear to ear like it was the best day of his life to be at work. 

I couldn't believe it was happening to me... amazing lunch for cheap and sweet little boy with fantastic customer service!!!!!
The food is really yummy especially the tandoori chicken. It's very well cooked and their garlic naan is amazing! They also deliver which is a plus!

My absolute MOST favorite Indian food in the city. We eat here every so often and order to go even more and the service is always excellent. So super friendly. They even recognize when we call and remember what we get! I always get the veggie korma and the hubs gets chicken tikka masala or chicken korma. And they all are absolutely delicious every time. We honestly don't go anywhere else for our Indian food. Love you guys! Thank you!
One of my favorite places to go for AYCE Indian lunch buffets. Staff is friendly & efficient. I love the decor as well! Consistent, delicious & great customer sevice
The service was great and good food, but they charge extra for rice!
I love their buffet. They had briyani when we were there for lunch a few weeks ago. Friendly server.

I'm a foodie for Indian and many places in town do not have the variety as Delhi Indian. Their selections are vegan friendly, meat, and they even have some salad/desert bar. The service was by far the best, staff is very friendly and accommodating. Looking forward to my next visit.

Great atmosphere. One of the best waiters we ever had!! The is the first time eating Indian food and because of the perfect wait staff it won't be the last! ( haven't got our dishes yet so can't say on the food yet! Our bread with sauces ( in the pic) is great though)

By the way the food was perfect also! Got to try the garlic naan too. Been in vegas almost a week and hands down the best place we ate so far and definitely the best service! Thank you Dehli!
Great food. Some of the best Indian food I've had. Ate their Tahli, and each portion was perfect in every way. The waitstaff was also professional, helpful and pleasant. I wish they were closer....

And the NEW Undisputed Indian Champ of LV is......Delhi

Just a week ago I went to another 4.5 star Indian Buffet off Sahara and there's no comparison - Delhi's so much better and I need to revisit Mint to see if it unseats it but I"m pretty sure it does.

Their lunch buffet selection is ridiculous with Biriyani, Goat Cury, Chicken Curry, Tandori, and many other specialties.  They switch it up as I've been a few times and everything is done better than Mt Everest Indian.  The goat curry here had better flavor and was more tender.   When they bring you the naan, it's piping hot made to order chock full of garlic.  I went to play a poker tournament after and this definitely helped me force a couple folds.

They have a great check in deal where you get a free Lassi or soda - gotta go with the Mango Lassi. 

I've yet to come for dinner but if their lunch buffet is this good i'm sure it will also deliver!

Food is great, service is awesome. We are in Las Vegas on a trip. We will surely come here again whenever we visit Las Vegas. There are lot good things like customer care, light Hindi music, interior etc.,. One thing which I didn't like is the lack of cleanliness in the restroom (actually it was in too too bad shape to say the least) but I will not reduce the number of stars because they deserve another chance on that.

On the food side had goat biryani liked it, had tandoori chicken super liked it. Today I have ordered chilly chicken looks good I am sure it will taste great!

BEST INDIAN FOOD IN VEGAS! I usually say all Indian food is delicious since I love it so much, but this is definitely the best (next to home made) that I've had. The prices are affordable, the location is clean and the service is fast.  We usually do take out, which I love, because the serving sizes are large. I love bringing the food home and binge watching House of Cards (or anything on Netflix). Add candlelight and the sound of rain falling outside your open window...makes for a romantic night in. Love it!

Hands down the best Indian restaurant I've ever been to. The lunch buffet is cheap and the quality and taste of the food is amazing!  The staff was very attentive by keeping our glasses full and giving us as much naan as we wanted. The garlic naan is delicious and they have a bunch of vegetarian options. My boyfriend eats meat and he was surprised with how many meat options they had as well. I'm so happy I tried  this place, it's soooo good!

This restaurant is big and has a nicer setting than I thought it would. The owner Hari, comes from Tamba on the strip. 

I was dining by myself so I went with the vegetable thali and mango lassi which is free if you check into yelp. My mango lassi was made in a blender at the bar so I could hear it being made from where I was sitting. The mango lassi was icy and tasted watered down. This was the first non creamy mango lassi I have had. 

The samosa filling was well seasoned, not too greasy, but breading was a tad thick. It took 45 minutes for my vegetable thali to come. I am used to Indian restaurants being abnormally fast. 

The presentation of the thali was classy and each dish tasted freshly made. My favorites were the malai kofta and the Kashmir sabji, the rest I could have done without. The malai kofta was well executed and the creaminess of the curry and aromatic spices worked harmoniously. First time I have had the Kashmir sabji and the assorted vegetables seasoned with herbs and spices pairs well with the richness of the malai kofta.  

All the food I had was thoughtfully prepared and freshly made. Hari seems to genuinely care about his customers. After finding out i didn't like my mango lassi he made me another one without the ice. I hope they work on getting the food out in a more timely manner because I do not know anyone that wants to wait almost an hour for Indian food.
Good food, Vegas expensive!! The attendants are over eager to clear your plates. They just hover around the table and it's almost irritating.

Came back last night and I'm trying to decide about removing one star or two.

Came at 5 and was pleased to see more people in the restaurant than the last time we where here. Feels more comforting personally.  

My partner ordered the non vegetarian Dahl thali **(that take out menu, in restaurant menu and online menu all have different items listed for this- be warned) **  which was a great way to try a lot of different items. They serve you small portions dishes, plus rice, naan and a yogurt dip. Such a great deal to try new food. The menu said dessert was part of it but it never came. Out of all the dishes the only one that he didn't like was the lentils. Was too salty. Not sure it that's how it's supposed to be or if it just got over seasoned. 


I ordered whipped spinach with cheese, and goat curry at a spicy level of 7 andJeera Rice( if you never had this before, I HIGHLY recommend this)  and of course garlic naan. What came to the table was different. I got a different goat dish instead of the curry ( tomato base that was thin and soupy) and with very little spice. (My boyfriend order his spice lever at 5 and was stronger than my dishes)  new cook, different cook, waiter miss heard me??  I didn't complain because I hate that at restaurants and didn't want to waste the food. It was still good ( not amazing like last time but again, I got the wrong dish) different chef, off night? 
 
No dessert for the boyfriend 
I was served the wrong dish 

I still really enjoy the food I was served and my evening out but these little things kind of bug me. the servers are always nice and great, sometimes a bit slow when trying to wrap things up at the end. I'm just gonna say it was a off night.   Of course I'll be back because everything is still delicious.

My foodie fantasy day two, another 5-star success. I couldn't bring myself to go to a casino restaurant after the long day standing at the World Market Gift Show. So, thank you Yelp for another great find. 

I found Las Vegas' Best Indian Food! No, REALLY they won 2015 Best Indian Food by the Las Vegas Review Journal. Delhi is a very large family restaurant and everyone made sure that everything was perfect. Even a little hiccup was corrected immediately. 

I had the Vegetable Thali for dinner. Ample portion and I couldn't resist the Pani Puri to start. The Chai Tea was rich and creamy. Delhi has earned a place on my Vegas Restaurant list.
They must have changed cooks.  The new food was too spicy for the kids.  We will not be going there again.  They need to have Golan Jamin too.
Visiting from NY, this place is a very authentic Indian cuisine! They can even control the spicy level of your dishes! Also the mango lassi is delicious!

Very comfortable n nice place to eat with great menu n choice of food 
Desert "Gulab Jamun" is very delicious over ther good job guys !!

The ambiance was really nice. The restaurant was bigger than I expected. When we first went in there was only one table occupied which was a little worrying. The people started to pour in after we went in. It wasn't fully packed though. The service was very good. They were constantly checking on us if we needed anything. The prices were a little steep than what we expected. However the serving made up for it. Our group ordered 2 Biryani Chicken (Spicy Level of 3&4), 1 Chicken Masala (Spicy Level 5), and 2 steam rice. We over ordered since we were expecting a smaller serving. We ended up taking home half of each chicken biryani and one steam rice. I would probably comeback for their buffet since it is cheaper than most of the ala carte orders and you'll be able to taste more food.

I've been to the buffet several times. Hari was our wait staff person. Very helpful! The mint chutney is great! Mixed pickle also good. Tandoori chicken yummy. Palak/ saag paneer delicious! Lots to choose from. I love when they have gulab jaman for dessert!! The best buffet so far I've been to in Vegas!
Never had Indian food tried it for the first time . It was good experience staff was great friendly and polite. I d go back in the future to try the lunch buffet.

This is one of the best Indian restaurants you can find in Vegas! I was here when it opened about 2 years ago, and it wasn't known that much! This restaurant has a variety of food that's good for both vegetarians and non-vegetarian! You can tell it's a great restaurant by looking at the crowd that come to the buffet!
Haven't tried any other Indian Restaurants other than Tamna in Las Vegas, the Buffet here, tasted very well, and its cheaper on off-long weekends.

I went with à la carte option, the food was good, but they took a lot of time in serving. If you take it positively, may be a good sign that they were cooking fresh food! I found it little expensive, though.

Delicious food ! Considerate and hospitable with the service. 
We did a to-go. They made tava rotis on special request, even if that is not on the menu. Sweet! 
Would definitely stop by next time if I want Indian food.
Decent buffet for vegetarians. Nothing that stands out. Very good service. Nice and clean.

This place truly surprised me. I took advice from a fellow Eliter on this place. I'm totally glad I did. I'm totally not one for Buffets but this place had really fresh food. None of the food tasted like it's been sitting there a while. A lot of buffets run into that problem. 

Lunch buffet was all you can eat for $9.99. Great deal!

Restaurant was big and spacious so you aren't on top of one another. Service is meh. The servers really don't know the food too well. I was quite nervous eating there because I have a tomato allergy. Server didn't know the sauces too well so I had to be selective on what to eat. Sucks but at least I was smart in my food picking. I asked the server what was in the sauce like spices and such and all he kept saying was "it's cream based" over and over. Like I get that but what else is in it???? At least go ask a manager or a cook?!

Malai Kofti (fried vegetable balls in sauce) was my favorite part of the meal. A sauce unlike I have had in a while with yummy fried veggies in it. All around amazing.

The vegetable Samosa I expected more. The flaky part was ok but the vegetable middle wasn't what I was expecting: I just dipped it in the Malai Kofti sauce and it tasted better lol

Basmati rice was simple like most places. Hard to mess up. Mixed it with some goat stew and it came out great. 

GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY YOU WILL BE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED.

The buffet was delicious without a doubt. Their bread is also very nice and well seasoned. I'm sure that if I was a fan of Indian good (I came with family), I would've loved it. Getting enough rice seems to help with the spices, but again, definitely great for people who are a fan. The service was amazing. They were very attentive. Although the food was spicy, it was of amazing quality!

The decent indian place of all that i've been in vegas. 

Customer friendly and food is pretty decent.
Only tried a togo order of chicken biryani which didnt disappoint.

Brought the family for lunch buffet on a Sunday. Their lunch buffet is $11.99. A really good price for all the food they offer in their lunch buffet. They have the usual chicken curry, chicken makhani, goat curry, tandoori chicken, chicken biryani, reshmi kabab, etc. For the veggie dishes they had Paneer Saag, Aloo ghobi etc. They had alot more I just cant remember everything. I just remember not being able to decide what to take because there were so many options and my plate was full just have way down the buffet line. They had lots of veggie options including salads, chutneys, pickles, raita and more! 

We had great service from the time we walked in and throughout our entire stay. The servers were friendly and checked on us often. The food was very good. Everything was cooked right and very flavorful. Their regular and garlic naan was soft and delicious. All the food was fresh too, not sitting out for hours. The meat curries and biryani had nice big pieces of meat. Some places have more sauce than meat. I think we found our new favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. We all felt like eating more and more even past the point of not being hungry anymore and stuffing our tummies with extra food.

Good service, great food, friendly staff, clean restaurant and restrooms. Great overall experience and looking forward to coming back.

I had a GREAT Indian lunch here. The lunch buffet was huge with a very good selection. The food was HOT just the way it is supposed to be. The chicken was very tender and moist. The service was spot on. I will definitely be letting my friends know about this great restaurant.

My sister and I we were craving Indian food for dinner , I've been to mint, Mt . Everest, Indian oven.. hands down we found the best one yet, Delhi Indian Cuisine is truly the best. And the setting is great, Hari the one who help us was awesome. Don't think twice about it, eat  and enjoy..

Came here for lunch buffet on Sunday afternoon. Being from the bay area we are very familiar with Indian buffets and we were pleasantly surprised by this place. It is clean and has a lot of great selections for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. In terms of veg selections I remember seeing samosas, pakoras, palak paneer, chole, dal makhani, malai kofta, idli sambar, gulab jamun, salad, naan, rice, indo/chinese noodles. A lot of options. I particularly enjoyed the malai kofta and the palak paneer. I'd come back again if in Vegas and craving Indian food. 

Note: $18 taxi ride from Vdara to Delhi Indian Cuisine (take Uber instead b/c it will most likely be cheaper).

Best Indian buffet I've ever had.  10 min drive from the strip near UNLV.  Big lunch buffet selection including meat dishes.  Everything was good and only $11 for lunch. 

My favorites: goat curry and chicken biryani.  Goat curry had lots of sauce was good for dipping the garlic naan.  Naan was fresh from the oven and doughy (a bit too doughy).  Indian buffets usually have little spice to cater to the masses, but not Delhi.  Actually had good flavor and decent spice level. 

Get the mango lassi too.  You won't be disappointed.  5 stars overall.

We came here for dinner after checking the high rating in yelp. It took 20 minutes for us to even get a waiter. Another 20 minutes for our beer to come. We ordered bhindi masala and goat biryani. Apparently no curry comes with a side .. Which is disappointing.. We ordered tandoori roti .. After 40 minutes wait .. Finally our food arrived .. Goat biriyani had 4 small pieces of goat .. Thats it! My bhindi masala tasted blant and had the top head of bhindi in it ( which is typically discarded as garbage) .. It took us forever to get our bill .. So once we gave our credit card we had to wait 20 more minutes.. So we just went to cashier instead.. So in the end .. We arrived at 7.55 and left at 9.35! And irony is it was just two of us and we didn't order much .. Its totally unprofessional and hotel management should really look into this .. We were so tired waiting that instead of playing in casino we just hit the sack!

I am Indian and am disappointed with restaurants' lack of proper flavor 90% of the time.  This place is different.  The lunch buffet gives you tons of options, and the dishes are prepared with care and taste delicious.  The tandoori chicken is moist, the pakoras have great flavor, and the garlic naan was right up there with the best I've ever had.  I'm going back immediately to try some dishes off the dinner menu!  The most telling detail about this place is that every single customer was Indian, not surprising at all for a place of this caliber.

What an excellent surprise!  Babygirl and I were out shopping in the area and were arguing - oops, I mean "discussing" our options along Maryland Parkway, and had finally reluctantly agreed to go to Jason's Deli, Turned out, the parking lot was jammed, it was unseasonably hot for October, and we were ready to turn that car around and go home when I remembered that the old soup place in the next lot over was now an Indian place. I admit I didn't hold out much hope, but it's a cuisine of which we are mutually fond, and I figured we could find SOMETHING good on the menu.

Yee hah! Turns out they featured the ubiquitous lunchtime buffet, so we could try it all. 
The tandoori chicken was surprisingly moist, the butter chicken rich and tasty, and the curry had a satisfying kick. There were lots of vegetarian options involving rice, lentils, spinach, etc., which I never got to. Not because I don't like them; I happen to believe that All Foods Matter, but I had slurped up so much sauce with that nice hot naan, that I had to tap out. Did manage to wash down a big glop of sweetened carrots that made a fine, if unintended, dessert.

Might have been a four star, but it's getting five because there was actual meat in all those steam table trays, not just the sauce with a few barely detectable chunks as is too often the case at Indian buffets. Good job. 

Highly recommend that next time you're in the area, skip the "Deli" and hit the "Delhi".

(Did you see what I did there? Hee hee hee).

Very poor service 
Too slow. Took forever to take the order and then we had to wait 1 hour to get the food. 

That too at non peak hours
The restaurant was 20% capacity.  

Very slow. Went by the yelp reviews but poor service

This buffet was amazing! This is the first time I've been here and I was impressed with the variety and freshness of the food. The curry chicken and the chicken tandoori were especially delicious. As a lover of spicy foods, this buffet was right up my alley.

The price was reasonable, considering the quality of the food and the atmosphere of the dining area. They do have gluten free/vegan/vegetarian options as well. Overall, 5 stars for a great dining experience.

I LOVE this buffet! And that's saying something, because I have been a die hard fan of Mint for some time now, but.... I gotta give props to Delhi, mainly because of CUSTOMER SERVICE!

There is one guy, HARI! He is amazing. The first time, we came here as a huge group for Norm's UYE, and despite there being around 14 of us, he made sure our glasses and Nan were never empty! Very attentive, and always on it.

The next time I visited, I brought my mother. Again, Hari made sure to come over and check on us, chit chat a bit, and make sure we had everything we needed. I reminded him that I came with the huge Yelp group, and he gave me a warm welcome back.

All the food is fabulous, and if you come during the early daytime rush, it is VERY fresh. Yes, there will be a bit more people there, but it's worth the wait.

My favorites from the buffet include the Goat Curry, the Navratan Korma, Gulab Jamun and the Tandoori Chicken. Mmm, just writing about it now is making my mouth water. And that's just a short listing of all the choices Delhi has to offer on any given day.

You have to go and try for yourself. Make sure you say hi to Hari for me!

My wife and I decided to step out of our respective offices the other day for a quick lunch and this was the spot of choice.  And what a great choice it was!! They have a buffet style lunch with all kinds of great dishes for just $10.99.  I tried a little bit of everything, including my favorite aloo gobi. It was all delicious.  Literally nothing on the buffet I didn't like. The garlic naan was great too. Service was fast and efficient, and our drinks never ran dry.  We were in and out quickly, with tummies full to polish off the rest of the work day. We will definitely be back.

Very much disappointed with the quality of food. I ordered for kardhai paneer. They give us kardhai paneer in a simple bowl instead of kardhai and the taste was horrible. Also ordered for kulcha, but it looks like something else. I am very disappointed with the quality of food. HORRIBLE#
This was my first time eating Indian food ever! And be experience was amazing. I suggest it to everybody.

I was like you once. Looking on yelp for the best indian food option. Knowing that these places on the strip weren't worth their prices but wondering what other joints still offer good food, good service, and nice atmosphere (because, hey, you're vacationing in Vegas and you don't need to be slumming it at some filthy ethnic place to save $10 you'll just lose on a side bet anyways). Well, this is the answer. Do not look at any other reviews because New Dehli is where you want to go.

Just a few months old, it has a slew of positive reviews and -- as great as the food was (there is a mango lassi free with your check in that you MUST get) -- the pride the staff/owners put into the restaurant is apparent with every detail of the restaurant. From the decor to the menu to the EXCELLENT service, New Dehli is what comes to mind (for me, at least) when we talk about "shopping local". This is their restaurant and I saw in my visit that the owners truly care about this place. These folks took out a space in a shopping center (plenty of parking!) and have created a truly sincere dining experience. Maybe it's not something I can explain well -- but if you'd like to understand, swing by New Dehli on a Thursday evening and take in the experience. Never have a rooted this hard for a restaurant in a city I've only been visiting.

Awesome food choices . the spice level was good as well . Very neat and clean . very helpfull staff . The Gajjar halwa and kheer were simply amazing . 
we went for buffet they had good choices for both veg and non veg  and a lot of items for both. garlic naan and chowmein were also very very good. i would definetly recommend them to all my friends and family visting Vegas .

Came here for buffet with friends, and boy it was amazing. Indian buffet was only $9.99. This is the cheapest buffet in town. Everything is tasty, they have 5 vegetarian and 5 non vegetarian options. They even put out tandoori chicken and chicken kabab together. Gulab Jamun for buffet thats crazy, never have i seen someone put gulab jamun for buffet.
One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at. We were here last year and couldn't remember the name. Literally drove by all the Indian restaurants in the area until we found it. Worth the effort!
Great place to eat ask for José he Will explain how to eat or anything. Will be back here next year for sure. Try the samosas and the dessert yummi

Whenever I come to Las Vegas this is where me and my Indian friends come to eat.  The food is great the service is impeccable also the owner is a great guy. I threw a surprise party for my wife at Vdara they were kind enough to cater this event for my wife at the last minute everyone was raving about the food I would encourage anyone who visits Las Vegas to stop by and have a Taste of India

Delhi Indian Cuisine, you have become my favorite!  I went a few weeks ago for the buffet, and as buffet goes I think this one is one of the stand outs.  I loved each curry I tried, where in alot of places flavor does not separate  each dish. But for each choice at Delhi Indian Cuisine, I could taste a different recipe.  I also had the mango lassie.  It helped anytime i had a super spicy curry.  The only downside was that it was such a small glass. Honestly I would drink a gallon of lassie if they served it to me.  The selection was great, I really though the naan and the tandori chicken was the best I have had in a while.  And to finish off a perfect buffet lunch, the mango custard was amazing.  I will be back.  And I can't wait to take my friends.

Service: 5 Stars 
Food: 5 Stars (well, I really like the goat curry, garlic naan, Khir...)
Ambience: 5 Stars

Yelp check in: free lassi/soda

What more can I say?  Just try it for yourself!

We decided to visit this place within 2 minutes based on the reviews and directly drove from the airport for a weekday buffet. Since it was a weekday the restaurant was not busy, 3 or 4 tables were occupied. 
The food was delicious, and the buffet had a good variety of both veg and non veg options. The naan was served to table and it was one of the best I have had until now. The food was hot and fresh, and the staff were very courteous. The reason for 4 star is not all the items tasted good, biriyani, noodles, and idlis tasted below average. 
Overall the food was delicious, and would visit again when I am in the area.

This is the 2nd time we've eaten here and both times were quite good. It's not nearby or we'd go even more frequently! Prices are reasonable and there are a LOT of vegetarian options in addition to the standard (and not so standard) meat dishes. The spice scale is reasonable - a 5 has some heat but not light your mouth on fire - but they can get it nice & spicy if that's your taste. No one at our table had less than 5 so not sure how mild they can go for the non-spice lovers but they seemed very eager to accommodate. Service was very attentive. Plentiful parkDefinitely worth checking out!

Best Indian Lunch Buffet in Las Vegas!

This place has been open for about a year, but as you can see has already received accolades from over 200 Yelpers. I was introduced to this restaurant by my Indian friend who assured me it was the best in town. For $10.99 (or for that matter at any price) this lunch buffet is outstanding. It has a 35 display of savory meats and vegetables from traditional tandoori chicken to a goat stew. Admittedly, passed on the goat, but everything else was great, including the desserts. A complimentary freshly-baked nan (garlic or plain) comes with each order.  Spacious and clean and an A Health Department rating completes the offering.

I honestly don't have much to say. I ordered this on postmates, and since there's no photos on postmates I decided to reference Delhi Indian Cuisines website. In their photo it looks like the whole dish is filled with chicken. Pictured is what it looks like. You can't even tell if there's chicken in there and you get about 7 tiny pieces of chicken. There's no rice or no bread that comes with the dish(On their website there is some bread that seems to accompany the dish).
