Now I wouldn't be upset if this was less than $10, but for $15 this is absolutely absurd. If you want something similar you can just go to Curry Zen and for $10 you get far more food for the money. I don't suggest anyone to visit this place as long as Curry Zen exists. Yes it's a little different but I'd much rather suggest them.

Went to dinner with my husband and was blown away by both the service and the food! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. There were two managers on and both of them checked on us which is always nice. The food was phenomenal! Our server recommended the Vindaloo and told us the Tikka Masala was their most popular do we tried both, and while both were good the Vindaloo was out of this world! We will be going back soon and I highly recommend it.

Best Indian food ever. We tired almost all Indian restaurants in and around Vegas and this is the outstanding one. Sumptuous food, warm welcoming, and quick service are their attractions... I recommend everyone to try food here when you visit Vegas

CANT BE BEAT!!! This is my all time fav place to eat in Vegas. Where else can you get a wide variety or veggie and meat selections in a takeout or dine in form?!?( serious question...let me know) I love Indian food and Dahl Indian Cuisine NEVER disappoints.
Great food. Visited twice once for buffet and once a la carte and everything tasted good. Service was good as well. No complains. Highly recommend.

Food was delicious! Owner was super nice too! He came and talked to us and even offered me and my friend free mango dessert drinks~! 

They have a great selection in the buffet and you can't beat the price! 

I'll definitely return ~
And I highly recommend this place.

Food is mouth watering and service is awesome.
They do care for your comfort, your oder and your taste

I would recommend to give it a try for once.

By far the best food during my Vegas stay. I spent two weeks vacationing in Vegas and went to several restaurants everyday.   For dinner I had a yellow curry lamb dish. This dish is in my top three rated dishes of life. The chicken masala was the best that I've had. This place's lunch buffet easily beat out Caesar's palace buffet and was a fourth the cost.  I I will eat here anytime I'm in Vegas.

A great value Indian cuisine buffet. We arrived right when they opened on a Thursday. We were sat at a booth and it obviously was not crowded at all. Many patrons who were already seated were of Indian descent which is always a good indicator of authenticity. There were also a few locals. Our server came along a few minutes later and we ordered naan bread and a mango lassi and went to work on the buffet. 

I loved the curry selection and they had a variety of typical Indian cuisine meats such as goat and lamb as well as chicken. Tandoori was spot on and the only thing I didn't care for was the spinach. At the end of the line there was a variety of soups and some dessert and fruit selections which were delicious! My favorite was the semiya payasam which was creamy and thick with noodles in a milky soup. The mango lassi order took some time to come out since it was forgotten the first time but it did come out right in time for desert which was fine. Overall price for the buffet was well-worth it for two people under $30! Definitely would come back!

OUTSTANDING! 

When we walked in, we had our doubts.  The restaurant is pretty big, and the decor is very nice.  But it was 7:30PM and the place was literally empty.  Not one other customer.  Normally, this would have turned us off, but we decided to give it a try because of the good reviews on Yelp.  We were not disappointed.  My Butter Chicken was not the best I've ever had, but it was delicious with the perfect amount of spice.  My nephew said that his Tikka Masala was the best he's ever had.  He lives in Vegas and commented that he has a new "go to place" for Indian.  Our vegetable samosa's were very nice as well, but the reason I have to give five stars is because of the Chicken Pakora's.  They had the perfect amount of breading in comparison to the chicken.  The outside was just crispy enough, and the chicken on the inside was moist, tender, and juicy.  They were without a doubt the best pakora's I've ever had, and I've been to Indian restaurants all over the world.  The service was very friendly, and quick (granted, we were the only ones in the restaurant), and the prices were surprisingly reasonable.  Give Delhi Indian Cuisine a try if you are in Vegas and want a fantastic Indian meal.  You will not be disappointed!

Did takeout. Ordered following items. 
Mango Lassi - Bad
Chicken Soup & Sev Puri - Decent
Plain Naan - Worst I have ever had, it was so thick..felt like I was eating uncooked dough.  
Butter chicken - Decent
Fish masala - Bad
Yellow Daal - Decent
Chicken Fried Rice - Horrible & without salt. 
Gulab Jamun - Decent 
Gajar Ka Halwa - Bad
In short.. never again.

This is my Indian place to go in Las Vegas. They have really good varieties and everything tasted good. 
My favorite is goat curry and tandoori chicken. Their naan is very fluffy and awesome. Mango lassi is great as well. Servers are friendly and attentive. Overall, it's worth the money that you spent for an Indian buffet.

I have been to 4 other Indian buffets in Vegas but none of them made me crave their food as badly as this place. 

The service here is not always the best but it's getting better in recent months. You may need to wait a little longer to get their attention especially if you don't look Indian. I don't really care because their food compensates for everything else. 

My favorite buffet dish is Malai Kofta. Just dip your fresh naan bread in it and you will know what I mean. Kebabs are also really good. 

They tend to rotate their buffet dishes throughout the week but removing Malai Kofta on certain days is the crime against the part of humanity they made addicted to it!

Came in for lunch buffet. Great variety. All delicious. The vegetable samosas were my favorite. Crust was light and crispy filling was moist. I've had samosas elsewhere that were doughy and dry. The goat curry is definitely worth a try. They come in big chunks, lean and tender.

It'll be a sin to steal a star from Delhi Indian Cuisine, they come to be party with the most delicious food and an all star buffet backed by a very friendly host. Oh, did I tell you about the tall glass full of real mango lassi that's free of psychological pricing at three dollars?

If you want north Indian food while on the strip, don't waste a moment before you decide to drive to Delhi Indian Cuisine.

We had a lunch buffet

Food spread was just okay and not the best taste

Will do just for one time if you are looking for Indian food
Fantastic Indian buffet for lunch. Chicken tika and curried goat were excellent. Great service and atmosphere. Very good variety.
Excellent food and service! Ordered yellow dhal, chole and bhindi masala. It was outstanding. Would strongly recommend this place

I'm so glad i decided to have Indian cuisine for the first time.  It was delicious!  I tried the garlic namn bread n the regular.  Regular one was my favorite.  The price was very reasonable. The buffet is the way to go of you're new to it.  I tried a bite size of everything then went back for seconds of my favorites. Loved the goat curry... but many others were great.  Namn bread is brought freshly made.

This is another good Indian restaurant in Vegas. This restaurant's goal is high volume, as is apparent with its large layout and seating capacity (100+ people could dine here). The buffet is great, with the chili and tandoori chicken dishes being my personal favorite.

This place is good - it bills itself as "The Largest Indian Buffet in Las Vegas." It has about two or three steam trays/food serving stations, and it's all typical Indian buffet stuff - well-done tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, goat curry, biryani (I believe it was chicken), basmati rice, salad, and typical desserts - cut-up fruit, kheer, etc. It's reasonably priced (about $11 or $12) and well worth eating at if you're visiting the nearby Museum of Atomic Testing, or shopping at the Best Buy, Target, Men's Wearhouse, etc. while taking a break from the Strip.  There are also no gambling machines, so that's also a nice break from the Strip. I've eaten here three or four times, and will definitely continue to eat here when I'm in town.

I was lured in by the good yelp reviews, found myself in Vegas wanting some really good chicken tikka masala,  it wasn't terrible but I wasn't impressed. I like my food spicy so I ordered 7 out of 10 for the spice level.  When my food came out I was very surprised with the portion size I received a bowl of sauce and 8 of the smallest chunks of chicken, some which were dry while other pieces were mushy. The level of spiciness was perfect but the flavor of the food just wasn't there for me.  Service was great but the place was empty.  I wouldn't come back again.
Amazing food and service! Highly recommended! We had the paneer tikka masala and paneer shahi with garlic and plain naan. Best Indian food in LV!

Our cravings were satisfied indeed! Chicken biriyani was amazing (5 stars). Chicken tikka masala with plain naan bread was ideal especially if you only eat chicken breast. I also got free mango lassi was delish!
Worst Indian restaurant.. chicken was not fresh at all.. curries were tasteless. Don't go for buffet here.. 1 star because its a mandatory to save post!
Tasty! The breads are the best there. Also loved the Malai Kofta! One of the best I had so far.

The food was incredible. Flavorful, very warm, aromatic, and massive in portion. 

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, the Garlic Naan, Steamed Rice, and the Aloo Tikki (Must be a minimum of $25.00 to order for delivery). Everything was packed clean and tight, no spills and no issues. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala is one of their most popular menu options. Now I know why. Creamy, smooth, rich, and especially spicy (if you order it as such). A perfect consistency with large chunks of delicious chicken. The tomato is not overwhelming, the spices don't rule the flavor (saffron is especially nice), and the chicken has a great consistency. I ordered a side of steamed rice, which was incredible for the amount given at $3.00. I expected a tiny bowl, but instead received an entire 6 x 6 to-go box full. 

The Garlic Naan is good. The flavor is not especially strong, it's incredibly soft, not insanely chewy, but chewy enough; great to have just alone as a snack. The portion is large enough to be split between three people or more, and the texture is fluffy with that infamous smoothness of naan. I would honestly prefer regular naan, but that doesn't mean the garlic isn't especially tasty.

The Aloo Tikki numbers in two for $3.00, both about the circumference of a tennis ball. They are thick potatoes cakes, with a smooth interior and an especially crispy exterior. A little on the heavy side, but still delicious. They come with two sauces, one of which is a very close relative of a green avocado salsa, and the other a thick, sweet brown sauce. I have no idea what they are. I prefer them mixed together, because the green is especially spicy and the brown is a little too sweet. Combining or dual dipping evens them out perfectly.

Overall, the meal impressed me. I'm full with so many leftovers for tonight. Everything was absolutely wonderful and the delivery was so quick and efficient. I feel horrible, by the way. I ordered delivery and gave the girl the wrong amount for a tip. I wanted to give her $6.00 instead of $3.00. *Sigh*
Yes LORD! The buffet is amazing!!! It's so comprehensive and the display is also fantastic. Really well seasoned food.

Huge selection of buffet items. Typical Indian buffet. I wouldn't say it's anything really great but I've also had worse so if this is an option and you're looking for reasonably priced buffet, I'd recommend.
Wow! First time here and all I have to say is wow! The food is fantastic!! This may be one of my new favorites. Hint: order the garlic naan, you won't be disappointed.

Food and service were nothing short of amazing.  The menu featured some traditional dishes not seen elsewhere.  Besides a vegetarian menu section, there was also a wealth of vegan offerings.  We will absolutely be back.

Very very good! Had a great first experience. Everything we ordered was hot, full of flavor with the perfect amount of spice. We were here during dinner and had great service. Will definitely be back soon!
Big no to this overpriced flavourless restaurant. Everything is substandard even the yogurt is poor
Very lovely decor! The service from Hari's  was simply superb and completely professional! He's handsome too! The food was amazing, I definitely rate it 5 stars!
Excellent food and awesome service. Our server Krishna was one of the best we have ever experienced. We will definitely visit again.

OMG Yelpers - thanks so much for your recommendations - we were in Vegas for the weekend and didn't want to eat on the Strip. We drove out to this place for dinner because of all of the Yelp reviews and it was fantastic. Everything was delicious and authentic (and spicy!) and the service was great too. We cannot wait to come back - yay!
Wow wow wow.....awesome food.... great customer service. Loved every dish in buffet. Food is fresh and flavors are amazing

I wanted to try this lunch buffet since reading some friends' reviews and I went today.  It's taken the #1 spot in the Indian lunch buffet spot with one restaurant yet to go.

I was there early, about 11;15, and I was the first person in the restaurant.   There soon were several other customers.  It's a very large room with lots of tables laid out well and the buffet is a large area opposite the entrance.

With a check in on Yelp, you get either a mango lassi or a soda free.  It's a good deal for merely checking in.

I ordered garlic naan and then headed to the buffet.  The naan was good but I wish it had more of a garlic flavor.  For the first plate, I had chicken Biryani, a couple vegetable pakoras, a vegetable samosa, a piece of tandoori chicken, some chili chicken, soya badi, and some saag paneer.  Everything I had was very good and I noticed that almost all dishes had a spiciness that I liked.  Of these, the weakest dishes was the saag paneer.  The crust of the samosa was flaky and the filling was very good.  The soya badi was quite good.

For my second plate, I had squash, Navratan korma, chicken curry, and chana masala.  All of these were very good save the squash which was a little nondescript.  I also tried some of their raita which was good.  The chicken curry didn't have very much of a curry flavor but when the juices from the chana masala mixed with the curry juice, it became much better.

Finally, I went back and got one idli and put a small amount of tamarind chutney on it.  It had a soft texture and was good.  I was a but disappointed that they had no dhokla.  I had read Christopher S.' review and I was interested in trying something different.

Overall, this is a very solid buffet and moves to the top tier of Indian restaurants.  The price is now $10.99 but that's still very good considering the wide choice you have with their large buffet.

Service was very good!  Several times, someone stopped by to see how things were.  A woman stopped once and asked me if it was too spicy so they know that they spice their foods.  Plates were cleared before I came back each time.

This is another stop for after hiking when we go to an Indian buffet.  It's a great addition to the Indoian dining in Las Vegas.

Can't say that I liked too much about the food; I am from LA and have had excellent Indian food. It was also way too hot; I have to be very careful when eating spicy foods and like to control the amount of heat. Here, this is impossible since they add the heat. We won't be back.

Mmmmm I love Indian buffets!! Very clean inside, attentive and friendly staff. Used to be a super salad back in the day...we've visited twice so far both for their lunch buffet, and sat where we used to sit way back then :) Can't beat the price when you are craving big plates of spiced comfort food.They have a nice vegetarian selection as noted by other yelpers which my daughter likes and good garlic nann. They also have an assortment of fresh fruits and a small salad area with some chutneys and desserts. Definitely my daughter's favorite which means we'll be back.

Buffet was half empty all the time. People were racing for the naan.
No entree tasted good.
In short other than naan, nothing good to eat here.
Very displeased.

One of the best indian cuisiness i have ever been too.Food was delicious.Service was great.Food was Halal.What else would you expect.They even ask you how we want our food?Spicy or not.I recommend everyone this restaurant.

Great dishes for Vegan folks. I'm also gonna gues.its really authentic cause I was like the only non Indian looking white guy in there but then again i have nothing to go off.


Food was delicious but really spicy for my liking.

I'll go back anyday.

My wife and I have gone here on several occasions for the lunch buffet. The food is great and delicious. The service is always professional and prompt. The prices are average for what quality Indian food usually costs. There's plenty of parking but I'm not a big fan of the area. If you don't mind panhandlers walking around the parking lot, then nothing to worry about. Great place!

I came here today 45 minutes before their lunch buffet closed and it was a good experience. 

We were sat promptly as our party was already there. They have about 12 hot dishes that range from curries to rices and then a salad bar.

The stand outs were the chicken curry, goat curry, and the chicken tikka masala. They also gave our table two orders of garlic naan. The naan was piping hot and full of garlic.

I would say the amount of meat in the curries was minimal but given it was a buffet I understood. Plus the flavors of all of the curry dishes were each so delicious and unique that the sauce with naan was enough for me.

I'm used to having curry in a non AYCE setting and I don't know if I'll ever do that again. The value of the buffet was really good for the variety.

I also liked their fried onion fritters, the veggie samosas, and their rice and chicken dish. I don't know any of the names but everything was worth a try.

The staff was solid for a buffet as in those 45 minutes I had my drink refilled about 5 times. They also cleaned up our plates before I got back from each trip the buffet line

They also had this spice mix when you leave up front that was full of spices they used like dinner mints which was cool to try.

I like the value, the restaurant staff, the decor, and definitely the flavors. For $35 after tax for three people it's an excellent value and I'll return very soon.

Chicken tikka masala that is comparable is about $15 at most establishments on its on so this was awesome.

We had the lunch buffet. It is a great way to try lots of things. They brought us fresh naan and garlic naan. It was fresh and delicious. There were lots of meat and vegetarian dishes. It was a bargain for at 11.99 a person.
Such good food!! The chicken tikka masala was amazing. Definitely will be coming here again.

I come here for the perfectly seasoned and cooked goat curry, but all of the many items are great. It's not far from the strip, but it's mostly a locals spot. It's affordable priced and they offer free Naan. DIC is always busy but has plenty of space.

All VEGAN and VEGETARIAN  items are clearly marked. They have a meat section and a veggie section. The staff really care that you have a good experience. The manager named "Hari" is just AMAZING.  For lunch buffet it is fast and dependable. The quality is consistent from day to day...which is very good. For weekend Sunday is my favorite day to go. I eat a huge pile of noodles that are "asian-indian fusion" along with Samosas, Lentil Soup and what-ever else I can before I "pop". Yummy 
UPDATE : Nov 6th just went there again today. It was great and fresh
Unassuming and amazingly delicious. If you like Indian and Nepalese food you gotta try it.

Norm K invited a bunch of Yelpers to eat here for the lunch buffet. I wasn't expecting my taste buds to be delighted at almost every bite or for everything here to taste good and fresh, but that's pretty much what I got.

You know the rule of thumb about places that largely serve their own demographic, right? Well, I got really excited when I walked in and saw tables and tables full of Indian customers. It's such a huge place that I'd almost call it a dining hall rather than a dining room, and there were plenty of tables available for our group. Wish the lighting wasn't so dim, but that's a minor issue.

Naan, either standard or garlic depending on what you ask for (I think the garlic actually gets too soggy, but table majority ruled), is brought out by servers as needed. The rest of the food and condiments are in the buffet line. Starting from the front of the line, you run meats, veggies, and sauces/desserts. I'll just list what I had:

- Tandoori chicken: the one without sauce; luckily, only a little dry as opposed to the considerably or ridiculously dry fare at other places.
- Chili chicken: reminiscent of some Chinese fried chicken offerings, but pretty sweet, not too spicy, and definitely fresh as opposed to what you might expect at an Asian buffet.
- Chicken curry: can't recall the flavor exactly, but I'm sure it was good.
- Chicken makhani: aka butter chicken, definitely a favorite of mine at Indian restaurants. Rich and delicious here as well.
- Goat curry: tasty, somewhat fatty, typical gaminess of goat meat. Delicious.
- Chicken biryani: chicken and rice dish, kinda sour but still not noticeably dry.
- Vegetable pakora: a fried vegetable dish, wasn't very special but could pair with something like the saag paneer
- Vegetable samosa: fried pastry stuffed with potato, good filling to crust ratio, crunchy on the outside and warm on the inside, not too spicy if at all spicy
- Saag paneer: creamy spinach with cheese. Didn't even pick up cheese until round 2, so I was pleasantly surprised. Tastes good until you get really full. "Hey ma, I ate my veggies!"
- Navratan korma: curry with cheese and potato, or at least those were the only two I fished out of the buffet tray. Pretty tasty, worth it even for meat-eaters like myself.
- Tamarind sauce: sweet sauce that you can dip naan in. Helped to combat the sour taste when I accidentally bit into something unpalatably sour from the chicken biryani.
- Mint sauce: light, and as minty as you would reasonably expect. I didn't really try pairing this with as many of the dishes as I should have, but I'm sure it would complement something well.
- Gutab jamun: I probably have had this before, but I'll be darned if any place has made it this good. Great warm dessert dumpling in a sweet sauce. Wish I'd had room for more!
- Kheer: rice pudding available next to the fruit, mildly sweet and probably should be eaten before you overwhelm your mouth with gulab jamun

I haven't gone out of my way to try every Indian restaurant around my hometown of San Jose or around the Vegas area, but Delhi Indian Cuisine serves through and through the best Indian food that I've had so far, period. The buffet thing is icing on the cake as it hardly detracted from the quality and was a tremendous value at $11. Fair warning, though: it was a busy Sunday lunch, and I don't know if the weekday holds up. Go as early as you can for freshness, perhaps?

An excellent Indian buffet with delicious vegetable, rice,proteins and salads!  Service was very attentive.   The wonderful variety of Indian dishes were seasoned well, plentiful,and fresh; not sitting on a steam table drying out our becoming soupy. The garlic naan was the best we've eaten.   Really,  the buffet is excellent and well worth the cost.  . . It is a terrific value, a lovely setting, good service and a delicious dining occasion!

Simply the best service! So friendly and sincere & the food was too notch. I was so excited I forgot to take a picture of the presentation but it least I took one of the aftermath..... So good I couldn't finish it all. I will be back for sure and will mark this as one of my favorite spots.

Does Delhi Indian Cuisine serve the best Indian food I've tried?  Sadly no.  Do they serve the worst I've tried?  Far from it.  Simply put, Delhi Indian Cuisine is average if not slightly above.  I went with a group of Yelpers for a Sunday lunch buffet.  I was impressed by the overall number of dishes to try and found the $10.99 price to be quite fair.  Not being one to shy away from new foods, I tried a sampling of nearly all the options Delhi has to offer from meat dishes to vegetarian.  I even tried the curried goat, a protein new to me.  It wasn't bad but there was nothing about it that made me think "oh my goodness, this is awesome." In fact, that is true for basically everything I tried.  There was nothing that I wanted to push aside but there was also nothing I wanted to go back up to serve up seconds of.  I had their chicken makhani and chicken tikka masala which are typically my favorites at an Indian restaurant.  Both were good just not spectacular.  My biggest disappointment was the saag paneer.  I got a nice healthy scoop of saag but had trouble finding the paneer.  Its a good thing I like creamed spinach because that is about all it was.  At least on my plate.  I did see others with paneer on their plates so maybe I just got the bottom of the barrel before it was refilled.  At the other end of the buffet bar, I did like the desserts quite a lot.  I tried and thoroughly enjoyed the galub jamun and the syrup those little dough balls are in.  There was a rice porridge or pudding of sorts that was tasty too.  Sweet, cool and refreshing on a balmy summers afternoon.  In the end, the food was fine but the company was better.
Best food. Great price. I also ready like the Buffet special. Very authentic and great for vegetarians.

We had to get off the strip for a little, and we wanted some Indian food for lunch. This hit the price point and the relaxed environment we were looking for.

I thought it was a good price for the quality and selection. I thought the Curry Chicken and Butter Chicken could have used a deeper flavor, but all of it was pretty tasty. The Chicken Tandoori was pretty dried out so that would be the only dish I recommend skipping.  The Garlic naan was made fresh whenever you ran out and was very good.

If you are vegetarian the buffet gets even better for you. They had a number of choices that were flavorful. Paleek Paneer is a personal favorite.

Had lunch here. The buffet had a great selection and the food was yummy.. Great flavor - love the mango lassi and the chicken curry.. Very nice ambience- kinda simple but I'm all about the food.. I recommend this place..
Nice food. Their Garnic naan is good. Its better than few other places in Vegas. Their staff is nice too. Its basically owned by Nepali couple. Buffet is $10.99 plus taxes.

I do not consider myself an expert in Indian food at all.  I just know what tastes good.  I'm from Southern California, and there are 2 authentic Indian food restaurants where I'm from.  Delhi Indian Cuisine is right there in line with them.  I love their food, the servers and even owner are very nice.  They always ask you how the food is.  I come here so much that I'm almost a regular.  I haven't been to the lunch buffet yet, I've only eaten dinner here.  The portions are huge enough for two people.  I love this place
Excellent service, delicious food, and reasonable prices. I kinda wish I had come for the buffet because it looks like it was enormous.

Oh boy!  My sister found a great South Indian Buffet in Vegas (via yelp, of course!) Fantastic buffet spread!  I especially like that they have Chicken Biryani, Saag, Dhal, Butter Chicken, the most tender Tandoori Chicken and lots of other items too many to mention.  All were good!  There were 2 kinds of naan brought to the table and helped me to try out all the different curries in the buffet.  Eat all dishes with bites of the split jalapeno peppers.  Sure adds that heat in the food.  Dessert was gulab jamun and kheer.  

Will be back!
Great food affordable prices. Really can't go wrong with their lunch buffet. Their Garlic Naan is amazing!

I tried a lots of indian buffet in CA. This Indian Have the most varieties. The goat curry and chicken curry are my favorite! And the buffet is worth your money. 
The service is excellent, Ashmita always come and ask if me and my friends need any thing and add water for US.

I just spent a weekend in the DC area. I took my friend here with the promise she would not be disappointed. And of course, Delhi was on point. I love the chicken rolls masala and veg Khorma and the bread with the fruit and nuts, paratha maybe. It's all amazing.

My first experience with Indian Cuisine, very good! First of all, the place looks great, very clean and great service, all the staff is friendly and attentive. I tried the buffet, keeping in mind that is the first time I try Indian Cuisine and I don't have any other experience to compare with, I liked it a lot!!! The garlic bread is really good, I tried all the vegetarian plates; I was a little worried about the food being very spicy, but it wasn't. Overall I enjoyed the food and will definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Before entry into the restaurant, the parking lot for the restaurant was very room. The moment you enter the front door, you can sense a classy vibe that is being emitted from with in. All the tables have cloth napkin and wine glass style cups that were set already. Inside the restaurant it was very well designed, tables were placed in a well designed arrangement, and in the back near the kitchen entrance there is a bar. The workers are very tentative to every customers needs. 

The food that we ate was the Butter Chicken, the chicken was presented in a curry pot, the color of the of the curry is a bright dark orange, the aroma from the food smelt like tomato with the smell of curry, a very sweet aroma. At first taste, you can taste the butter, cream, curry and, tomato. The texture of the chicken was very smooth and soft. The flavor from the butter chicken gave a buttery/creamy/curry taste and a sweet smell in your mouth.

This was a first time having Indian Cuisine and the service was great, I highly recommend this restaurant.

I was craving Indian food so I came here based on recommendations on yelp. the place including the bathroom is very clean. staff is super friendly and nice. the food was excellent. I tried everything on the buffet and they were all tasty. I especially loved the goat curry but I love curry in general. when u sit be sure to ask for garlic naan.  I was searching for saag paneer but it was displayed so I asked and they said they had run out but they made a small bowl for me. it was excellent as well. the buffet is only available for lunch and they temporarily close from 3-5pm so they can change for dinner. I think I found my Indian lunch buffet place. oh it's $10 which is cheaper than other places. I'd definitely be back for sure!!!
The Guy Krishna, was awesome, Food is really nice and Good..!! Its a good place for eating spicy food..!!

Ok so I like to try many indian restaurants when I go on vacation...and this is awesome! Felt like home cooking....Sunday brunch....must go if you are visiting from out of town....cheaper than a regular buffet.

Been here thrice...and have never been disappointed with the food... everytime i go there, shrimp fired rice is my dish to order.. pani puri there is also one of the best i have ever had...once they were out of pani puri and they went out of their way to get one for us.. i have tried their malai kofta, lachha paratha, bhuna goat, roti, chicken boti kebab, samosa chaat and all of them were exceptionally good... hands down to the chef..
Average food nothing great . But if you are in Vegas with parent who does not eat other than Indian food . Then you can go there but don't expect good quality though .

Oh garlic naan! How I love you!

This place has legit naan! We came to the lunch buffet, the price went up from 9.99 to 10.99, but you get a free mango lassi with Yelp check-in.

Being that I'm a weirdo and I don't try everything, this was momentous for me. The inside was really dimly lit and clean clean. The buffet line was clean and the food didn't look hella old. It actually looked and smelled appetizing. 

My person favorites were Tandoori chicken, chicken curry and butter chicken (that's what my coworker Safi said it was called) I was super impressed by everything! The customer service was great; the food was delicious and hot. For desert we had Gajar Ka Halwaw, my coworker loves this stuff!

We will be back!
Yay!

I love the food environment . It's affordable their chicken biryani, palak paneer are best plus there chilli chicken and reshmi kabab are good. Food variet is owsum gajar halwa , gulam jaman and butter naan and garlic naan are owsum I love this place.
Just tried this place... it was very good.   We tried many new dishes and was delighted with the quality.  Service was exceptional.  Definitely will be back!!!
Sat for 10 minutes- no menus, no drinks, no service.  Tried to seat us at someone else's table.  Won't be back.

Will never order from this restaurant again. I ordered food using the Grubhub app. The restaurant forgot my order of rice and an order of naan. I paid $15 for not even a cup worth of curry, and it didn't taste like mango chicken curry. Then I checked their website and mango chicken curry was not on their menu but it's on the Grubhub app. My other entreé (if you can call it that) I ordered mild and it was so spicy I couldn't eat it.  

Finally, I contacted Grubhub to coordinate with the manager asking for a refund and the manager denied a refund for their horrible service and food. 

DON'T EAT HERE!!! You will be disappointed and it wouldn't surprise me if they paid people to write positive reviews.
Great buffet, service is great, good food for the money cant go wrong with this place

I love Indian food, definitely a favorite cuisine for me. I keep coming back to Delhi and its becoming my new favorite indian restaurant in town. 

It seems this place must do the majority of business during their lunch buffet because each time we have dined in the evening it's been dead. I don't mind a quiet restaurant...actually I prefer to feel like I have a restaurant all to my self but it makes me worried that somehow this restaurant is hurting. I hope not! I would hate to see another great Indian restaurant close. 

The service here is great, the owner is always floating around and managing every aspect. You can tell he is passionate about his restaurant and it really shines through the service and food. 

The Food

Chicken Tikka Masala
Amazing. Perfect balance of cream, tomato and masala spices. Not too oily and great depth of flavor. Chicken is succulent and juicy, only gripe is there is not enough chicken but I deal with it because their sauce is that good.

Naan
Airy pockets with doughy edges and just the perfect amount of seasonings. Heavenly! Always so fresh and so darn addicting and their garlic version is a standout. 

Tandoori 
Have tried both chicken and shrimp. By far my favorite was the shrimp. I've always preferred a shrimp tandoori anyway because there is nothing more visually appetizing than large juicy shrimp and fresh onions and lemons sitting atop a sizzling hot plate. Those sexy soft hissing and popping noises get me every time. 


Matter Paneer 
Well I have had better IMO but it wasn't bad. I think it's too forward with tomato and I'm searching for more creamy notes. Which is silly when you think about it, there is paneer in there and that should somehow be enough, maybe a touch more cream would make it better? I don't know. 

Malai kofta 
Sauce 10! Dumplings 0! Way too dense and I like when they are shaped into round balls instead of those football shaped things. I'm totally just whining here, shape shouldn't matter but the shape coupled with how dense they were just didn't do it for me. But that sauce though! Their cashew based sauces are amazing. 

Gulab Jamun
Again another too dense item but I don't hold that against them. I've experienced the same dense issue at other restaurants regarding this dessert. Maybe was cooked or sitting too long? Not sure.

Mango lassi
Dare I say this was made with canned mango? I hope I'm wrong here but I'm pretty sure it wasn't fresh mango. Still tasty nonetheless especially as the alcoholic version. 

All in all this place is excellent. Great dishes full of flavor and wonderful attentive service. I can't really ask for more!
Pathetic Food Quality, Overpriced for the food they server and they didn't provide any plasticware  either.
Very clean.  Friendly staff.  Food tastes great.  All this for 9.99.  We'll be back over and over again.  Dont forget to try the garlic naan.

This review is for the lunch buffet only. I have came to this place several times, and I return every time I get bored of bland everyday food, and I need spicy flavors with the kind of kick that jolts me out of my culinary boredom. For that effect I specially recommend the Chicken Makhani and Malai Kofta; I usually don't care much for the meat and just get the sauce and dip the Biryani garlic bread in it, then I frantically reach for my ice cold Coke (keep it close). The seasoned rice is also great. Warm atmosphere, friendly service, overall very good experience.

This buffet is very average. There were some items I liked and some that I didn't, but nothing wowed me. 

The sitting area is large and they can hold a good volume of people. The staff was nice, but a little disorganized. We had to let a couple people know before we actually got our naan. The ambiance is very casual and it makes for a nice lunch place.

In the appetizers, the Tandoori Chicken was cold on the outside from sitting out so long and only tasted okay. The Shish Kabob was tasty, but not one of the kinds that I could keep eating. I had a couple pieces and was done. The Samosa, I would rave about. Though the filling had a little too much peas for my taste, they were really yummy. In most samosas, my favorite part is the little end where there is no filling and the dough is crunchy, and in this samosa, all of the dough tasted like that edge piece. Simply wonderful!

One really good thing about this place is that they deliver fresh naan to your table. Other buffets have the naan cut up as part of the buffet, but when there isn't a high turn around, you know those naans have been sitting for a while. Not the case at this place, they offered us plain or butter, but we asked for garlic and they obliged. It did take a little while for the naan to actually come out after we had ordered it, but it more than made up for the wait with the quality. 

The main dishes is where I was most disappointed with this buffet. Chicken Makhani was pretty good. It had good layers of flavor. Unfortunately, at they tray seemed like the chicken pieces were either very small or had been picked through by other guests. The Chicken Curry had no flavor, and I only ate a little. There were a couple of vegetarian options, which was good to see for the vegetarian folk out there. I'm not a fan of brinjal, so I didn't try that, but I did try the Chana Masala, which was decent, although, not my favorite. All in all, there was nothing super exciting in terms of the main dishes.

For desert, I tried both the Gulab Jamun and the Kheer. The Kheer wasn't sweet enough for my taste. The Gulab Jamun, on the other hand, was pretty spot on. They were nice and warm too!

Overall, this buffet did not hold up to its reputation, but it was a good value for the amount of food that you get for the price you pay.

Is it just me or is curry more potent than Thanksgiving turkey? I feel like I need to drift off into a deep slumber every time I have some Indian food! 
But I don't care. It's worth it. 
I've only eaten here for the lunch buffet (about $11- cheaper than most Indian buffets I believe) and have enjoyed it every time. Choose between garlic/butter or just plain naan. Can't go wrong with either. Very flavorful dishes and vegetarian options. Only wish there were more! Usually only one choice for dessert. Employees also prompt and accommodating.

First time trying Indian food

$11-12 for the buffet price

Service was good.. our waters were always refilled before going empty

I had the tandoori chicken, basmati white rice, and naan.. surprisingly it wasn't too bad tasting. I was apprehensive but it was good because the spices weren't overpowering.. not too bland and not too spicy
Having a delicious lunch before I go into work!  Started my lunch off with a free mango lassi! Check in on yelp for a free mango lassi or soda!  So yummy! Always great service too!

Tried their buffet lunch for the first time.  After tax, it's works out for $25 for two, which is amazing deal, considering all the food you get.   The buffet has three sections, two for hot entrees and one for fruit/veggies/dessert.  Everything tasted fresh and was delicious.  Servers were attentive and a manager came over to ask how everything was and if we needed anything.  Definitely recommend.
What a find!!!! Driving by and stopped in with the kids and it's the best Indian we've ever eaten in America!!!! Will definitely be back. Highly recommend the chicken korma. Service also great.

horrible food, i was given the food which was left in the buffet , the chicken tandoori was so hard to chew one can say it is warmed up again in the microwave, tikka masala chicken was same . 
worst experience and horrible food i would recommend 
curry leaf

My wife and I came for the lunch buffet.  The food was excellent in taste and variety.  We had eaten at Mt. Everest a month ago and had tasted it a bit too salty.  The service was excellent.

There seemed to be a good balance of vegetarian/vegan and chicken or goat options.  Nice salad section and 3 dessert choices as well as honey dew, cantaloupe and orange wedges.  Oh, and let me not forget the naan.  We got plain and garlic and both were fresh, tasty and plentiful.  I think next time though, we'll get ALL garlic naan though...it was that good.

We most definitely will be back again.

Rafael

I have been here twice and each time the staff was wonderful, and the food was amazing too. I am a huge fan of Indian food, so finding a buffet that served great quality food, at a beyond reasonable price had me sold. I highly recommend this place. The fresh Naan, that is made to order is delectable, along with the curried goat, and tikka masala was fully of flavor to compliment it all. Although the buffet has only a few choice, there wasn't any lack of flavor or quality to each choice. There is only one thing i would like change and that would be there being more light in the building. I personally like to see what i'm eating and it is awfully dim in there. Besides that, Yelpers please check this place out! It is worth your time, and belly happiness!

I have been craving Indian cuisine for a long time. While I'm stuck here in Vegas I wanted to search for a good place to eat Indian food, and I came across Delhi Indian Cuisine restaurant. It had a buffet which is awesome so I can try new items that I haven't eaten before. Hands down the best food I've eaten. 

Right when you walk in the smell of India hits you with all the spices. The owner and staff are very kind. When I come back to Vegas I will definitely eat here one night. 

If you never tried Indian cuisine you must eat here, and if you have this place is great to enjoy with family and friends before heading out for the night.

Had a fantastic visit today for our Sunday meal. May I start my compliment off by saying this establishment is absolutely phenomenal! Lost in the moment because I can't say enough. Positively tasteful and delicious. Indian buffet serves 7 days a week 11-3PM. Walked in was greeted properly and sat at a very nice and romantic setting. All dishes were fresh and smelt wonderful. Highly rating Delhi Indian Cuisine. 5 Plus stars. Thank you for the wonderful experience.

Buffet starts at 11 and we reached at 11:30. We were surprised food was cold already. Chicken biryani and chicken curry were really good, everything else was okayish. Service was good and very polite.

I ordered a pickup order from here okra this was the best okra I've ever had fresh cooked well not like I usually have it all slimy the food was ready early & I also ordered the veggie rice you could taste the ginger very strong
Tried this first time. Was very tired of whole day roaming on the strip. This place is amazing.
Absolutely the best Indian buffet in Las Vegas. The Naan is out of this world and the Jamun is so sweet. Service is outstanding too.
Possibly the best Indian spot I've ever been to. The Tandoori chicken was better than an Indian wedding I went to with and Indian caterer, and the non-veggie dhali was all around phenomenal.
Loved the food here. We had the lunch buffet and we really enjoyed it. This will be our go to place for Indian food in Las Vegas.

I should have not come here for buffet. Reading so many good reviews made me go there.
There was Samosa, Pakoda, kadhi pakora, fruits, palak, malai kofta, only ONE dessert of halwa. Nothing tasted good and they seem to have used a lot of color in good as well.
such a disappointing Indian food

I don't invest my time in reviewing places that don't shine for me, but rare weird experiences ask of Yelp-catharsis. If you're considering visiting this place, please note that all recent reviews have a trend: poor ratings by reviewers who are most likely connected to the Indian subcontinent; high ratings by others. If you are still coming, then keep your guest service expectations as low as possible. Because of the location and constant flow of touristy customers (who won't return in a hurry irrespective of their experience here), the management seems to care not much for customer service. Sorry folks, this is one atypical case where the Yelp rating is farcically misleading on many fronts. Would I visit this place again? Nope, not even if someone else is willing to pay for my meal.

YELP SHOULD OFFER 10 stars!!!!!!! This place gets it!! absolutely amazing this is the best indian food we have ever had the pleasure eating!!! the staff is awesome and attentive !!?soooooooo worth every penny spent the sheer amount of food lol is crazy!!!!!!!

I used to really love coming here. I feel there have been cutbacks in food and tastes and some seemed leftovers. In the chicken dishes barely any meet and the naan seemed out of bag, not fresh. Granted a buffet but they used to be five star.
The very best food we have had in Las Vegas. Very tasty, adequate spiced and nice served.  All staff was friendly, smiling and with a sense of humor. This was not our last visit!

My coworker and I went here for lunch today because the Mint was too busy.  We arrived around 12:20pm, and the pickings were scarce. No naan. No pokora. They were out and didn't replenish for 1/2 hour. Lentil soup was watery. I think the most aggravating thing was they were just plain out of items and did not replace the whole 30+ minutes I was there. They also have the nerve to kick up the price 2.00 more for lunch. You can't do that if you can't back up the price increase. This was by far one of the worst buffets I have been to. When I complained about the lack of essentials when I went to pay, there was no apology, no "let me take the drinks off." Nothing. A blank stare. I will never go here again. Save your money and take it to the Mint where the food is delish and FULL buffet ALL the time.
Good food amazing gulabjamoon clean and neat restaurant with good customer service what else do you want. Will come back again

Just thinking about the place made me hungry .It`s 11 PM so probably too late for the buffet .But anyway ,Vegas local ,frequent visitor to the Indian buffet and have been to most in town .Yes that crazy ! I started going to this place about 2 months ago , had a gigantic biryani and mango lassi , the chef specializes in the Mango lassi as far as I am concerned! Fan ever since .
First time I went there for the buffet , the garlic bread , the mushroom were fantastic , not to mention the chicken and mutton .I had a feast , no pun intended . Only regret that day was, maybe  I shouldn`t have eaten that much .But by another 3 days the regret vanished and i duly returned ,this time ,they had another special variety of chicken , I am blanking on the name , but i was good , if you end up there just look and sausage like chicken roll,it`s really good . 
When I am not going to this one ,I am probably going to some other one :) .Imagine the embarrassment at showing up at the same buffet ,every other day ! And have to say most of them are similarly priced and probably have similar food range ,but after multiple sampling at other indian buffets I have to say that this one has more options,maybe a little bit cleaner and definitely the most spacious  in town. And would recommend it to anyone who wants to get away from ridiculously priced buffet at the big nightclub restaurants , as long as you like indian food .
As for the negative stuffs , the ambience could be better , i mean they could decorate the walls a little bit better and play some decent music like some upscale places.Sometimes they have hard time catching up with the demand supply thing but i guess this being a new place ,its something they can work on.And  yes sometimes ,there is just that little extra oil floating around in the nan-bread or the curries, again something they can work on .All in all ,for an indian buffet ,it`s bang for bucks. And no I don`t own the place and have nothing against any other Indian buffets.

This restaurant was great, we were greeted immediately, lots of booths and tables, the smells were enticing when you walk in and gets you excited for the food. Only negative was that as you get sat, there is no silverware on the table, instead the silverware were in bins where you pick up your plates to go down the buffet line, sort of like a cafeteria. That might be personal preference though, but it was just an extra piece to carry in my opinion.
Overall great experience. Water was filled at all times, the flavours of the food was amazing, goat curry/chicken curry/biriyani rice were some of our favourites! We will be back!
Worst veg food ever. Everything tasted bad..and they are not courteous. I wouldn't go again .
The food was great and service was amazing. We also got free beverages for checking in on Yelp. I strongly recommend this place for authentic Indian food.
Decent Indian buffet with considerable vegetarian options. Loved the mini samosas. Surprisingly they kept refilling idlis. Enjoyed yummy idli sambar too.

This place is pathetic.. They took more than 45 mins to get our food. The waitress started unreasonable argument with customers when they were unable to handle the crowd. Very bad customer service and food was not even worth it. There are better Indian cuisine places around.
I hate to give even a single star.

Great food! Whenever i travel i automatically dont expect much from ethnic food in really touristy places, ie las vegas, but the food here was actually really good! I always judge my indian restaurants on their malai kofta and this place was right up there with my favorite places. Kudos and keep it up!

I haven't been to many Indian places in Vegas, because this place is awesome. What makes them extremely memorable is their daily lunch buffets. They've got a wide variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options to select from and their lassies are super flavorful! Dinner a la carte options are great too. Can't go wrong with anything. The only reason they didn't get a 5 star rating is for their spice level. As of lately, the lunch buffet has been getting too spicy to the point where it's difficult to enjoy the food's flavor, and at dinner time they let a bit of the spice slide a tad bit when you customize your spice level.
Excellent. Food was spicy and well prepared. Atmosphere was nice. The place was extremely clean. I'll definitely be back.

After reading so many reviews, my BF and I finally tried this place out last week. We had the lunch buffet, and I was surprised by the variety of the different foods. Of course our first question to the owner was if the meat is halal or not, and it was!! *halal alert* 

The food was delicious, everything from the reshmi kabob to the warm gajar ka halwa. They had chicken tandoori (flavorful!), goat biryani, channa masala, and the list can keep going on and on. We also ordered garlic naan (including in the 10$ buffet price) and it honestly seemed to come right out of the oven! I couldn't get enough of the chicken tikka masala, and the Navrata korma (I think that's the name? LOL). The sauce (Salan) was creamy and hot. 

It became obvious that this place is going to be very popular VERY soon. We talked to the owner, and he was very helpful. He told us that although the main items stay the same during the lunch buffet, sometimes the dessert (mithai) might change, and maybe the lentil curry (daal). 

The atmosphere of the restaurant was quite fancy and quiet on the day that we went... But they have a very nice setup. 

I'm itching to come back again! :) 

SPECTACULAR place!! MUST GO.
Ordered food to the hotel while in Vegas. It was so flavorful! We got the chana with fried rice and enjoyed every last bite. Will make a visit to the restaurant & try more dishes on our next trip.

Slightly on the expensive side for dinner buffet, good options for people who love meat, but usual/not much different options for people who don't eat meat. 

Price would be what that could prevent me from going back.
Waitress rude and stuck up. Didn't honor Yelp offer of free mango lassi upon Yelp check in. Food tasted good and no complains there. Taste wasn't anything special or remarkable.

By far, Not the best Indian Lunch Buffet I have ever been to.  Staff was cold and less than accommodating,  and even less welcoming.  The Room was crammed, packed and bustling busy . 
Atmosphere was loud and uninviting.  The food was not terrible, but taking the staff and room into consideration it was definitely less than stellar.  I am certainly NOT interested in returning.

We missed the lunch buffet here by minutes, but were so resolved to try this food we stuck it out and came back for dinner hours.

Delhi came recommended to us by a British friend who had spent two years in India as "the best Indian food I've had in America." That's high praise from someone from the two Indian food capitals of the world (and perhaps having a palate more similar to an American than a native Indian)

The service was almost hilariously attentive since we walked through the door right as the place opened for dinner and it was all but empty.  I love a full water glass though, so even though being asked 10 times during dinner was a bit of an interruption, I can't complain.

I foolishly filled up on delicious samosas at the beginning of our meal, but they were so tasty I can't be sad.  The vegetarian dumpling curry we had was surprisingly tasty.  The cashews in the sauce added such rich, thick, depth of flavor.  It is one of those dishes that makes you think, yeah, this is what I'd eat if I were vegetarian, and I wouldn't miss meat one bit.  ...But, speaking of meat, the butter chicken was an absolute dream. I've never had such perfectly cooked chicken in a curry.

The naan was also on point with a yummy chewy top and a crispy bottom.


To sum up how good the food was, my dining partner and I ended up eating so much of it we promptly went home and took a nap.  Bravo, Delhi Indian Cuisine, bravo.

I love this place. I think about the food, ambiance and experience as soon as book my travel to Vegas. I've never been here during the lunch buffet but the dinner is always quiet, Intimate, and on-point.  The waitstaff is appropriate and the food is exceptional, $20 for sampler menu. I just love coming here and Krishna (ask for him) is the best.

This place is so good. Their service is amazing and they have so so kind. We went there because we noticed how many vegan options that they had. They have a full page of vegan options and also many vegetarian and non vegan/vegetarian options as well. They are so attentive and make sure you don't need anything. The restaurant itself if very clean and gorgeous! The food was beyond words! Never had Indian food before and this was the perfect place to go. Definitely will be going again!!

Funny enough, I thought I knew all the Indian restaurants near UNLV. But this was new. The exterior is unassuming enough and fits into the surrounding businesses like a leaf on grass. But once you enter inside it looks pretty nice and clean. What I noticed was how big this place was. My go to place for Indian is Everest, but my friend told me to try this place and I did.

The service is quiet but friendly and very quick. I give the food a 3-3.5 star but the service moves it over.

Ok, stop your yammering Andrew. What about the grub? The food is actually spicier than most other Indian restaurants I been to. The butter chicken is probably the tamest entree there. Well, that and the pre-requisite tandoori chicken. My favorite go to is always tandoori chicken and goat. And that's what I went for. The tandoori chicken was pretty dry. I wasn't sure if it was the Hoover Dam drought effects but i shrugged that off and notched it against Delhi. The goat is very tender and tasty. The butter chicken is very delicious. I also had the other spiced chickens like curry. It was good but not memorable enough for me to remember much about that foul. The eggplant was cooked well but man oh man it had some spice to it. A bit too much for a rather bland vegetable if you ask me. Sometimes the veggie is best left natural with a bit of seasoning. To me, this is one of them.

My regular rice pudding dessert was a bit different, it had vermicelli noodle bits in it....glass noodle for the noodlers out there. The fruit and desserts were minimal. If you like sweets, they had this glutinous ball that was swimming in honey water. Sweet and delicate. Try it.

I did not eat the different varieties of rice there but it looked good enough. The nan bread was brought out piping hot and had garlic and cilantro in it. It was fresh and tasted great, especially after dipping it in the butter chicken sauce.

AYCE lunch was about $10. There is quite a variety but I think I will stick closer to home and go to Everest.

Business seemed pretty slow so I hope it was because we lunched at 1:30.

I will mention one more thing. There were a little too many black things in the rice pudding. Maybe 2. Imma tell myself that it was some sort of spice. It wasn't a bug. I rubbed it on the table and it was more like lint. A bug would break apart. The better half thinks it's spice so I'll go by that. She did notice that it had quite a bit of it on the tray as well. I am Chinese but an extra added bonus of tiny bug is persona non grata.

I ordered food through GrubHub.  The food was AMAZING!!!!  Excellent depth of flavor, just the right amount of spiciness.  It really blew me away.  The Lamb Korma was incredible.  The meat was tender and flavorful, and the sauce was out of this world.  This is my new favorite place.  YUMMMMMM!!!

So i am back here after 2 years!!!! The owner is still the same courteous person. Not all food were the same what I had it before. I had mango lassi too much yogurt and also the consistency was on the watery side. I had goat curry it was finger licking good. Butter chicken was nice & creamy but the flavor was bit on the pale side. Tandoori chicken was overcooked & dry. I loved palak paneer & gulab jamun so overall I would say it was not convincing as I was specially visiting for butter chicken.

Great buffet, everything was good but the Chili Chicken was to die for, the best I've ever had. They could have made it everything spicier for my taste but it was still very nice. The free Nan was ok, I've had better but for the price it was fine. I'll be back when I visit Vegas again.

Well appointed great service and amazing food. Make sure that you get garlic naan. Had the lunch buffet. The chicken makkani ( which I would compare to chicken tikki masala) melts in your mouth. The goat curry falls off the bone. Everything was Great!

This is the best Indian restaurant in Vegas ! I have tried every single one in this city, and I have never been as satisfied as I am here. 

The buffet is not only the largest variety of any other Indian buffet in Vegas I have experienced, but it is also extraordinarily fresh and it is the most affordable. 

I award my highway recommendation!
I bring friends and youngsters here all the time, those who have never tried Indian, and I have only seen the most positive experiences!

Enjoy!

We are Indian and we loved the food.  We had Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhuna Gosht, fish tandoori tikkas, lacha paratha, and Tasmania for desert.  Every dish seemed to be perfect.  The fish was perfectly cooked, tasty and not over cooked.
Two minor things I didn't like:  color added to the planner giving it a bright red color.  Unnecessary in my opinion.  Second the Bhuna Gosht was a bit salty (my wife thought it was perfect), but this is something you can tell them when you place the order.
Also I had 2 glasses of the 2008 Perez Cruz Cabernet which I enjoyed.  Just give it time to breathe.

Very good, nice buffet available daily.  Garlic Naan, served with buffet. Amazing Lentils,, Curry dishes, plenty of vegetarian dishes........ Manager and wait staff very friendly, interested in customer satisfaction. Very pleased! Excellent quality, and experience.

Came here yesterday for the lunch buffet. I'd say it's well worth the price tag of $12.99. Lots of options on the line with all the usually suspects. I went there craving Tandoori chicken and got my fill and then some. Butter chicken was well seasoned and juicy, and you can't match The curry anywhere else. The mint sauce is perfect and the garlic naan was served warm and soft. They don't short change you on flavor or quality just because it's the buffet either. The interior was very clean and nicely decorated with beautiful artwork and elegant table settings. I really enjoyed it and will be back soon and often.

Delhi Indian cuisine is nothing short of delightful, as soon as you walk in you are overwhelmed (in the best way possible) by the most wonderful smells. You are immediately greeted by staff,  seated, and walked through their menu. We chose what I can best describe as a sampler platter. It was so great, we will be coming back soon, promise.
Finally an Indian buffet I can go to. Wide spread..lot of choices both in vegetarian as well as non vegetarian food......clean ambience, good service, decent price.

I rarely go to a place that lands 5 stars in all aspects.  Great food, great price $10.99, good service! Ooof! I'm stuffed. 
Highly recommend this place.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after finding out our first choice restaurant had a 60 to 90 min wait.  Little did we know that we would end up waiting for 10 minutes before we were even given water and a chance to order, and another 50 minutes before our food would arrive.  And the restaurant was only half full!  After we finished eating, we called for the check and again, we were made to wait as we watched the guy who promised to bring us the check run around, refilling the potpourri bowl and ringing other customers up..basically doing anything but bringing us the check.  

I guess the food was decent enough.  But I don't care how decent your food is, if you can't get your food out within a reasonable amount of time when your restaurant is only HALF full, then you've got an issue and you can forget about ever attracting your customers back.  As such, we could have stayed at our first choice restaurant and still ended up eating at around the same time.  We would also have saved on the gas money it took us to drive over to this place.
Really really amazing food. Very authentic in terms of taste. If you are in Vegas  and love Indian food then it's a must visit. I am out of words to describe this place

Great food and great people! The hosts were wrapping up when we walked in but they still accommodated us. We went with a simple order of jeera rice and chicken curry with beverages and raita. The food was original to the Indian palate. The hosts were possibly the best I've met! Must check it out if you have an Indian craving in Vegas

I went during the lunch buffet.  Clean establishment,  friendly staff.   The buffet offered some common dishes like tandoori, samosas, butter chicken as well as a few of out of the ordinary ones (curry goat).   Mango Lassi is always delish.  There are a few items on the buffet that I find to be the best I've ever tasted (when compared to other Indian restaurants):  pakora, chile chicken,  chicken tikka masala, and galub jamun.  To me, the flavors are perfect.  I do wish they would add mango chutney to the buffet.

Great food and great service.
The staff was very helpful and the garlic naan was delicious! 
We will definitely be coming back!

Excellent in everything ! 
Food tastes amazing
Veg food, non veg food, service quality taste best !

Haven't tried the buffet but good food is all I got to say. Dinner was tasty and service is cool though. A bit of high on the price end, got a variety of options to choose and that is what makes it stand apart from the rest of the crowd!

Best Indian restaurant in Las vegas. We were there in vegas on long weekend holidays. We try there lunch buffet and that was actually fabulous. This was an example of good india food. Staff was very friendly and service was great. So I recommend all the folk visiting the vegas and looking for good indian food to visit this place for good indian food instead of wasting your money on other indian restaurant located on vegas strip "Tamba".

The first restaurant I ate during my trip to Vegas is Delhi Indian Cuisine.They have very delicious food and much appreciable hospitality to its customers.I have from Louisville , i eat at least once or twice in Indian restaurants but I ate every buffets and dinner in Delhi Indian Cusine during my  week long stay in Vegas.They serve delicious food both buffet and dinner. They have best Indian nan and chicken tunduri and imported beer from India. In my Experience this  Restaurant is the best in town for vegetarians too.

Got take out food here. Very good but smaller portions than other Indian takeouts I've been to in the past. In addition, the entree orders did not come with free rice. You have to pay for the rice. 

I probably won't order take out from them again but I will eat at the buffet

Thank you yelp once again! While roaming the streets of LV, I got the craving for some food from the homeland. After some bad experiences with lunch indian buffets in the past here, my hopes were pretty low.  I have to say I'm vegetarian so while many may love indian buffets with great meat options, I usually am stuck with like two non-appetizing vegetarian options. Not the case here!! The buffet was huge! Filled up half the restaurant! And the food was delicious!!
Naan-amazing
Samosas- to die for! (I ate like 3)
Korma- almost fell out of my chair!
Even the dal was good!

Been coming here for a couple years now...there's a reason why I do. Everyone is usually nice and courteous, and always attentive. Their goat curry taste amazing, and their carrot halawa taste like heaven.

I kinda get what another reviewer meant when she said the buffet is quite large, yet lacked variety. Everything was pretty great though; I love that they aren't as afraid of adding a little bit of heat to their buffet dishes (most places avoid heat in buffet items, for obvious reasons). 

I also thought the garlic naan was wonderful, hot and fresh from the kitchen. They brought it out pretty late into our meal, which brings me to the service. Not bad, but a little slow. Understandable, as they haven't been open long, and not a huge deal. Just looks like they might still be working out a couple of kinks perhaps?

I would definitely return, for the buffet, and possibly for dinner if the mood strikes.

As much as I enjoy trying new things, there are certain cuisine I am a creature of habit. I have my favorite spot for that food and I am just not messing with it. Indian lunch buffet is one such thing, but after hearing some love from trusted friends, I reluctantly shook up our routine and tried out this new spot. 

It's a large open room so it's probably a better bet if you are dining with a large group as the other better buffets are rather small dining rooms. Size of the buffet is fairly good as there were 16 hot dishes, some chutney, lettuce, cucumbers, some fruit and kheer. 

We got the garlic naan, which I thought was superb and had nice garlicky flavor. 

All the food was solid, but there were a few standout dishes for me. Tandoori chicken was juicy and I appreciate these aren't huge hormone large pieces. The goat curry had a nice flavor in the sauce, though quite a bit of bones to navigate., Saag paneer was solid, a bit creamier than average. The one surprise for me is the malai kofta. In the past, I've disliked this dish at other places, but I loved it here because of the texture of the kofta. I find some places it just is dry and dough-y and full of blah, but the texture of this is soft and creamy even. There wasn't a label for it, but it was sort've cut up pieces of sausage similar to a lulu kebab that had a nice gingerly flavor to it that was awesome wrapped in naan with chutney. The yellow daal was really tasty - probably my favorite one I've had in the recent years. 

I see that there are pics of the Himalayas and seen some mention of there being Nepalese owners and Indian owners so it's reflected in the way food is flavored. I find Napalese is less spicy and more a balance with savory and sweet. 

Service was decent. We had our drinks refilled and the people were friendly. There's a current check in for a lassi or soda so we took advantage and got a free mango lassi which was yummy. 

I think this matches my usual standby in quality so I'm glad we went. I think I will alternate between this place and Mint depending on the type of Indian I feel like having.

If you've been waiting to try this place I suggest you try and see for yourself what Delhi Indian Cuisine is all about. I've only tried 2 other Indian places in my Life both were in Vegas The first was India Oven and the second was Mount Everest. India oven was ok. Wasn't a big fan of that restraunt but then again I was also younger and not interested in broadening my horizons and trying different things. Mount Everest was really good their sweet rice was really yummy but they don't serve Garlic Naan anymore :( at lunch I believer so in comes Delhi. 



We came at about 2 and there were 2 parties of people besides us eating here. They have the standard share of Indian offerings my favorite was the Chicken Makhani. It's probably my favorite Indian dish. It's super good especially with the garlic Naan. Free mango lassi with check in so that's also a plus. 

Only thing I will skip next time is the Galub Jamun. It's a dessert. Little balls of I think bread in a almost diabetic coma sauce. It's wayyyy too sweet for me. 

I hope you last Delhi India cuisine. Just put the sweet rice on the buffet line and I will be extra happy !

One word, delicious.

If you can read more than one word, then read on my friend cause this is one of the best Indian restaurants that I've been to. 

Some hobknobs might find the location a bit shady, but the interior of the restaurant is clean and well put together and makes you forget about all the bums across the street. Whataraya gonna do? Amirite?

This place has only been opened a week or so. The service here was good. While the waiters were new and seemed untrained in the usual customer service/waiter chatter, (family owned restaurant I assume?), they were still very polite and attentive, and boxed our food to-go for us. No complaints from me, they refilled my water glass often as I slew down all that spicy curry.

Good news for all vegetarians, half the menu is vegetarian based, which put me in a chipper mood right off the bat when we entered. They also have multiple chicken and lamb entrees if you're still craving the meat food. For me not actually being a big fan of curry, the food was amazing and I ate till I was beyond stuffed. I forgot the names of the dishes we selected, but I had a nine vegatable combo with mild spicy creme curry and my boyfriend had the traditional chicken curry. Both were just right in hotness and didn't leave a chalky taste in my mouth like most curry does.

The grand finaleeeee....Naan bread. mmm yes, that's right. the garlic naan bread here is so delicious I just wanted to go adopt a new puppy or something. Was so good that I got another frisbee shaped bread slice to-go.

With all that and an extra bowl of rice, the price for two was pretty decent. We ate there during the dinner hours where they gave us a menu, but they also do a lunch buffet which I have yet to try. I plan on coming back here as this place has awakened my curry craving. I'm getting hungry just typing about it.
i've gone back a few more times for the lunch buffet and its still fantastic. only wish they offered a dinner buffet atleast once a week.

Went for the lunch buffet, wide selection of chicken dishes, chicken tandoori, chili chicken, was quite appetizing, the curry chicken, not so.  The chicken curry seemed too watery to me.  The spices were off a little bit on the light side in all the dishes.   but overall, I liked it because of the large selection and the large dining area.  The AC was off so it was a bit muggy and uncomfortable.  Overall, based on the food alone, the taste is decent but not inspiring.  It's good because they put so much effort in it, but I don't think it's quite 4.5 stars.  I'd say closer to 3.5 to 4.

After 6 hours of long drive I reached Vegas and went to this restaurant. Amazing food....authentic indian food...we had shadi paneer, dal and palak paneer. We all loved it... I felt like I am eating in India...

Found this place looking for some where to deliver at Westgate but decided to Uber over instead and glad we did. fantastic food loved the Momos the place was beautiful and the staff were friendly and acted like you were a guest in their home 
All three of the dishes we has were wonderful

We were here just for a day in Vegas and we wanted to have Indian food. We didn't go with much expectations but the lunch buffet totally surprised us. It was full of options in the menu. So much that we couldn't even finish first round that too in so less price. It was tasty and clean and staff was courtoeus. Must go for Indian food !!!

AWESOME!!! The foods and people of the resturant are amazing and very receptive and attentive. 
I went there with my family and really enjoyed the enviroment. Very romanic musics and lovely workers. 
I will surely come to VEGAS just to vist this amazing place

I've been to many Indian Buffets and this is by far the best I've been to in Las Vegas. Great selection of both meat and vegetarian curries. I love that they have goat curry and kabobs. The Biryani is a little spicy for me, I wish they have another selection of Biryani that is less spicy. They refill very often, so that the batch is always fresh. Get the garlic naan, it is very tasty, always comes out warm and fresh. The sauces are also on point, I could eat it everyday. Love the Pakora and Samosas, I always start with those items as appetizers. The price is amazing and the staff is always so attentive. The place is big enough that you don't have to wait to get seated. Food is phenomena!
On Saturday, I had their lunch buffet and really enjoyed the food variety and flavor.   The service was excellent and it was a great deal at $12.99.
Food was amazing! Went for brunch and it was awesome not authentic though but the taste was just awesome.

Recently dined here for the lunch buffet hoping to find the best Indian food in Vegas. Greatly disappointed. Being originally from the Bay Area, I've ate at some really fantastic Indian/Pakistani restaurants. Haven't found one in vegas yet. 

The staff was very friendly and the Garlic Naan was really good. However, allot of the food tasted bland and lacked flavor altogether. The chicken curry lacked chicken and the flavor of the yogurt was overwhelming. The Saag, Samosa's and the Dal lacked flavor. The pakoras tasted stale and the rice in the Biryani was over cooked. 

The only two things good were the Garlic Naan and the desert, Galub Jamun. I see all the great reviews so maybe I just came on a day when the cook wasn't feeling it.

Really enjoyed this buffet! Lots of selections, large parking lot, friendly service!
When I went, they didn't serve any dishes with paneer but hopefully next time I visit again, they'll have it! Great flavor and consistency with all their selections.

Thank you, Yelp, for finding me a place with delicious food, that's open late, not on the strip, and most importantly takes American Express! 

Fantastic food. Great flavor! Ordered butter chicken, level 7 spicy (next time I'll order level 9, could be spicier for my taste), and buttered naan for take out. Wonderful service, very friendly staff, and food was ready in the exact amount of time they said. Wish I had found them earlier in my work trip!
I am very impressed with this restaurant!  The service we received was first class.  The food blew my mind with the flavors and overall quality.  This is the best Indian cuisine in Las Vegas!
Excellent food, super friendly service, incredible price. Chicken Biryani was very good. Possibly one of my favorite buffet to date. Take a break from Casino Buffets and go here.

Clean updated atmosphere, the buffet had a good selection and the food was kept up, nice and fresh. Off the beaten path so it was nice to drive right up, no wait. Good price buffet as well. I'll definitely go back.

Pathetic food. We ordered chilly chicken, chicken momos, dal makhni, karahi chicken and bhunna ghost. All except chilly chicken was worse indian you could have. First, waiter forgot our order. Bhunna ghost was uncooked. Karahi chicken had excessive salt. Dal was bland. One of the worst meal I ever had in US. Breads were not up to the mark. Washrooms were in bad condition. 
What else do you expect from a resturant. 
Eat at your own risk !!

Two stars only on the strength of the food. 

Second time here. First time was great good food and decent service. 

Today is a different story. 1pm lunch buffet time and theres not too many people here the wait service is bad. Waited 25 min for our naan. 

Our server went on break without telling us or notifying another waiter to watch our table. Did not get one refill of water. 

Found three pieces of hair in the tikka masala 

Although very good masala after the third hair I just couldn't eat anymore. 

One of the hairs looked like an eyebrow hair. 

The manager was nice about it and gave us the meals for free even after we tried to pay for at least 1.
