big lunch buffet  (10.95  $ )  with lots of things to choose from . it's a little bit on the spicy side , but not too much . food was fresh and the seasoning was good . free mango lassie or soda with yelp check in . free choice of regular or garlic naan .

First off me and my girlfriend LOVE this place they always have new dishes every time we go but they always keep the fan favorites. The food is always warm and fresh. They are sometimes a little slow on bringing the naan bread at times but they always refill your water right away. We have went so many times now they ask us how our life has been going if we haven't been in a while just a overall very pleasant experience. Good food, Nice people and a clean place what more can you ask for?!
I've never had better Indian food in my life!! The service was great, I think our waters got refilled like 7 times! I HIGHLY recommend it!

For $10.99 lunch buffet, it's a great place during working hours. Easy to find location and very clean. Food quality is good. Spicy level is bearable. My favorite is the chicken curry. The chicken is very soft to taste. A variety of selections. Would go back!

Tucked away in a large shopping plaza next to the Best Buy on Maryland Parkway Delhi Indian Cuisine originally opened its doors on January 1st 2014, and although the area around it may not be the most glamorous with vagrants roving both parking lots and nearby streets those in the neighborhood around noon would still do well to stop in for the all-you-can eat Buffet lunch.

Stacked against a lot of competition in Las Vegas but more than once voted Sin City's Best Indian Restaurant, the 11a-3p daily Buffet complimented by a large a la carte menu offered both day and night, guests entering Delhi Indian Cuisine will likely first be struck by the impressive size of a restaurant easily capable of accommodating more than one-hundred diners and although many may criticize Steam Tray food for one reason or another those arriving early can rest assured that everything offered is quite fresh while service is also very attentive.

Offering a full bar in addition to Beer and Wine, the ability to order off the menu at lunch also not typical of most Indian Lunch Buffets, it was after checking in at the hostess stand that a seat was offered along the right wall in a plush booth, both drinks and the full menu declined before selecting Garlic Naan and walking up to gather the first of five plates of Food.

Playing soothing music without video throughout the Restaurant, a significant departure from the loud volume and flashing Bollywood of Mount Everest or Paradise India on the West Side, it was shortly after returning to the table that a puffy round of Bread with lightly blistered edges emerged from the kitchen and with the smell of Garlic quickly filling the air it would be hard to name a better version of the dish found anywhere in the city, the opening quartet of Chicken all proving very well made with the Tandoori Leg and Wing both moist with good color while the Chili Chicken brought a lot of heat, but not so much that it was unpleasant.

Clearly labeling Vegetarian versus Omnivorous options, a large family of visiting Indians from London soon entering and speaking loudly about how good much of Dehli's Buffet was in comparison to those back home, it was with the faint linger of Curry on the lips that a second trip was made to the lengthy Buffet, a small bowl of Goat Curry as usual made difficult to eat by splintered Bones but otherwise funky and Fragrant while the Pakora and Samosa were fairly run of the mill, thus leaving room for the tender Turmeric-heavy Cauliflower and Potatoes as well as generous cubes of Chicken Breast served in Rice perfumed with Nutmeg, Cardamom and Bay Leaf.

Moving right to left and incidentally from Meat to Vegetables and Legumes, more than 50% of the buffet focused on the latter, fans of heat would do well to focus on Delhi's Navratan Korma with "three types of Chiles" according to the waitress while those looking for something a bit more subtle will be better off with Dal Makhani or Chana Masala, the former a fragrant Black Lentil Porridge while the later outperformed the Chicken version by being a bit thicker and a little more focused in flavor around tender Chickpeas.

Using creamy Palak Paneer as a topping to for the Naan after discovering a lack of Chutney on the Cold Bar, the Cheese about 3/4 melted and thus a nice consistency, it was as the meal neared its end that an inquiry was made about the Gajar Halwa seen in many pictures online, the apparently "not every day" Buffet item nonetheless prepared special at no extra charge and served piping hot with plenty of Cardamom but not a lot of extra sweetness, that side of dessert instead left to chilled Rice Pudding with subtle Saffron notes and globes of Gulab Jamun soaked in sugary Syrup.

****Offering the Buffet for just $12.99 and full a la carte menu throughout the day it would be difficult to name a more accommodating Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas than Delhi Indian Cuisine, an early arrival assuring that everything is fresh while the staff easily outperforms even the Grand Buffets of the Strip in terms of friendliness and attention to guest's needs.

First of all service is excellent and the food is soo good. Especially tandoori sizzler was fabulous. The waiters are keep watching what we need. They are keep asking the level of spicy for each and every item what we ordering. I appreciate the waitress have the attitude. Only thing I noticed the water is not purified and its taste less . I hope the management department will fix that issue. I wish u have a great future

Excellent Indian food with a Nepalese flair. Don't miss the Kashmir Naan! Coconut stuffed! Delicious! Samosas are great. Garlic Naan is fantastic. Palaak paneer is creamy dreamy yum. Veggie biryani is very tasty. Chana masala is wonderful. A little spicy. Just be careful. Service is perfect. They will take great care of you. A must go.

We went here for late dinner. So, this place was pretty empty. Other than our server not giving us personal space, the service was good. 

We tried a few of our favorites. For the most part, we enjoyed dinner.

Mango Lassi:
The color was a bit off-putting. It was very orange. It didn't quite taste like what I've had at other Indian restaurants. This tasted artificial. 2/5

Papadum:
Perfect cracker. But what makes this exceptionally good were the sauces: tamarind and mint. Their sauces are better than anyone else's. 5/5

Garlic Naan:
This is my favorite. I can eat this stuff by itself. Warm, soft, buttery and garlicky goodness. I'm making myself want garlic naan by what I just said. 5/5

Prawn Korma:
The sauce was a bit garlicky and creamy. It has some spicy kick to it. I wish this dish had more prawns since it is in fact PRAWN korma. 4/5

Fantastic! We went to the lunch buffet and they have the largest selection of dishes for vegetarians like us, (don't worry there were plenty of meat options for you carnivorous types.)  And the customer service was out of this world! We felt like we got the royal treatment, we had a couple special requests and were accommodated graciously, I have to say this may be our new favorite indian restaurant in Las Vegas!

tell you 1 hour in delivery time comes to you in 2 hours and 10 mins, the take out servings are less then half of the real serving spent 80 dollars on 5 people and we order 2 pizzas form pizza-hut afterwards, the food tasted so-so not that happy with it specially with the price

and the greedy fat delivery man demanded a tip. before kick him out with 2 dollars

It is the best Indian restaurant you can find near UNLV. My favorite go to always tandoori chicken, do not forget to ask for hot and fresh baked garlic bread. Try goat as well it was so tender and tasty. 
If you are student, show your student card and get 10% off!!!!

**Summary**
       - Value - This is probably the cheapest Indian buffet in town.
       - Quality - This ranks as one of the top Indian buffets I've had. Moist chicken/goat and good curry. What more can you ask for?
       - Service - They're absent from the front a lot of times, but when they do come over, they're very friendly.
       - Asian Influence - They have chow mein and chili chicken. I guess it adds variety, lol.
**Price**
       - Lunch Buffet $9.99
**Ordered**
       - Garlic Naan - I suggest requesting the garlic naan or they might give you the regular naan instead.
       - Tandori Chicken - Flavorful as ever cooked in a clay oven.
       - Chili Chicken - One of their Asian tasting entrees. It wasn't too spicy. A little salty from the sauce, but good otherwise.
       - Chicken Makhani - Chicken + Curry + Butter = Delicious. The chicken wasn't too dry and the curry was as buttery delicious as ever.
       - Chicken Saag - I prefer the makhani, but this adds variety to my plate.
       - Goat Curry - The goat is fall off the bone tender. A must try.
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice lunch Indian buffet. It's a great deal!

The lunch buffet was ok, I felt that the food was very spicy at least that part was authentic they didn't water down the spices. I had wished they had chicken tikka Marsala even though it's not an authentic Indian dish but it's a tasty dish. 

I wasn't that impressed with the vegetarian curries, I'd would have liked it if they had Chana Marsala and vegi korma. I'm sure they rotate their dishes but the day I went I wasn't that happy with the buffet selection. 

The naan was good and so was the mango lassi. That was the best part.
Lunch buffet was only $9.99! The best quoalit and great selection.  I want to try dinner soon.  Love it!  :)
The Best Indian Buffet in town with a wide variety of dishes and very tasty food. Sure will recommend any one try and the staff is very polite with a big smile.

Last night was my first time at this establishment and I was not at all disappointed. The food was stellar and the staff were charming. I over ordered and took home far more than we managed to eat. I will be back very soon.

Best Indian Buffet in Vegas.
Beats Mint India buffet both in size, convenience and the choice of food.
You have to try their reshmi kebabs.

My server was Krishna and he redefines customer service.

I would go there again.
The food and service was absolutely beyond awesome! We enjoyed the whole experience from the decor and ambiance to the service and food! I highly recommend this restaurant if you visit Las Vegas!
I would rate it as 5stars and a fantastic place to hang out and have food. Very polite at service and delicious food served. Its very close to the strip and one must try out of thou are nearby.

First time coming here for the lunch and it enjoyed it better than other indian buffets that I have been to.

There is a large selection of food that takes up the back wall. You have a choice between regular or garlic nan, I prefer the garlic one. 

Most tandoori chicken at other places are usually dry, but this one was nice and tender!

Definitely worth trying out (:

I've been to several Indian restaurants here in Vegas and this one is definitely the best I've had. The garlic naan is chewy and delicious. Also, so many great vegetarian choices on the lunch buffet which is a very reasonable $9.99. The staff is extremely sweet and they provide great service!
Loved the food and the people is really friendly too, after we finish our dinner they even gave us desert, it was awesome, recommended 100 percent, delicious food!

When we walked in this place was completely empty.  There were four of us and we ordered an appetizer/starter (samosa chatt), the tandoori sizzler, chicken vindaloo, chicken tika masala, rice and garlic naan. The food was all wonderful and service was good too. The only two things I didn't like is that our waiter didn't like the fact that we didn't order one entree per person ("you realize these dishes are meant to be for one person"), and the prices. I can get the same foods at many other Indian restaurants for less, larger portions and that have a better taste. I'm glad I went and tried it, but probably won't be back.

Amazing food. Amazing service. This is real indian food. Every item's taste is so perfect and balanced. This is second time I came here coming from San Francisco. I wish they open in Bay area as well. Their Naan is one of the best I ever had.
Amazing chicken tikka masala! Craved Indian food for two months and this was just the place to go. first time coming here and truly blown away

They're best in town! All the foods are amazing test and best customer service. We come here all the time never got disappointed! My whole family comes here. The biriyani and lamb  chumps is my favorite:))
Food taste was average, tasty but not special. Staff were friendly. We ordered our food medium spicy but it came out very spicy.

What a hole in the wall! I was thoroughly surprised by the delicious food here! I've passed by this place so many times and didn't know how good it was. The naan (garlic and plain) was fresh, airy, yet crispy on the outside. We tried the butter chicken (which was my favorite), lamb curry, and another spicy veggie and meat dish (I forgot what it's called, my friend ordered it). I got one of the mango yogurt drinks (forgot the name too, sorry!) and it was cool and refreshing for a hot Vegas summer night. I can't wait to come here to try the food again! And P.S. they serve halal food.

i wish i could rate more but i cant. i was there on saturday for dinner and then later on sunday for lunch buffet. Before i start i would like to say that i am vegetarian and i am only saying from this perspective. when we were there on Saturday for dinner it was nice and comforting everything was on point so we decided to return today for lunch buffet! But no it was a wrong choice this time. It is the worst buffet that i ever had in US. the food waa not fresh and it tastes pathetic. 
sambar was as thick as a gravy of shahi paneer, punjabi kadi was as sour as lemon and it is super thick too with no dumplings in it. 
then we tried kofta and its same no taste: very thich and same with yellow daal. BTW there were few more (aloo matar,corn saag) and they were equally horrible. we ordered breads and they were also not properly cooked we have to ask our server to cook it properly. Mind it we didnt had any trouble yesterday over the dinner. When we informed about our disappointed to the management they started giving diffuse excuses and just said sorry!

i dont think the sorry was sincere ! 
i have grew in delhi and i know how the delhi food tastes! i am not returning back again and will not advise anyone!

This restaurant was excellent. Every dish we ordered was delicious. Heat being graded from 1-10 the spices were perfect. We all ordered different heat levels. The waiter was very informative with all questions answered. Will definitely return to try other dishes.

I can't speak highly enough about this place. If you're coming for the Buffett but come late (after 3pm) like we did, don't be afraid to order their sampler. It's awesome! We had so many things. I'm no pro when it comes to Indian food but the Tandoori chicken was the best I've had out of the ~10 other places I've been. The butter chicken was really good and their. 

The service was attentive enough and they didn't make us feel like they were hovering even though there were only a couple of other tables seated. When we were unsure about something, they were patient and pleasant when explaining.

I really enjoyed this. Everything was good. Spicy was properly spicy and unlike some other Indian joints, the chutneys were rapidly produced to mitigate the heat. (I've heard that chutney is English more than Indian, but I do not care: A good chutney is the perfect counterpoint to spicy Indian food.)
The naan was perfect. I like the garlic naan best but either way, you're winning. We had chicken vindaloo and a lamb dish. Both were terrific. Plus a full bar and they know how to pour a drink!
The service we had was terrific, even when (because I was stupid) I forgot to order our entrees, our wait person was patient with me and got the orders in immediately. I note that some of the reviews dinged them on this, but seriously, our service was well-neigh perfect.
Excellent service and very tasty goat curry. Garlic naan was slightly biter but the Mango Lassi and chai were great.

After a long time found a typical North Indian restaurant which still has some true Indian flavors in their chicken, goat curries and creamy tikka masala

Pakora, tandoori , were good too. 

Biryani was decent

Chilli chicken could have been better. 

Could probably improve their sambar.

I was very excited to get Indian food while in Vegas as Phoenix's Indian food scene.... how can I say this nicely.... leaves something to be desired. After seeing the great reviews, I knew we had to check Delhi out. We came for the lunch buffet on a weekday and it was not overly crowded (which was nice). The buffet was large with an extensive selection of dishes. Most of the food was quite good, with the spicy chicken curry being the tastiest option (in my opinion). They also had a large variety of vegetarian options if that is something you are looking for. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have chai tea on the buffet, nor did they have my favorite Indian dessert (the rice pudding... yum)... but apparently the selection changes from day to day, so maybe we came on an off day. The price is good for all that you get (about 11$). I must admit that I have had a better Indian buffet experience in Vegas (Evergreen... yum), but this is another great option, especially if you are a local. Happy eating, Vegas!

The food was great!   Tomato soup, garlic naan, tandoori chicken, Karachi chicken.  However as great as the staff was last time, this time not so much.  Mostly attentive, just chaotic.   Also the decor could use lots of help.

Delhi Indian Cuisine was the second Indian buffet that we tried during our last trip to Vegas. It is located not too far from the south end of the strip so location and accessibility was not a problem. Upon entering my first impression was that the place seemed pretty inviting. It was spacious with the buffet nicely spread out along the far end, tables nicely spaced apart so after having eaten in Mount Everest the previous day this was a welcome change.

The buffet again has all the standard items that you will find in an Indian buffet. Appetizers included tandoori chicken, vegetable pakodas (vegetable fritters) and samosa (puff pastry with potato filling). Entrees included butter chicken, goat curry, saag, rice, biryani and noodles. Desert included gajar ka halwa (carrot pudding) and kheer (sweetened rice pudding with milk). Taste wise what stood out to me was that everything was good but not great. Well the biryani and naan (provided fresh on the table) were both excellent but all the entrees were enjoyable but nothing popped out. The deserts could have been better. The gajar ka halwa cried out for some more mava (heavy cream) and the kheer for more sugar. Obviously they were made keeping the health conscience, not too sweet regulars in mind (another resturant which was full of locals). 

Service was good, all our plates were cleared promptly and price wise it was $10.99 which is pretty much standard for Indian buffets.

Overall I feel that the food surely needs a shot in the arm, but considering the overall package of location, decor, service and value for money a repeat visit is surely on the cards during our next visit.

Was a little disappointed that the buffet was only available at lunch, that said the food we ordered was reasonably priced and the quality was comparable to our favorite places back home. Located in a small shopping plaza, it was pretty empty when our party of 7 arrived so no problems with seating. Later more families came, predominantly Indian which is always a sign of authenticity. The goat curry was fantastic. They had a wide variety of lassis including strawberry, cherry and lychee which the kids enjoyed. We ordered all of the dishes mild for the picky eaters in our group but I was happy to find that some dishes were more on the spicy side. Usually have to order extra rice and naan but the portions here were good sized and ended up with leftovers. The manager was very friendly and helpful and came to our table many times to check up on us. I had ordered a gulab jamun to go and was pleasantly surprised later when he doubled my order for free. Everyone was very happy with the food and the service. Will visit again next time we are in Vegas.

Went during the lunch buffet and not a bad item was tasted! Everything was delicious and prepared as it should be. For the cost it is a tremendous bargain. I will definitely be going again! Also, try the garlic naan! Yum!

This place has great food for the price (lunch buffet).  It is not a disappointment either on selection.  They actually had one of my favorites which have been difficult to find in a buffet, vegetable samosa...very yummy.  Unlike a lot of Indian places, the food was not too salty.  Definitely will be a repeat customer.

This is the first Indian restaurant/buffet that I've been to where I wasn't stiffed on meat. My butter chicken actually fed 3 people! Expect to wait about 20mins longer to get take-out because the tandoori chicken has to be cooked fresh. Here's the breakdown of my order:

Chicken Tandoori - was a bit dry but still tasty
Korma Shrimp - was really good too, I saved all the sauce so I can slather my rice in them the next day
Butter Chicken - tasty as always and had enough meat to feed 3 people
Garlic Naan - not as garlicky as I would have wanted
Chicken Pakora - not a fan, dry and not that tasty
Veg Samosa - not a fan, too doughy, not enough filling
Excellent service delicious chicken tandoori veggies crisp hey im tryna write like a food critic i enjoyed myself I will be back.

Had dinner here last night and went a little overboard on ordering. I ordered 3 entrees  Chicken Vindaloo, Chicken Tikki Masala, and Aloo Gobi.  All of which were amazing.  I had them set the spice level (how spicy) to 7 on the 1 to 10 scale and it had just the perfect amount of heat for someone who like things on the spicy side.  I also ordered the Naan and rice which also very good.  The staff was very friendly and always made sure I had everything I needed.  So if you are in Vegas and looking for good affordable Indian food i highly recomend Delhi Indian Cuisine.
I went there for the first time and I really like the goat. And the Biryani . Friendly staff. Chicken kebab was very good. It's halal !!!

A friend invited a group of us for the luncheon buffet and it was one of the best Indian meals I have ever experienced.  The variety was exceptional and the service was excellent.  I will definitely return!
One of the best buffets in vegas taste real desi and reasonable staff is nice ,i love the environment must try nice. Cheers!

Great lunch buffet with many different foods to choose from. I love the goat and the carrot pudding(?). Wish they would say a little more about what each item is for those of us who don't know Indian food have a better understanding of the different items.

We went for dinner and we're not happy with quality of food (tasteless and not fresh). Additionally the service was slow.  We will not recommend this place because of food quality and the time it takes to serve food. For us it took 30min and we just sat there doing nothing.

Our first time eating here. Yelp's reviews brought us here :)  

We had the manchurian veggie balls for an appetizer & chicken karadi with plain nans for dinner. Everything was delicous!

The staff were all very friendly & attentive. 

Baby Alayna approves too :)

Btw the mango lassi was yummy too

I am from out of state. My best friend and I were looking in the area to eat and decided to try out Dehli. Trying new food is always a risk. Dehli put that fear to rest. Hands down one of the best Indian cuisine buffets I've been to. Great service, great food, can it get better than that??? Would come back for sure!

FINALLY found some good Indian food in this city! This will be our go to place for Indian food from now on. The lunch buffet was so delicious and most importantly FRESH! The atmosphere was nice and clean. The staff was very polite. The restaurant is chef owned and you can tell that he takes pride in his food and restaurant.

I really enjoyed the buffet selection- six meats - chicken and goat, multiple vegetable dishes, free naan, deserts, and they do not push you to start at the salad bar.   I didn't eat again all day.

If you are sensitive to spice, which I am, make sure you taste the dishes and avoid spicy curries (even the mildly hot ones are trouble!).  I had a bad experience later that evening.
Food is amazing here . Best buffet I have ever had .  They had awseom malai kofta and Naan.Food is not expensive too. They have very good service too :)
Great lunch buffet! Has everything!! Food was good!! The place is huge so tons of sitting area! I reserved but didn't really need to bc it wasn't super busy for a Tuesday lunch. Will be back!!
Super great food and it was a buffet.  Really yummy and a variety of foods to try.  Great location

Went here when we first got to town. Started our trip out perfectly. I am not a big fan of Indian food due to the spiciness of it so I usually stick to tandoori chicken, naan, and rice.  I have to say this was the BEST Tandoori chicken ever, and the naan was wonderful. Have never had it cooked in a clay oven with a buttery almost crescent roll like flavor you don't want to pass on it.  They also make a garlic one.
The rice pudding like dessert (can't remember the name) had what seemed like an orange undertone to the flavor and it was quite good.
My husband loves Indian food and thoroughly enjoyed the lunch here.
Worth the price foe lunch buffet and service was great.  Friendly and never a dry glass
The best Indian food in vegas ever. Nice staff, plenty space,no reservation need. Chicken masala is so smooth and creamy, melting in mouth. Try garlic naan! Will be back for sure.

Great place for a first date; nice ambiance... the music is half Indian/half American and the decor is modern and subdued. There are white tablecloths with white paper tops, and lots of booths. The menu is varied with lots of choices for vegetarians and those looking for healthy food. My fish curry had some serious capsaicin authority, and I had ordered it as a 3 spiciness on a scale of 1-10. So if you don't appreciate spicy food, order it mild, mild, mild. My vegetable samosas were spiced perfectly, but my son would have complained that they were too spicy. I really liked the buckwheat roti (like a pancake).
Worth every penny to eat here. Service was excellent. Loved the chicken tikka with the peas polau!!! Delicious.... Must try the naan too, fresh & soft.

I love this place! Their food is always tasty and they have a great selection. I would definitely recommend them for a nice sit down dinner or for a quick lunch with their buffet. Their prices are also very reasonable!

My friend and I had dinner here after meeting the chef om wonderful food I enjoy the variety of naan bread and vegetable Thali relaxing atmosphere and very nice service I love going to aurhentic  restaurants where they actually have authentic music playing definitely will be coming back

Grand opening tomorrow. They had a soft opening on New Year's Eve. I was presently surprised at how lovely the place was on the inside. It's dimly lit and makes for an intimate experience. They have a GREAT selection on the buffet for anyone's taste; several options for vegetarians and meat lovers. They even had biriyani on the buffet line, which I am a big fan of. 

The place is very spacious and has a contemporary layout with soothing music playing. It makes you feel like you are really in a high end restaurant, but you realize that it's a high end buffet with great food instead. I'm told they will offer a full bar in the near future which is unique for an establishment like this.

I had no complaints. The staff were accommodating and received prompt service. I will definitely be back. 

I just need to work off the 20k+ calories I just injected into my body first after I take a much needed nap. Not smart planning on my apart considering it's the evening of New Years Eve. Oh well. We live and learn.
Biryani was great ! was here for a conference and tried this restaurant and it was worth.

You know, I wasn't going to write a review. I am not one to immediately complain, send food back, or write a negative post. BUT after yelp sending me multiple emails encouraging me to review, I figure hell why not. I ordered delivery from this restaurant and fought with myself if $50 was worth the price of instant satisfaction and laziness. $6 for delivery charge PLUS extra for taxes made two dishes and a small side salad the price of what two people could pay for a substantial dinner out together. I ordered the cucumber salad--- that listed every ingredient. Or so I thought. So to my disappointment when the salad arrived and was covered in cilantro I was pretty pissed. I am in the group of ultimate cilantro haters , and as I have started accepting it in sauces such as curries usually in Indian and Thai foods, I CAN NOT eat it raw. It makes me want to puke. So the $5 salad was inedible for me. Pissed no1. 
I ordered online - next the buckwheat bread. Knowing it may be weird and definitely unconventional I still went for it and asked if they could add garlic and butter to it - as a side note and request in the box provided online. When I got the bread it was plain, slimey, and just gross. Pissed no2. Finally I am a HUGE Indian food eater and I usually order the same things when I eat Indian. I could call myself a chicken vindaloo expert at this point. Hands down the worst chicken vindaloo I have ever had anywhere. In many states, in many cities as I travel for work. Not only was the chicken vindaloo just not authentic or good at that, it was $15+ super overpriced as usually people order more than one dish at an Indian restaurant to get small helpings of a few different plates. $15 per dish is a bit outlandishly overpriced. I ate half of the buckwheat bread, half of the vindaloo, none of the salad and about a quarter of the gigantic rice box they gave me. I spent $50 to be severely disappointed. Now I know no matter how lazy, I need to get up and drive to a better restaurant. 
Sorry, I usually don't complain. But this was just a terrible experience and a complete waste of way too much money. Pissed.
Food is too bland... Waste of money... Even the tikka masala curry is bad... Not sure how they runny his place...

Best Indian I've had in the USA! 
The sauces (especially the Mali Kafta) were amaaaazing!!! Naan and rice (cumin seasoned) were delish too. The servers were attentive and so friendly. *we came for dinner but we hear lunch buffet is a hit!*
Terrific location. Very attentive wait staff that were on their game. We had multiple waiters check in actively. Food was very good as well.

Order my food to go... BEST CHICKEN CURRY!! My new favorite place. I love Indian food!! Glad this place is open!! I've been waiting to eat here. The ambiance is really nice as well. Look forward to trying their buffet!!

What can I say? This place is not what I was expecting. Taking my first step into the door I was in awh. Upon entrance my friend and I were greeted and shown to our table where our third party was waiting for us. The slightest details of this place were excellent; The booths were nice and comfortable, The ceiling lights: modern, The music sets the mood: calm and relaxing. 
The customer service was great; because the three of us we're foreign to Indian Cuisine we had many question on what we were eating. The staff was very knowledgeable and able to answer our every question. 

The food? It was delicious!! No complaints on my end. The Butter Chicken was very well rounded. Nice and creamy curry, soft and moist chicken; put that on top of rice and you get a wombo combo! The complimentary Papadum was something else: the bread was nice and crispy, add one of the two sauces that came on the side and you get a sweet taste (black sauce) or a earthy savory taste (green sauce). We also ordered the Sev Puri which was a whole mouth full of flavor. The house made cracker was nice and crispy topped off with what seemed to be a jumbled yet organized mess of toppings and you get a nice high note of sour and spicy and a slight saltiness. The visual representation and organization of these dish depicts what hard work the chef puts into the food before it is delivered to the customers table.

Overall I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking forward to experience new flavors. Great staff. Great food. You can't ask for anything more except for food.

This is the best Indian Buffet in Las Vegas.  Great selection, clean and nice open atmosphere.  Price is right and their Garlic Naan is great.  It seems to be staffed well as you won't be waiting for dishes to get refilled.  Excellent

I rarely eat Indian food, so I took an opportunity to come here for dinner while my kitchen was out of order and I had some shopping to do nearby. Some friends recommended this place, but didn't give any specifics on what to order. I tried the Delhi vegetarian thali- a sampler of curry dishes served with naan, rice, and samosas. Everything was good- and the presentation was quite nice. My favorites were the malai kofta and dal makhani. I also ordered the mango chutney, but didn't love it. The Thali says for one person only, but I left very full without touching the rice. The staff checked up on me often- maybe because business was slow. I would come back, maybe to try some new things or to check out the lunch buffet.
